title: Data Science Instructor
description: [  THIS ROLE HAS THREE COMPONENTS TO IT  Expert knowledge/experience with Data Science, you are the Guru in Data Science A passion/experience in teaching, especially to students that may be coming from all kinds of background   If you love data science and want to execute your knowledge among others with the opportunity to make this your own and be in charge of expansion this is the role for you!   RESPONSIBILITIES  Deliver instruction on data science, data analytics, machine learning, Python, SQL, statistics, probability and data engineering Facilitate group discussions, demos and in-class activities Follow industry trends in big data, deep learning, machine learning and AI Play a hands-on role in curriculum development, use what you learn from working with students to make the curriculum world class Gather and report on student metrics Work alongside Coding Dojo’s Online Instruction team to deliver remote training Participate in professional training, so you stay fresh!    EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS  You must have proficient data science and machine learning experience. Please ensure you meet or exceed the following: Professional experience as a data scientist Expertise in Python, Python libraries, SQL, statistics, mathematics, machine learning, data visualization tools and all of the data science topics that we teach Teaching and leading teams experience a big plus   If you have Data Science and/or instruction experience and are looking for a new and exciting milestone in your career, this position is a rare opportunity to join a rapidly growing company and make a positive impact in many people's lives.   Coding Dojo offers a competitive salary and standard benefits   Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Education Training Engineering  Industries Professional Training & Coaching Computer Software  ]
description_raw:
[

THIS ROLE HAS THREE COMPONENTS TO IT

  1. Expert knowledge/experience with Data Science, you are the Guru in Data Science
  2. A passion/experience in teaching, especially to students that may be coming from all kinds of background


If you love data science and want to execute your knowledge among others with the opportunity to make this your own and be in charge of expansion this is the role for you!


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Deliver instruction on data science, data analytics, machine learning, Python, SQL, statistics, probability and data engineering
  • Facilitate group discussions, demos and in-class activities
  • Follow industry trends in big data, deep learning, machine learning and AI
  • Play a hands-on role in curriculum development, use what you learn from working with students to make the curriculum world class
  • Gather and report on student metrics
  • Work alongside Coding Dojo’s Online Instruction team to deliver remote training
  • Participate in professional training, so you stay fresh!


EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • You must have proficient data science and machine learning experience. Please ensure you meet or exceed the following:
  • Professional experience as a data scientist
  • Expertise in Python, Python libraries, SQL, statistics, mathematics, machine learning, data visualization tools and all of the data science topics that we teach
  • Teaching and leading teams experience a big plus


If you have Data Science and/or instruction experience and are looking for a new and exciting milestone in your career, this position is a rare opportunity to join a rapidly growing company and make a positive impact in many people's lives.


Coding Dojo offers a competitive salary and standard benefits

  • Seniority level

    Mid-Senior level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EducationTrainingEngineering

  • Industries

    Professional Training & CoachingComputer Software
]

title: Senior Manager, Data Science - Shipper Experience
description: [  Who We Are  Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward! Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.  Who We’re Looking For  Economists, Analysts, and Data Scientists are at the core of Convoy’s platform. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. We also forecast business metrics, evaluate the causal impact of business decisions, design experiments to optimize our product, and leverage our data to generate insights for our customers. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, causal inference, experimental design, econometrics, and prediction domains. We have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace. As we scale our data teams, we need experienced managers and technical leaders to mentor and develop our talent. We also need thought leaders with a vision for leveraging data science to optimize every aspect of our business. We are looking for player-coaches who can transition effortlessly between owning their projects end-to-end and team management. At Convoy, we are a highly aligned team that operates in a fast-paced environment and pivots where needed to focus on what matters most. You will work with high signal-to-noise data to power your deep dive research, modeling, and experimentation projects. If you are interested in joining a company that is integrating economic insights and data science into the core of its business, while leveraging technology to drive efficiencies in a critical sector of the economy, let’s talk.  In This Role, You Will Do The Following   Partner Deeply with PMs to help them understand their key drivers. Develop and Deploy Metrics A/B Testing Be a key voice and advocate for data-driven decision making Recruit, Retain, Develop, and Motivate our talent Build a diverse and empowered analytics culture Be in the trenches, doing the dirty work, alongside your direct reports Create and maintain systems to elevate best practices and walk the walk in your own contributions.    You Have The Following Skills & Experience   BS or Advanced Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, a natural science or equivalent quantitative subject  10+ years of experience leveraging quantitative analysis, analytics, and data science to solve business problems 5+ years of experience managing data scientists/analysts/economists Experience with scientific/statistical languages such as R or Python Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity Excellent presenter, influencer, and writer You are a leader and will speak up where needed You have a habit of bias-to-action    Bonus Skills/ Experience   Experience with two-sided markets (platforms) and other economic theory Experience in bidding and pricing (e.g., quant experience) Experience in Data Visualization with Tableau or similar software    Benefits Of Working At Convoy    Health & Wellness: Taking care of your health comes first. Convoy covers 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums, and 85% for your family. We also provide access to the gym and showers in our building.  In-Office Happiness: Enjoy catered meals multiple times through the week, and fully stocked fridges and pantries to keep you running full.  Commuter Benefits: We transport the world; the least we can do is help get you to work. Every employee receives a fully paid Orca Card to get you around on the bus, light rail, or water taxi. We also provide locked bike storage if you prefer to pedal in.  Time Off: Life outside of work matters! Convoy has a flexible vacation policy, so take the time off you need- we don’t track vacation or sick time. We also offer generous parental leave for those expecting new additions to their family.  Compensation: We offer market competitive compensation, including stock options and a 401k plan to help save for retirement.   Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!  Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Research Information Technology Engineering  Industries Computer Software Internet Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Who We Are

Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward!

Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

Who We’re Looking For

Economists, Analysts, and Data Scientists are at the core of Convoy’s platform. We build the models that power freight pricing, shipment offer relevance, auction bidding strategy, and other core services. We also forecast business metrics, evaluate the causal impact of business decisions, design experiments to optimize our product, and leverage our data to generate insights for our customers. The breadth of the problems space is huge, spanning machine learning, optimization, causal inference, experimental design, econometrics, and prediction domains. We have only begun to dig into the difficult and diverse problems in our two-sided marketplace.

As we scale our data teams, we need experienced managers and technical leaders to mentor and develop our talent. We also need thought leaders with a vision for leveraging data science to optimize every aspect of our business. We are looking for player-coaches who can transition effortlessly between owning their projects end-to-end and team management.

At Convoy, we are a highly aligned team that operates in a fast-paced environment and pivots where needed to focus on what matters most. You will work with high signal-to-noise data to power your deep dive research, modeling, and experimentation projects. If you are interested in joining a company that is integrating economic insights and data science into the core of its business, while leveraging technology to drive efficiencies in a critical sector of the economy, let’s talk.

In This Role, You Will Do The Following
    • Partner Deeply with PMs to help them understand their key drivers.
    • Develop and Deploy Metrics
    • A/B Testing
    • Be a key voice and advocate for data-driven decision making
    • Recruit, Retain, Develop, and Motivate our talent
    • Build a diverse and empowered analytics culture
    • Be in the trenches, doing the dirty work, alongside your direct reports
    • Create and maintain systems to elevate best practices and walk the walk in your own contributions.

You Have The Following Skills & Experience
    • BS or Advanced Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, a natural science or equivalent quantitative subject
    • 10+ years of experience leveraging quantitative analysis, analytics, and data science to solve business problems
    • 5+ years of experience managing data scientists/analysts/economists
    • Experience with scientific/statistical languages such as R or Python
    • Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity
    • Excellent presenter, influencer, and writer
    • You are a leader and will speak up where needed
    • You have a habit of bias-to-action

Bonus Skills/ Experience
    • Experience with two-sided markets (platforms) and other economic theory
    • Experience in bidding and pricing (e.g., quant experience)
    • Experience in Data Visualization with Tableau or similar software

Benefits Of Working At Convoy
    • Health & Wellness: Taking care of your health comes first. Convoy covers 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums, and 85% for your family. We also provide access to the gym and showers in our building.
    • In-Office Happiness: Enjoy catered meals multiple times through the week, and fully stocked fridges and pantries to keep you running full.
    • Commuter Benefits: We transport the world; the least we can do is help get you to work. Every employee receives a fully paid Orca Card to get you around on the bus, light rail, or water taxi. We also provide locked bike storage if you prefer to pedal in.
    • Time Off: Life outside of work matters! Convoy has a flexible vacation policy, so take the time off you need- we don’t track vacation or sick time. We also offer generous parental leave for those expecting new additions to their family.
    • Compensation: We offer market competitive compensation, including stock options and a 401k plan to help save for retirement.

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

  • Seniority level

    Mid-Senior level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    ResearchInformation TechnologyEngineering

  • Industries

    Computer SoftwareInternetFinancial Services
]

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: [  At Credit Sesame, we believe every person should feel creditworthy. That’s why empowering members to own their credit is our number one mission. Since 2009, we’ve been helping millions of members improve their credit scores, lower the cost of their credit, and save money. When you join Credit Sesame, you become part of a team devoted to helping people take charge of their credit so they can live better lives.   We’re looking for Senior Data Analyst who can help lead business intelligence efforts and grow our Analytics team by generating data-driven insights to inform our primary business strategies. If you have a curious nature and want to use the power of data to help millions improve their credit wellness, then this opportunity is for you!   You’ll...  mine data from large SQL databases; build models that lead to better insights and understanding of the business; design and improve reports and dashboards to track Credit Sesame’s goals; assure data quality and data integrity for revenue and business development; partner with data source owners to develop project plans; produce creative insights beyond the scope of supporting reactive requests; mentor team members; report to the Vice President of Data Science and Analytics.    You’re a great fit for our team because…  you’re accomplished in statistics, econometrics, and data science, and you have the experience and education to back it up; you have a command of machine learning techniques and tools (K-means, Naïve Bayes, SVM, etc.), and you’re familiar with lifting model performance to get world-class results; you’re comfortable analyzing large datasets and interpreting data flow diagrams; you can use Python and R to analyze and solve thorny problems; you know how to produce SQL queries, and you have enough mastery to design useful databases; you have the perseverance and passion to uncover meaningful insights; you’re excited about the potential FinTech has to change the traditional delivery of finance services; you have a Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent; you have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field of study (preferred); you have an e-commerce or technology background (preferred).    You’ll love it here because…  you‘ll have huge potential to grow with a company that’s a category leader; you’ll have equity in a pre-IPO company backed by top VCs; we offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance with many plan options; we have team meals catered twice a week; you can stay on top of your fitness goals with our on-site fitness centers and a monthly fitness reimbursement; you can fuel up at our stocked kitchens with endless snacks and drinks; we value EQ over IQ and prioritize work-life balance (read more about Credit Sesame’s Key Values here: https://www.keyvalues.com/credit-sesame)    ﻿Office Location  You could work out of our San Francisco or our Mountain View office—you decide!   Our San Francisco office is 1 block from the Montgomery Street BART station and within walking distance of world-famous restaurants and attractions such as the Ferry Building, Union Square, and North Beach.   Our Mountain View office is located within walking distance of the Caltrain station and in the heart of downtown Mountain View with great cafes, restaurants, and shops.    We’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.    Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Analyst  Industries Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[

At Credit Sesame, we believe every person should feel creditworthy. That’s why empowering members to own their credit is our number one mission. Since 2009, we’ve been helping millions of members improve their credit scores, lower the cost of their credit, and save money. When you join Credit Sesame, you become part of a team devoted to helping people take charge of their credit so they can live better lives.


We’re looking for Senior Data Analyst who can help lead business intelligence efforts and grow our Analytics team by generating data-driven insights to inform our primary business strategies. If you have a curious nature and want to use the power of data to help millions improve their credit wellness, then this opportunity is for you!


You’ll...

  • mine data from large SQL databases;
  • build models that lead to better insights and understanding of the business;
  • design and improve reports and dashboards to track Credit Sesame’s goals;
  • assure data quality and data integrity for revenue and business development;
  • partner with data source owners to develop project plans;
  • produce creative insights beyond the scope of supporting reactive requests;
  • mentor team members;
  • report to the Vice President of Data Science and Analytics.


You’re a great fit for our team because…

  • you’re accomplished in statistics, econometrics, and data science, and you have the experience and education to back it up;
  • you have a command of machine learning techniques and tools (K-means, Naïve Bayes, SVM, etc.), and you’re familiar with lifting model performance to get world-class results;
  • you’re comfortable analyzing large datasets and interpreting data flow diagrams;
  • you can use Python and R to analyze and solve thorny problems;
  • you know how to produce SQL queries, and you have enough mastery to design useful databases;
  • you have the perseverance and passion to uncover meaningful insights;
  • you’re excited about the potential FinTech has to change the traditional delivery of finance services;
  • you have a Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent;
  • you have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field of study (preferred);
  • you have an e-commerce or technology background (preferred).


You’ll love it here because…

  • you‘ll have huge potential to grow with a company that’s a category leader;
  • you’ll have equity in a pre-IPO company backed by top VCs;
  • we offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance with many plan options;
  • we have team meals catered twice a week;
  • you can stay on top of your fitness goals with our on-site fitness centers and a monthly fitness reimbursement;
  • you can fuel up at our stocked kitchens with endless snacks and drinks;
  • we value EQ over IQ and prioritize work-life balance (read more about Credit Sesame’s Key Values here: https://www.keyvalues.com/credit-sesame)


﻿Office Location

You could work out of our San Francisco or our Mountain View office—you decide!


Our San Francisco office is 1 block from the Montgomery Street BART station and within walking distance of world-famous restaurants and attractions such as the Ferry Building, Union Square, and North Beach.


Our Mountain View office is located within walking distance of the Caltrain station and in the heart of downtown Mountain View with great cafes, restaurants, and shops.


We’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

  • Seniority level

    Mid-Senior level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Analyst

  • Industries

    Financial Services
]

title: Financial Data Analyst -Sterling
description: [ Creoal Consulting has an opportunity for a Financial Analyst who will aid in the ongoing assessment of our systems. The analysis will drive further developments and capabilities. We are looking for someone with a genuine passion for learning new technologies & applications, a desire for continual growth and troubleshooting skills to be a part of our dynamic and close team. D uties and Responsibilities: Obtain, join, scrub, explore, model, and interpret large datasets Transform and manipulate the large dataset to suit the desired analysis Create and present clear oral and written reports on the findings Become an expert on name and entity matching. Required Qualifications: BS Degree in a related technical field (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, etc.) Experience working with SQL, data-mining or statistical software Experience performing data analysis and interpreting results Experience using two of the following for data analysis: Java, R, Python, Matlab, or SQL Experience with analyzing financial data Experience extracting and converting raw data into actionable intelligence products Conceptual understanding of and/or prior experiences related to data profiling, fuzzy matching, entity resolution, and signal detection theory Desired Qualifications: Technical exploitation experience, such as computer forensics, DOCEX DOMEX Experience working in the field of entity resolution, analytics, data mining or name matching. Knowledge or experience with data wrangling, cleansing, and analytics Java programming experience is a plus Experience working with Customs or ICE travel-related data. Clearance Must pass CBP BI. Citizenship is required What we offer We are offering a challenging and interesting opportunity with extensive responsibilities in a dynamic and fast-growing company. Benefits include a generous 401(k) plan, health care, tax-free transit and more! About us: Creoal Consulting is a leading-edge provider for full life cycle information technology and ERP support services to the Public Sector with deep application product and market expertise. We are a small business incorporated in the State of Maryland in 2005 and founded with a single objective to support the implementation, transition and support of ERP and Custom Applications in the Public Sector marketplace. The company s principals and key staff possess rich experience and deep skills with Oracle products and most have been singularly focused in their deployment for well over a decade. Creoal Consulting LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. - provided by Dice          Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Management Consulting  ]

[
If you are a Immunology or cancer biology Scientist with in-vivo murine model experience, please read on!

We are a well funded biotech firm working in the genome engineering field based in Menlo Park, CA. Our Co-Founder is world-renowned for his work and is leading the company in advance research methodologies to help make a huge difference in mankind's well being.

Our company prides ourselves in providing a collaborative, creative, innovative, focused, and dedicated work place. The team is made up of brilliant minds who are all working toward the same goal. We are looking to expand our brain trust by adding a Research Associate to our team.

Apply today and join our team of scientists looking to revolutionize the biotech world through techniques in Immunotherapy.

What You Will Be Doing
  • Culture/Characterize CAR T-Cells
  • Complete in vitro functional assays with human T cells
  • Designing and executing murine models/experiments to evaluate CAR T cell functions in vivo
  • Utilize viral-based strategies for CAR T-cell genetic modification
What You Need for this Position
  • PhD degree in Immunology/Cancer Biology, or related field with at least 1 year of relevant experience
  • Proficiency in Multi-color Flow Cytometry
  • Excellent mammalian cell/tissue culture technique
  • In Vitro T-Cell based assay experience
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Proficient and independent in Data Analysis
(HUGE PLUS)
  • Lentivirus production experience
  • Lentiviral gene delivery
  • Proficiency in flow cytometry data analysis software (Flowjo, kaluza, or Prism)

Millions of dollars are allotted each year to various teams throughout our facility, employing thousands of researchers. Our main goal is to provide exceptional healthcare to patients in the most time efficient manner possible. Apply today to be considered for working one of the best, world-renown research organizations that are contributing towards the goal of helping lives across the world. [
If you are a Data Analyst with a minimum of 3-5 years of healthcare IT experience, please read on!

We are a world-renown medical facility located in Boston, Massachusetts. As one of the largest research-based medical facilities in the world, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional care to our patients, and work diligently to tackle the worlds leading medical diseases that have yet to find a cure. Millions of dollars are allotted each year to various teams throughout our facility, employing thousands of researchers. Our main goal is to provide exceptional healthcare to patients in the most time efficient manner possible.

Apply today to be considered for working one of the best, world-renown research organizations that are contributing towards the goal of helping lives across the world.

-This position requires days on-site at both main facility and sister facility, so traveling back and forth is required-
  • Obtain data from hospital staff through interviews, workshops, document analysis, site visits, data and workflow analysis
  • Understand data and end user workflow in order to validate accurate results and fix discrepancies when necessary

  • Running small to medium projects to keep project timelines on track

What You Need for this Position
  • Bachelors degree in Management, Information systems, statistics or relevant field
  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience in Healthcare IT or hospital setting
  • Working knowledge of SQL and other business intelligence tools (Tableau, Business objects, SAS BI)
  • Strong working knowledge of Epic data and workflows

title: Senior Vice President, Environmental Research -Arlington
description: [ Leads strategy and oversight of environmental science and research program. Provides strategic counsel, from an environmental perspective -- including food systems, for the Global Sustainable Nutrition Affairs & Research (GSNAR), and Innovation Center’s Sustainable Nutrition and Environmental Stewardship Committees. Provides technical expertise and interpretation of science to Dairy Management Inc. (DMI), National Dairy Council (NDC), the Innovation Center for U.S. Dairy, and close collaborators (i.e. National Milk Producers Federation (NMPF) and Newtrient LLC) on environmental and sustainable food systems research. Integrates within the GSNAR team members and appropriate Innovation Center committees. Serves as an internal and external resource on environmental sustainability reporting and food systems science issues. The position requires an executive/scientific professional who: (1) can be a strong external communicator and translator of the environmental science on behalf of US Dairy Farmers; and (2) has a desire and commitment to lead and develop a team of scientists. This individual will be a self-starter who establishes and cultivates key environmental science partnerships and leads the Dairy sector’s strategy for environmental technology adoption and measurement. The position will also be responsible for driving attention and focus to environmental science, technology, and data as means to elevate Dairy’s position as a key player in a global, sustainable food system. Key Accountabilities: Oversees the execution of the environmental research program that supports business imperatives and creates value for the U.S. dairy industry. Identifies environmental reporting and food system issues and develops opportunities for new positioning of ecosystem services provided by dairy farming; serves as an expert scientist internally and externally. Collaborates with industry, government, and NGOs to facilitate and develop research that enables environmental sustainability reporting on behalf of the U.S. dairy industry nationally. Strategically identifying, establishing, and managing relationships with universities and other partners to drive best practices in environmental science, technology, and data to validate the effectiveness of the Dairy industry’s environmental efforts. Collaborating with the dairy processor sector to drive best practices in technology implementation and management Leading the development of a data collection, tracking, and reporting system for dairy processor measurement Directing environmental science research and assisting in the professional development of the research team members Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Strong technical background in environmental science area/sustainability Ability to manage and inspire a technical team of researchers Development of environmental research strategy Solid technical skills including research design, statistical analysis, and interpretation of environmental research. Strong proficiency with quantitative and technical analysis and/or modeling Excellent critical thinking skills and reasoning abilities; ability and tendency to question and evaluate methods, findings, and conclusions, including one’s own The ability to clearly communicate research and analysis, orally and in writing, to a wide range of audiences Thorough, disciplined, and well-documented research techniques Collegiality and the ability to work collaboratively with both internal and external colleagues Personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and the ability to manage time, priorities, and resources effectively A passion for interdisciplinary, objective research and analysis Education and Experience: PhD in environmental studies/sciences, economics, environmental/chemical engineering, agriculture or related field. Five to ten years’ experience in the analytics of environmental & food systems datasets, development and management of environmental research or a strong academic background with a proven track record in environmental research and/or food systems analytics. 5+ years’ proven work experience managing a team of three or more people. Competitive benefits, generous 401(k), and collaborative culture. Dairy Management Inc. ™ (DMI) is funded by America’s 37,000-plus dairy farmers, as well as dairy importers. Created to help increase sales and demand for dairy products, DMI and its related organizations work to increase demand for dairy through research, education and innovation, and to maintain confidence in dairy foods, farms and businesses. DMI manages National Dairy Council and the American Dairy Association, and founded the U.S. Dairy Export Council and the Innovation Center for U.S. Dairy. DMI works with state and regional promotion organizations to implement these programs across the country. We regret it is not possible to communicate with candidates except those who most closely match our requirements. Thank you. Dairy Management Inc.™ is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, gender, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Seniority level Executive  Employment type Full-time  Job function Research Analyst Information Technology  Industries Nonprofit Organization Management Research Food Production  ]

The position requires an executive/scientific professional who: (1) can be a strong external communicator and translator of the environmental science on behalf of US Dairy Farmers; and (2) has a desire and commitment to lead and develop a team of scientists. This individual will be a self-starter who establishes and cultivates key environmental science partnerships and leads the Dairy sector’s strategy for environmental technology adoption and measurement. The position will also be responsible for driving attention and focus to environmental science, technology, and data as means to elevate Dairy’s position as a key player in a global, sustainable food system. Key Accountabilities: Oversees the execution of the environmental research program that supports business imperatives and creates value for the U.S. dairy industry. Identifies environmental reporting and food system issues and develops opportunities for new positioning of ecosystem services provided by dairy farming; serves as an expert scientist internally and externally. Collaborates with industry, government, and NGOs to facilitate and develop research that enables environmental sustainability reporting on behalf of the U.S. dairy industry nationally. Strategically identifying, establishing, and managing relationships with universities and other partners to drive best practices in environmental science, technology, and data to validate the effectiveness of the Dairy industry’s environmental efforts. Collaborating with the dairy processor sector to drive best practices in technology implementation and management Leading the development of a data collection, tracking, and reporting system for dairy processor measurement Directing environmental science research and assisting in the professional development of the research team members Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Strong technical background in environmental science area/sustainability Ability to manage and inspire a technical team of researchers Development of environmental research strategy Solid technical skills including research design, statistical analysis, and interpretation of environmental research. Strong proficiency with quantitative and technical analysis and/or modeling Excellent critical thinking skills and reasoning abilities; ability and tendency to question and evaluate methods, findings, and conclusions, including one’s own The ability to clearly communicate research and analysis, orally and in writing, to a wide range of audiences Thorough, disciplined, and well-documented research techniques Collegiality and the ability to work collaboratively with both internal and external colleagues Personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and the ability to manage time, priorities, and resources effectively A passion for interdisciplinary, objective research and analysis Education and Experience: PhD in environmental studies/sciences, economics, environmental/chemical engineering, agriculture or related field. Five to ten years’ experience in the analytics of environmental & food systems datasets, development and management of environmental research or a strong academic background with a proven track record in environmental research and/or food systems analytics. 5+ years’ proven work experience managing a team of three or more people. Competitive benefits, generous 401(k), and collaborative culture. Dairy Management Inc. ™ (DMI) is funded by America’s 37,000-plus dairy farmers, as well as dairy importers. Created to help increase sales and demand for dairy products, DMI and its related organizations work to increase demand for dairy through research, education and innovation, and to maintain confidence in dairy foods, farms and businesses. DMI manages National Dairy Council and the American Dairy Association, and founded the U.S. Dairy Export Council and the Innovation Center for U.S. Dairy. DMI works with state and regional promotion organizations to implement these programs across the country. We regret it is not possible to communicate with candidates except those who most closely match our requirements. Thank you. Dairy Management Inc.™ is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, gender, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

    Executive

]

title: Data Analyst
description: [ Duration: Permanent Location: Downtown Toronto, 240 King Street East Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable retailers and financial services companies make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our proprietary platform can simulate potential outcomes to optimize decisions that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy works with retailers in improving their merchandising planning and promotions decisions and with financial institutions in improving their risk management. Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth  The Impact You Will Have  Do you see yourself as both analytical and business forward? In this role you will play a key role in Daisy’s analytical success and drive the client relationship processes. You will be responsible for educating the new clients on data requirements of our products and solutions while establishing rapport with both technical and business client teams. And how about helping clients understand their own data? You’ll be their problem solver creating informative presentations that will show opportunity for new ideas and explain change!  What You’ll Do   Educate new clients on data requirements of the products and solution Establish a rapport with new clients, work very closely with both technical and business clients to gain an understanding of their data and processes Conduct in-depth data analysis and profiling of client data Conduct statistical, data validation and quality, assessments Develop client-facing presentations and work with client to resolve data questions and issues.  Build automated solutions to aid in data on-boarding and integration Create data-related technical documentation  Develop appropriate data mappings to implement business logic into detailed technical ETL specs  Work collaboratively with ETL development roles to establish an efficient and effective data transformation    You Ideally Bring   Successful candidates will have a balance of functional (Business) and technical expertise Experience in a client-facing, SaaS implementation environment  Knowledge of data warehouse concepts, processes, and ETL development methodologies Understanding of dimensional data models Understanding of ETL pipelines using SQL, Python, Hive, and Spark Operational experience in a multi-platform environment (Linux, Windows) Good knowledge of Hadoop and RDBMS (DB2 preferred) Proven data analysis and manipulation skills, as well as experience in big data Extensive experience with SQL preferably in a DB2 and Hadoop environment  Demonstrated proficiency in the use of shell scripting (Linux Bash, Python, etc.) Knowledge of retail and/or insurance data is a plus Proficiency in MS Excel importing and exporting data, creating pivot tables, and VLOOKUPs Bachelor’s degree from a college or university is required, a Computer Science degree is nice to have.  Willingness to question the validity, accuracy of data and assumptions while remaining sensitive to clients' needs. Ability to develop warm client relationships Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills  Adept communicator with the ability to translate difficult concepts into layman’s terms and act as the interpreter between technical and non-technical implementation stakeholders Why Daisy Intelligence? Picture yourself building a successful career at Daisy Intelligence —working alongside other talented, driven individuals to deliver artificial intelligence solutions that are not out of reach for any organization. Daisy Intelligence transforms massive quantities of consumer data into profitable decisions. Our proprietary mathematical solutions simulate all the possible business scenarios that set our clients on the optimal path to grow their bottom line. You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture: one that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. We are the future of analytics. Perks Annual performance bonus Group health benefits Vacation allowance Skills development Flexibility Start-up culture Stock Options All day healthy snacks and drinks Team events All candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada. Daisy is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Duration: Permanent

Location: Downtown Toronto, 240 King Street East

Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable retailers and financial services companies make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our proprietary platform can simulate potential outcomes to optimize decisions that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy works with retailers in improving their merchandising planning and promotions decisions and with financial institutions in improving their risk management. Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth

The Impact You Will Have

Do you see yourself as both analytical and business forward? In this role you will play a key role in Daisy’s analytical success and drive the client relationship processes. You will be responsible for educating the new clients on data requirements of our products and solutions while establishing rapport with both technical and business client teams. And how about helping clients understand their own data? You’ll be their problem solver creating informative presentations that will show opportunity for new ideas and explain change!

What You’ll Do
  • Educate new clients on data requirements of the products and solution
  • Establish a rapport with new clients, work very closely with both technical and business clients to gain an understanding of their data and processes
  • Conduct in-depth data analysis and profiling of client data
  • Conduct statistical, data validation and quality, assessments
  • Develop client-facing presentations and work with client to resolve data questions and issues.
  • Build automated solutions to aid in data on-boarding and integration
  • Create data-related technical documentation
  • Develop appropriate data mappings to implement business logic into detailed technical ETL specs
  • Work collaboratively with ETL development roles to establish an efficient and effective data transformation

You Ideally Bring
  • Successful candidates will have a balance of functional (Business) and technical expertise
  • Experience in a client-facing, SaaS implementation environment
  • Knowledge of data warehouse concepts, processes, and ETL development methodologies
  • Understanding of dimensional data models
  • Understanding of ETL pipelines using SQL, Python, Hive, and Spark
  • Operational experience in a multi-platform environment (Linux, Windows)
  • Good knowledge of Hadoop and RDBMS (DB2 preferred)
  • Proven data analysis and manipulation skills, as well as experience in big data
  • Extensive experience with SQL preferably in a DB2 and Hadoop environment
  • Demonstrated proficiency in the use of shell scripting (Linux Bash, Python, etc.)
  • Knowledge of retail and/or insurance data is a plus
  • Proficiency in MS Excel importing and exporting data, creating pivot tables, and VLOOKUPs
  • Bachelor’s degree from a college or university is required, a Computer Science degree is nice to have.
  • Willingness to question the validity, accuracy of data and assumptions while remaining sensitive to clients' needs. Ability to develop warm client relationships
  • Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Adept communicator with the ability to translate difficult concepts into layman’s terms and act as the interpreter between technical and non-technical implementation stakeholders
Why Daisy Intelligence?

Picture yourself building a successful career at Daisy Intelligence —working alongside other talented, driven individuals to deliver artificial intelligence solutions that are not out of reach for any organization. Daisy Intelligence transforms massive quantities of consumer data into profitable decisions. Our proprietary mathematical solutions simulate all the possible business scenarios that set our clients on the optimal path to grow their bottom line.

You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture: one that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. We are the future of analytics.

Perks

Annual performance bonus

Group health benefits

Vacation allowance

Skills development

Flexibility

Start-up culture

Stock Options

All day healthy snacks and drinks

Team events

All candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada. Daisy is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and Services
]

title: Data Science SME-Life Sciences Lead
description: [  If you consider yourself an expert on the life sciences industry and in Data Science and are excited about the potential of automated machine learning to drive significant improvements in outcomes, cost savings, and bottom-line impact, then you may be the ideal Data Science SME-life sciences Lead to join our rapidly growing DataRobot team.   We’re looking for a self-motivated Data Science SME-life sciences candidate who has strong fundamentals of applied data science in the life sciences setting, and enjoys communicating and evangelizing life sciences data science solutions to internal and external business stakeholders. Location can be D.C., Philadelphia, New York, New Jersey or remote (US).   Roles and responsibilities :     Create assets (demo datasets, demo scripts, slides, blog posts, whitepapers, etc.) demonstrating the value of DataRobot platform for specific use cases in life sciences     Leverage industry data, partner data, and developing new datasets with partners or customers     Create technical content to enable customer facing data scientists to better support our life sciences customers     and assist the GM of life sciences with other content pieces as needed (webinars, ebook, case studies).     Help prepare CFDSs and AEs to do effective presentation to life sciences prospects     Assist CFDSs in effective demo's for life sciences prospects including data, scripts, value props.      Help win accounts in the life sciences industry (Pharma).     Assist where needed in initial POC Engagements (life sciences companies) and customer projects     Be able to educate executives on the strategic value propositions of DataRobot in the life sciences Industry      Product Development     Participate in Product Development/Solutions Development Discussions when needed     Track DataRobot product adoption and usage by life sciences customers in conjunction with life sciences Industry GM; identify issues that may be impeding adoption and escalate internally to the appropriate organization for follow-up/action.     Providing the customer’s point of view to DataRobot’s Product team, informing the direction of future product feature development      Events participation in the area of life sciences     Participate in conferences and marketing events in the area of life sciences as needed.     Assisting the GM of life sciences and the marketing department in events selection and planning for the year      Leadership     Understanding and empathizing with customers’ pain points of building AI solutions     Collaborating with Sales, Customer facing data scientists, Field Engineers, and the rest of the DataRobot team to ensure that our life sciences DataRobot users needs are being met.      Main Requirements:     1-2+ years of real-world experience in a data science role     2-4+ years of analytics experience in the life sciences industry (pharma or biotech).     Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models using machine learning algorithms     Deep experience in life sciences     Strong customer interaction experience     Excellent organizational, communication, writing and interpersonal skills     Familiarity with a variety of technical tools for the manipulation of datasets     Fluency with scripting (Python / R)     Understanding of the data types and software systems in life sciences (ie. real world data)     Up to 20% travel     Desired Skills:     Experience working with an enterprise customer base and salesforce     Great people networking skills – you built a trusted network at your current/previous company to help get stuff done quickly     Familiarity with Spark or Hadoop or AWS and related Big Data technologies     Experience dealing with complex customer organizations    Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
If you consider yourself an expert on the life sciences industry and in Data Science and are excited about the potential of automated machine learning to drive significant improvements in outcomes, cost savings, and bottom-line impact, then you may be the ideal Data Science SME-life sciences Lead to join our rapidly growing DataRobot team. We’re looking for a self-motivated Data Science SME-life sciences candidate who has strong fundamentals of applied data science in the life sciences setting, and enjoys communicating and evangelizing life sciences data science solutions to internal and external business stakeholders. Location can be D.C., Philadelphia, New York, New Jersey or remote (US). Roles and responsibilities :
  • Create assets (demo datasets, demo scripts, slides, blog posts, whitepapers, etc.) demonstrating the value of DataRobot platform for specific use cases in life sciences
    • Leverage industry data, partner data, and developing new datasets with partners or customers
    • Create technical content to enable customer facing data scientists to better support our life sciences customers
    • and assist the GM of life sciences with other content pieces as needed (webinars, ebook, case studies).
    • Help prepare CFDSs and AEs to do effective presentation to life sciences prospects
    • Assist CFDSs in effective demo's for life sciences prospects including data, scripts, value props.
  • Help win accounts in the life sciences industry (Pharma).
    • Assist where needed in initial POC Engagements (life sciences companies) and customer projects
    • Be able to educate executives on the strategic value propositions of DataRobot in the life sciences Industry
  • Product Development
    • Participate in Product Development/Solutions Development Discussions when needed
    • Track DataRobot product adoption and usage by life sciences customers in conjunction with life sciences Industry GM; identify issues that may be impeding adoption and escalate internally to the appropriate organization for follow-up/action.
    • Providing the customer’s point of view to DataRobot’s Product team, informing the direction of future product feature development
  • Events participation in the area of life sciences
    • Participate in conferences and marketing events in the area of life sciences as needed.
    • Assisting the GM of life sciences and the marketing department in events selection and planning for the year
  • Leadership
    • Understanding and empathizing with customers’ pain points of building AI solutions
    • Collaborating with Sales, Customer facing data scientists, Field Engineers, and the rest of the DataRobot team to ensure that our life sciences DataRobot users needs are being met.
Main Requirements:
  • 1-2+ years of real-world experience in a data science role
  • 2-4+ years of analytics experience in the life sciences industry (pharma or biotech).
  • Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models using machine learning algorithms
  • Deep experience in life sciences
  • Strong customer interaction experience
  • Excellent organizational, communication, writing and interpersonal skills
  • Familiarity with a variety of technical tools for the manipulation of datasets
  • Fluency with scripting (Python / R)
  • Understanding of the data types and software systems in life sciences (ie. real world data)
  • Up to 20% travel
Desired Skills:
  • Experience working with an enterprise customer base and salesforce
  • Great people networking skills – you built a trusted network at your current/previous company to help get stuff done quickly
  • Familiarity with Spark or Hadoop or AWS and related Big Data technologies
  • Experience dealing with complex customer organizations

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareInternet
]

title: Aircraft Maintenance Data Analyst
company: De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Limited
description: [ De Havilland Aircraft of Canada is currently searching for a Aircraft Maintenance Data Analyst to join our team in Toronto. The Aircraft Maintenance Data Analyst is responsible for reviewing, prioritizing, analyzing and responding to all assigned queries related to reliability, maintenance costs, aircraft economics and other analyses of various maintenance & operational data. At De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Limited, our employees work together worldwide - one good idea at a time to ensure the continued long term success of the Dash 8-400 aircraft. If you have a good idea, we'll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.  WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?  Competitive salary Full extended health and benefit plan The opportunity to join an organization from the ground floor Great task diversity and unique challenges   What You Will Be Doing   Work closely with originators of queries (De Havilland-internal and external customers) to ensure all necessary data are obtained in order to meet customer's expectations with regards to timeline and quality.  Work independently and with Maintenance Programs and Procedures team members to support them and align in all Maintenance Engineering queries, reports, projects and assignments  Provide qualitative and timely reliability and cost data and analyses to key supporting functions in Customer Services and Support, Sales & Marketing, Procurement, Engineering and other De Havilland teams Analyze all maintenance cost data (repair station, heavy/line maintenance, non-routine, labour, etc), for trends, inconsistencies, and problem areas and initiate potential improvements. Maintain, update, expand and develop analytical tools and models.   What You Bring To The Table   You have a University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Engineering Physics with at least 3 years' experience in Industrial or Aerospace or College Diploma in Aviation Technology with at least 5 years' experience in Aerospace Industry.  You have strong analytical abilities and experience using statistics to resolve engineering problems  You have robust understanding of reliability and aircraft direct maintenance costs. Aircraft maintenance programs and planning concepts, methods and management is a definite asset  You have good knowledge of aircraft systems. Familiarity with with De Havilland aircraft Dash 8 Series 100, 200, 300 and 400 is a definite asset.  You are familiar and proficient with Microsoft Software products - especially Excel and Access. Familiarity with Oracle database is a definite asset   About Us  Longview Aviation Capital Corp. (LAC) was established in 2016 to manage a portfolio of long- term investments in the Canadian aerospace industry. At present, LAC includes and/or is associated with the assets of Viking Air Ltd., Pacific Sky Aviation Ltd, Longview Aviation Asset Management Inc., De Havilland Aircraft of Canada and Longview Aviation Services. With the addition of the Dash 8 Q Series, Longview holds the Type Certificates and entire product line of the original deHavilland aircraft company including the Twin Otter program and the DHC-1 through DHC-7 series, as well as the former Canadair CL-215, CL-215T, and CL-415 waterbomber aircraft. Longview has a workforce of approximately 1,800 full-time employees in manufacturing and service support in locations across Canada making it North America's largest commercial turboprop aircraft manufacturer. This is a unique opportunity to join an innovative team dedicated to achieving outstanding results. The team at De Havilland Aircraft of Canada thanks you for your application. To learn more about us visit us at https://dehavilland.com/en De Havilland is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, age, sex, colour, ethnic origin, ancestry, place of origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship, gender expression, marital status, family status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@dehavilland.com. DlFyi5O1UK  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing Aviation & Aerospace Airlines/Aviation  ]
description_raw:
[
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada is currently searching for a Aircraft Maintenance Data Analyst to join our team in Toronto.

The Aircraft Maintenance Data Analyst is responsible for reviewing, prioritizing, analyzing and responding to all assigned queries related to reliability, maintenance costs, aircraft economics and other analyses of various maintenance & operational data.

At De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Limited, our employees work together worldwide - one good idea at a time to ensure the continued long term success of the Dash 8-400 aircraft. If you have a good idea, we'll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
  • Competitive salary
  • Full extended health and benefit plan
  • The opportunity to join an organization from the ground floor
  • Great task diversity and unique challenges

What You Will Be Doing
  • Work closely with originators of queries (De Havilland-internal and external customers) to ensure all necessary data are obtained in order to meet customer's expectations with regards to timeline and quality.
  • Work independently and with Maintenance Programs and Procedures team members to support them and align in all Maintenance Engineering queries, reports, projects and assignments
  • Provide qualitative and timely reliability and cost data and analyses to key supporting functions in Customer Services and Support, Sales & Marketing, Procurement, Engineering and other De Havilland teams
  • Analyze all maintenance cost data (repair station, heavy/line maintenance, non-routine, labour, etc), for trends, inconsistencies, and problem areas and initiate potential improvements.
  • Maintain, update, expand and develop analytical tools and models.

What You Bring To The Table
  • You have a University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Engineering Physics with at least 3 years' experience in Industrial or Aerospace or College Diploma in Aviation Technology with at least 5 years' experience in Aerospace Industry.
  • You have strong analytical abilities and experience using statistics to resolve engineering problems
  • You have robust understanding of reliability and aircraft direct maintenance costs. Aircraft maintenance programs and planning concepts, methods and management is a definite asset
  • You have good knowledge of aircraft systems. Familiarity with with De Havilland aircraft Dash 8 Series 100, 200, 300 and 400 is a definite asset.
  • You are familiar and proficient with Microsoft Software products - especially Excel and Access. Familiarity with Oracle database is a definite asset

About Us

Longview Aviation Capital Corp. (LAC) was established in 2016 to manage a portfolio of long- term investments in the Canadian aerospace industry. At present, LAC includes and/or is associated with the assets of Viking Air Ltd., Pacific Sky Aviation Ltd, Longview Aviation Asset Management Inc., De Havilland Aircraft of Canada and Longview Aviation Services. With the addition of the Dash 8 Q Series, Longview holds the Type Certificates and entire product line of the original deHavilland aircraft company including the Twin Otter program and the DHC-1 through DHC-7 series, as well as the former Canadair CL-215, CL-215T, and CL-415 waterbomber aircraft. Longview has a workforce of approximately 1,800 full-time employees in manufacturing and service support in locations across Canada making it North America's largest commercial turboprop aircraft manufacturer.

This is a unique opportunity to join an innovative team dedicated to achieving outstanding results.

The team at De Havilland Aircraft of Canada thanks you for your application.

To learn more about us visit us at https://dehavilland.com/en

De Havilland is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to provide employment opportunities to all individuals, without regard to race, age, sex, colour, ethnic origin, ancestry, place of origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship, gender expression, marital status, family status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@dehavilland.com.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst
description: [  We’re reimagining sports and technology.  DraftKings is bringing sports fans closer to the games they love and becoming an essential part of their experience in the process. An industry pioneer since our founding in 2012, we believe we can continue to define what it means to be a technology company in sports entertainment. We love what we do and we think you will too.  Love data? We do too.  We’re looking for a Business Data Analyst to help us scale quickly through data-driven action. When you join our analytics team, you will play a vital role in solving problems across a wide range of business areas and you’ll see the impact of your personal work immediately. Sound good to you? Join us.  What you’ll do as a Senior Business Data Analyst:   Design A/B and multivariate tests on game operation strategy, evaluate test results, and translate insights into business actions.  Develop Tableau dashboards and visualizations on game performance, customer engagement to measure the impacts of various business actions. Perform deep dive insight analysis to understand user play patterns. Develop automated tools to enable business to explore operation insights and improve operation efficiency. Enhance customer segmentation models to implement model driven decision. Collaborate with internal and external resources including engineering, marketing and product team to ensure the analytics solution development.    What Skills You Will Use   3+ years of business analytics or data science experience, preferably at a gaming company. Experience with SQL Server, Tableau or Redshift Comfortable in fast paced, results driven environment Experienced in Design of Experiment including A/B and multivariate testing.  Bachelor degree in Statistic, MIS, Engineering, Business Analytics or a related field.    Preferred Skills   Master degree in Statistic, MIS, Engineering, Business Analytics or a related field. Knowledge of parallel computation tool such as Spark Knowledge of data science language such as Python, R, or PySpark Strong skills with advanced SQL (data modeling, store procedures, etc.) Knowledge of statistical methods (power analysis, linear/mixed model, clustering, trees), simulation and/or machine learning    Who are we a good fit for?  We love working with talented people but more than that, we seek out compassionate co-workers with a collaborative spirit. Our work moves quickly and we’re great at coming together to find creative solutions to some of tech’s most interesting problems. If that sounds good to you, join us.  Apply now  As a technology company at our core, DraftKings believes that the best innovation comes from diverse perspectives, thoughts, beliefs, ideas, and experiences. We consistently push boundaries and challenge the conventional to ensure our culture and products reflect the expectations of our employees, and the customers we serve. We’re proud to believe that your gender, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability should have nothing to do with our hiring practices. We’ll never discriminate against anyone’s background or creed. If you’re good at what you do, we want you to do it at DraftKings.  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Computer Software Sports  ]
description_raw:
[
We’re reimagining sports and technology.

DraftKings is bringing sports fans closer to the games they love and becoming an essential part of their experience in the process. An industry pioneer since our founding in 2012, we believe we can continue to define what it means to be a technology company in sports entertainment. We love what we do and we think you will too.

Love data? We do too.

We’re looking for a Business Data Analyst to help us scale quickly through data-driven action. When you join our analytics team, you will play a vital role in solving problems across a wide range of business areas and you’ll see the impact of your personal work immediately. Sound good to you? Join us.

What you’ll do as a Senior Business Data Analyst:
    • Design A/B and multivariate tests on game operation strategy, evaluate test results, and translate insights into business actions.
    • Develop Tableau dashboards and visualizations on game performance, customer engagement to measure the impacts of various business actions.
    • Perform deep dive insight analysis to understand user play patterns.
    • Develop automated tools to enable business to explore operation insights and improve operation efficiency.
    • Enhance customer segmentation models to implement model driven decision.
    • Collaborate with internal and external resources including engineering, marketing and product team to ensure the analytics solution development.

What Skills You Will Use
    • 3+ years of business analytics or data science experience, preferably at a gaming company.
    • Experience with SQL Server, Tableau or Redshift
    • Comfortable in fast paced, results driven environment
    • Experienced in Design of Experiment including A/B and multivariate testing.
    • Bachelor degree in Statistic, MIS, Engineering, Business Analytics or a related field.

Preferred Skills
    • Master degree in Statistic, MIS, Engineering, Business Analytics or a related field.
    • Knowledge of parallel computation tool such as Spark
    • Knowledge of data science language such as Python, R, or PySpark
    • Strong skills with advanced SQL (data modeling, store procedures, etc.)
    • Knowledge of statistical methods (power analysis, linear/mixed model, clustering, trees), simulation and/or machine learning

Who are we a good fit for?

We love working with talented people but more than that, we seek out compassionate co-workers with a collaborative spirit. Our work moves quickly and we’re great at coming together to find creative solutions to some of tech’s most interesting problems. If that sounds good to you, join us.

Apply now

As a technology company at our core, DraftKings believes that the best innovation comes from diverse perspectives, thoughts, beliefs, ideas, and experiences. We consistently push boundaries and challenge the conventional to ensure our culture and products reflect the expectations of our employees, and the customers we serve.

We’re proud to believe that your gender, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability should have nothing to do with our hiring practices. We’ll never discriminate against anyone’s background or creed. If you’re good at what you do, we want you to do it at DraftKings.

title: Data Governance/Data Quality Consultant- Remote Only- Deloitte -Boston
description: [ Experfy, a Harvard-incubated on-demand talent platform, is working with Deloitte to build an innovative Future of Work model in which elite consultants work remotely on short-term and long-term projects. Top experts who are selected to become part of Deloitte TalentCloud receive preferred access to contract opportunities that are focused on cutting-edge emerging technologies. We invite candidates to apply to become part of this prestigious community and take advantage of virtual work arrangements. Roles & Responsibilities: Design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable data pipelines with state-of-the-art monitoring and logging practices. Bring together large, complex and sparse data sets to meet functional and non-functional business requirements. Design and implement data tools for analytics and data scientist team members to help them in building, optimizing and tuning our product. Integrate new data management technologies and software engineering tools into existing structures. Help in building high-performance algorithms, prototypes, predictive models and proof of concepts. Technical Qualifications: 4+ years of relevant data management consulting or industry experience (master data, metadata, data architecture, data governance, data quality, data modeling) with experience in relevant tools such as: Informatica DQ, Collibra, Informatica AXON, etc. At least 1 full lifecycle data governance engagement experience including working with clients to formulate data governance organizations, help curate processes, policies, and standards, and operationalize the data governance organizations. 2+ years of experience leading and managing data delivery project teams through all phases of the project lifecycle from scoping and planning, requirements gathering, design, development testing, and go live. Bachelor s Degree or equivalent professional experience Preferred Skills: An advanced degree in the area of specialization Experience in information governance including but not limited to analytics and reporting governance, data democratization, and unstructured content governance. Proven skills as a team member, team lead or project manager on multiple full life cycle implementations. A proven resource in defining systems strategy, developing system requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines. Eagerness to mentor junior staff and raise quality of data strategy, design and implementation across the practice by sharing insights and methods through training, community, etc. Committed to gaining exposure to multiple industries while further developing your career. Adept at implementing technology-enabled business solutions for clients as part of a high-talent team. Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). - provided by Dice      Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Quality Assurance  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Management Consulting  ]
