Job Roles/Responsibilities

This is a software engineering position related to BigData processing.

Position Description

The senior engineer with the experience in BigData technologies like Spark and Hive. At this position, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of
  • Spark applications using Scala language,
  • traditional applications that interact with relational database tables,
  • CI/CD pipelines for your applications.

We expect a good unit and functional test coverage for applications you creates. You should understand the idea of the application monitoring and alerting.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or related field) and 10+ years of work experience, or Master's Degree in Computer Science (or related field) and 8+ years of experience.
  • Extensive experience architecting and engineering BigData processing applications using Spark, Hive.
  • Practical knowledge of Scala or similar language.
  • Experience with Kafka.

We invite you to bring your bright, innovative ideas to MassMutual as we continue to help millions of Americans rely on each other. Bayesian methods), natural language processing, operations research  Exceptional problem solving skills and willingness to learn new concepts, methods, and technologies  Expert in data analysis using R or Python (numpy, scipy, matplotlib, scikit-learn, pandas, etc.) programming languages  Knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript, d3.js and web application frameworks (Flask, Django, Play!, etc.)  Knowledge of NoSQL systems, Hadoop/map-reduce, Spark, Hbase, etc.  Experience in database design and SQL  Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment  Outstanding communication skills (publication history a plus)      Education - M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, etc.) is required           CORE VALUES      Focus on the Customer: We understand our customers well and look for every opportunity to deliver an experience that is clear, easy, personal, human, empowering and trustworthy. description_raw:
[

Boston, MA  or New York, NY


Job Description


​​Since 1851, MassMutual’s commitment has always been to help people protect their families, support their communities, and help one another. This is why we want to inspire people to Live Mutual. We’re people helping people.


A career with us means you will work alongside exceptional people and be empowered to reach your professional and personal goals.  Our employees are the foundation of what makes MassMutual a strong, stable and ethical business.  We seek and value unique and varied perspectives and experiences because we believe we are stronger when all voices are heard. We invite you to bring your bright, innovative ideas to MassMutual as we continue to help millions of Americans rely on each other.


Description

​​

Position Summary:

MassMutual’s Advanced Analytics group is seeking an exceptional, highly motivated and self-directed data scientist. In this role, you will perform data-driven research, problem solving, and algorithm development through the systematic application of mathematics, statistics and computer science as well as cutting edge data technologies. Results of this work manifest themselves in a variety of ways, including interactive visualizations, presentations, publications, web applications, predictive algorithms, and APIs.

This is an opportunity to join a small but growing high performing team with diverse backgrounds in applied math, computer science and physics that have been tasked with developing, maintaining and extracting knowledge from a strategic data asset. Our work revolves around studying fundamental and high impact business questions that directly impact the direction of the company and industry at large.


Overall Responsibility:

  • Set strategy and assume a leadership role in a domain of expertise
  • Develop roadmaps for projects and services, data, and technology
  • Oversee operations of algorithm and system deployments
  • Partner with executive leadership to ensure alignment of data science initiatives and company strategy
  • Lead projects and research initiatives
  • Develop algorithms and predictive models, create prototype systems, visualizations, and web applications
  • Design and analyze experiments
  • Assemble data sets from disparate sources and analyze using appropriate quantitative methodologies, computational frameworks and systems
  • Disseminate findings to non-technical audiences through a variety of media, including interactive visualizations, reports and presentations
  • Mentor junior team members  



Candidate Requirements:

  • Industry recognized expertise
  • 7+ years working with data and relevant computational frameworks and systems
  • 7+ years developing of probabilistic models and machine learning algorithms
  • Proficient level of understanding in the following areas and an expert in at least one: machine learning, probability and statistics (esp. Bayesian methods), natural language processing, operations research
  • Exceptional problem solving skills and willingness to learn new concepts, methods, and technologies
  • Expert in data analysis using R or Python (numpy, scipy, matplotlib, scikit-learn, pandas, etc.) programming languages
  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript, d3.js and web application frameworks (Flask, Django, Play!, etc.)
  • Knowledge of NoSQL systems, Hadoop/map-reduce, Spark, Hbase, etc.
  • Experience in database design and SQL
  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment
  • Outstanding communication skills (publication history a plus)


Education - M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, etc.) is required



 

CORE VALUES

 

  • Focus on the Customer: We understand our customers well and look for every opportunity to deliver an experience that is clear, easy, personal, human, empowering and trustworthy.
  • Act with Integrity: We deliver on our promises by being open, honest and humble and by adhering to the letter and spirit of applicable laws, rules, regulations and company policies.
  • Value People: We respect and learn from each other’s diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We engage and develop people to their greatest potential.
  • Work Collaboratively:  We work together to achieve results by actively listening, seeking, understanding and creating solutions as a unified team driving toward one company, one culture, and one brand.
  • Achieve Results: We focus on winning by exceeding expectations and getting better – everyone, every day.

 

  • Seniority level

    Executive

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information TechnologyFinance

  • Industries

    InsuranceFinancial Services
]

title: Senior Expert, Data Science - Travel, Transport and Logistics
description: [ Apply Now  Qualifications   Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline; PhD preferred Aviation/travel/hospitality, transportation/transit or distribution/logistics industry and data knowledge is a strong plus 7-12+ years of advanced analytics experience using analytics to drive business results in, ideally, information-dense and customer-facing roles Extensive experience leveraging supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning as applied to the travel, transport or logistics industry Experience building scalable and secured analytical solutions to address high-impact business problems Extensive experience managing analytics teams (e.g., statistical, data, econometric), both on-shore and off-shore, to create meaningful and measurable business impact Track record of establishing positive client relationships that leads to generating repeat and/or new business development opportunities and successful client engagements Proven thought leadership within the analytics sector, including production, syndication/publication of ‘marketable’ knowledge Experience with cloud services platforms like AWS, GCP, or Microsoft Azure, and languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, and R – across a variety of relational database platforms (Postgres, MySQL, Amazon Aurora, etc.) Exposure to Big Data platforms like Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Spark, Hbase, CouchDB, Hive, Pig etc.  Exposure to enterprise implementations of CRM (Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, etc.) or ERP (Oracle, etc.) systems most commonly encountered at clients highly preferred Exposure to TeraData, Oracle, MySQL, Informatica, Tableau, QlikView or similar reporting and BI packages  Strong communication and collaboration skills and a strong work ethic  Ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus Professional attitude and service orientation   Who You'll Work With  You’ll work as part of our Travel Transport & Logistics (TTL) practice. You will work closely with senior leaders across our global TTL practice, and directly with our senior clients on topics related to advanced analytics and data science. You will be part of the senior leadership team that helps our clients deliver material value from their analytics and digital assets. Our Travel Transport & Logistics practice works with clients in the travel and tourism space as well as freight and passenger transportation sectors – be it via ocean, air, roads, rail. The majority of our clients are airlines, airports, hotels, cruise lines, rental car providers, tour operators, railways, urban transit operators, postal, parcel and express services, trucking companies, port operators, shipping lines, and others in the distribution value chain.  What You'll Do  In this Associate Partner-equivalent role, you will be responsible for leading analytics delivery on client studies, apprenticing dozens of technical practitioners, and leading research, insights and publications. You will serve as a senior expert or as a dedicated Engagement Director on client projects to make recommendations to industry clients across sectors, functions, and geographies in the context of rapidly growing analytics opportunities. You will be an analytics evangelist within the Travel Transport & Logistics (TTL) practice, helping to educate McKinsey colleagues and client teams on artificial intelligence and its applications to drive business impact. While overseeing multiple simultaneous deployments to institutionalize use of data and analytics for positive business outcomes, you will design and lead large, complex, high-profile sessions and workshops on findings and implications. You will apprentice high-performing analytics practitioners across TTL, ensuring teams are leveraging the latest technologies, infrastructure and datasets. You will be responsible for working with client project teams to assess client data architecture and technology stack, recommend future state architectures and data governance approaches while providing problem-solving support to address complex client needs and vision-setting. You will deliver high-impact insights and recommendations to senior clients, while being an A.I. thought leader with McKinsey and client teams. Lastly, you will lead technical design workshops to co-create solution and architecture with clients.  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Analyst Consulting  Industries Transportation/Trucking/Railroad Package/Freight Delivery Maritime  ]

Qualifications
  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline; PhD preferred
  • Aviation/travel/hospitality, transportation/transit or distribution/logistics industry and data knowledge is a strong plus
  • 7-12+ years of advanced analytics experience using analytics to drive business results in, ideally, information-dense and customer-facing roles
  • Extensive experience leveraging supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning as applied to the travel, transport or logistics industry
  • Experience building scalable and secured analytical solutions to address high-impact business problems
  • Extensive experience managing analytics teams (e.g., statistical, data, econometric), both on-shore and off-shore, to create meaningful and measurable business impact
  • Track record of establishing positive client relationships that leads to generating repeat and/or new business development opportunities and successful client engagements
  • Proven thought leadership within the analytics sector, including production, syndication/publication of ‘marketable’ knowledge
  • Experience with cloud services platforms like AWS, GCP, or Microsoft Azure, and languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, and R – across a variety of relational database platforms (Postgres, MySQL, Amazon Aurora, etc.)
  • Exposure to Big Data platforms like Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Spark, Hbase, CouchDB, Hive, Pig etc.
  • Exposure to enterprise implementations of CRM (Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, etc.) or ERP (Oracle, etc.) systems most commonly encountered at clients highly preferred
  • Exposure to TeraData, Oracle, MySQL, Informatica, Tableau, QlikView or similar reporting and BI packages
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills and a strong work ethic
  • Ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus
  • Professional attitude and service orientation
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work as part of our Travel Transport & Logistics (TTL) practice. You will work closely with senior leaders across our global TTL practice, and directly with our senior clients on topics related to advanced analytics and data science. You will be part of the senior leadership team that helps our clients deliver material value from their analytics and digital assets.

Our Travel Transport & Logistics practice works with clients in the travel and tourism space as well as freight and passenger transportation sectors – be it via ocean, air, roads, rail. The majority of our clients are airlines, airports, hotels, cruise lines, rental car providers, tour operators, railways, urban transit operators, postal, parcel and express services, trucking companies, port operators, shipping lines, and others in the distribution value chain.
What You'll Do

In this Associate Partner-equivalent role, you will be responsible for leading analytics delivery on client studies, apprenticing dozens of technical practitioners, and leading research, insights and publications.

You will serve as a senior expert or as a dedicated Engagement Director on client projects to make recommendations to industry clients across sectors, functions, and geographies in the context of rapidly growing analytics opportunities.

You will be an analytics evangelist within the Travel Transport & Logistics (TTL) practice, helping to educate McKinsey colleagues and client teams on artificial intelligence and its applications to drive business impact. While overseeing multiple simultaneous deployments to institutionalize use of data and analytics for positive business outcomes, you will design and lead large, complex, high-profile sessions and workshops on findings and implications. You will apprentice high-performing analytics practitioners across TTL, ensuring teams are leveraging the latest technologies, infrastructure and datasets.

You will be responsible for working with client project teams to assess client data architecture and technology stack, recommend future state architectures and data governance approaches while providing problem-solving support to address complex client needs and vision-setting. You will deliver high-impact insights and recommendations to senior clients, while being an A.I. thought leader with McKinsey and client teams. Lastly, you will lead technical design workshops to co-create solution and architecture with clients.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    AnalystConsulting

  • Industries

    Transportation/Trucking/RailroadPackage/Freight DeliveryMaritime
]

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: [ The Bing Local Search team located in Bellevue is responsible for mining comprehensive, fresh, rich, and clean content from entire internet to power various travel search scenarios. We are looking for a self-motivated and experienced data scientist that share our passion for understanding and processing information to make the real world easier to explore. This is a fun and fast paced environment, where developers are empowered to innovate and build your own career. Curiosity, creativity and versatility are strongly valued.  Responsibilities   As a data scientist, for a given user problem in wide range of areas including index selection, relevance, information retrieval, entity extraction etc, you are responsible to own E2E solution which includes analyze the problem, define metrics, collect training data, select or develop your model, evaluate you model and ship to production Listen for internal/external feedback and improve metric and model to please our users and power various scenario You will be expected to drive the learning / natural language processing project from conception to end.   Qualifications   4+ years experiences in one or more of the following areas: deep learning, machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, natural language processing, query understanding.  3+ years experiences in Python/R/C++/C# and general software development skills Experience with question answering, language modeling, information extraction, text classification, text summarization, conversation/dialog, time-series modeling, and related NLP applications Take end to end ownership of Machine Learning systems - from data pipelines and training to realtime prediction engines Ability to drive cross team collaborations and ship production features in a fast-paced startup environment. Superior communication skills, both verbal and written. Customer/end result driven in design and development   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. description_raw:
[
The Bing Local Search team located in Bellevue is responsible for mining comprehensive, fresh, rich, and clean content from entire internet to power various travel search scenarios. We are looking for a self-motivated and experienced data scientist that share our passion for understanding and processing information to make the real world easier to explore. This is a fun and fast paced environment, where developers are empowered to innovate and build your own career. Curiosity, creativity and versatility are strongly valued.

Responsibilities
  • As a data scientist, for a given user problem in wide range of areas including index selection, relevance, information retrieval, entity extraction etc, you are responsible to own E2E solution which includes analyze the problem, define metrics, collect training data, select or develop your model, evaluate you model and ship to production
  • Listen for internal/external feedback and improve metric and model to please our users and power various scenario
  • You will be expected to drive the learning / natural language processing project from conception to end.

Qualifications
  • 4+ years experiences in one or more of the following areas: deep learning, machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, natural language processing, query understanding.
  • 3+ years experiences in Python/R/C++/C# and general software development skills
  • Experience with question answering, language modeling, information extraction, text classification, text summarization, conversation/dialog, time-series modeling, and related NLP applications
  • Take end to end ownership of Machine Learning systems - from data pipelines and training to realtime prediction engines
  • Ability to drive cross team collaborations and ship production features in a fast-paced startup environment.
  • Superior communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Customer/end result driven in design and development

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. title: Data & Applied Scientist II
description: [ Speech team at Microsoft builds the most advanced technologies for speech recognition (SR), powering key Microsoft products and services, such as Cortana personal assistant, dictation on Windows and Office, Skype speech-to-speech translation, voice control and inputs on Xbox and HoloLens. Our cloud-based technology also enables SR capabilities for numerous third-party applications through offerings on Azure Cognitive Services. The team in Sunnyvale focuses primarily on Language Modeling (LM) for SR, as well as post-processing of SR results such as rescoring and display formatting. We are a team of world-class scientists and engineers, employing cutting edge machine learning technologies, sophisticated speech and natural language modeling algorithms as well as web-scale data mining techniques, and we follow the best modern engineering practices.  Responsibilities  Data is oxygen in our work. Our modeling effort routinely employs training data sets with billions to trillions of words, from a variety of sources with different quality, cadence, and relevance to application scenarios. It is critical that the most relevant and important data sets are mined and selected to facilitate efficient and effective SR model training for each target scenario.  Qualifications  We are looking for a highly motivated individual to take charge of building and running a flexible and scalable data pipeline to power our production-scale LM and SR training tasks. Your responsibilities include:  Understand the requirements and impact of training data for LM building in large, real-world SR solutions Design and implement efficient and scalable tools for data mining, text processing, and data management Create machine learning techniques for intelligent pattern discovery, data selection and evaluation for target application scenarios Build intelligent data extraction and processing strategies for model adaptation, personalization, and customization for both consumer and enterprise SR scenarios  Be vigilant about technology trends and scientific developments in relevant areas inside and outside of the company, including attending academic and industrial conferences.    Requirements   MS in Computer Science, Data Science or a related field Strong coding skills, with 3+ years industrial level software engineering experience in C/C++/Python 1+ year working experience in large scale data mining and cloud computing. Familiarity with MapReduce framework and parallel/distributed processing such as Hadoop/Spark/Scope Experience in machine learning/deep learning. Prior experience in speech and natural language data processing a big plus Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, excellent teamwork skills, and a passion for improving end user experience  #Cognition Cognition - Speech and Language  These Requirements Include, But Are Not Limited To The Following Specialized Security Screenings  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.  Seniority level Not Applicable  Employment type Full-time  Job function Other  Industries Computer Hardware Computer Software Information Technology and Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Speech team at Microsoft builds the most advanced technologies for speech recognition (SR), powering key Microsoft products and services, such as Cortana personal assistant, dictation on Windows and Office, Skype speech-to-speech translation, voice control and inputs on Xbox and HoloLens. Our cloud-based technology also enables SR capabilities for numerous third-party applications through offerings on Azure Cognitive Services. The team in Sunnyvale focuses primarily on Language Modeling (LM) for SR, as well as post-processing of SR results such as rescoring and display formatting. We are a team of world-class scientists and engineers, employing cutting edge machine learning technologies, sophisticated speech and natural language modeling algorithms as well as web-scale data mining techniques, and we follow the best modern engineering practices.

Responsibilities

Data is oxygen in our work. Our modeling effort routinely employs training data sets with billions to trillions of words, from a variety of sources with different quality, cadence, and relevance to application scenarios. It is critical that the most relevant and important data sets are mined and selected to facilitate efficient and effective SR model training for each target scenario.

Qualifications

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to take charge of building and running a flexible and scalable data pipeline to power our production-scale LM and SR training tasks. Your responsibilities include:
  • Understand the requirements and impact of training data for LM building in large, real-world SR solutions
  • Design and implement efficient and scalable tools for data mining, text processing, and data management
  • Create machine learning techniques for intelligent pattern discovery, data selection and evaluation for target application scenarios
  • Build intelligent data extraction and processing strategies for model adaptation, personalization, and customization for both consumer and enterprise SR scenarios
  • Be vigilant about technology trends and scientific developments in relevant areas inside and outside of the company, including attending academic and industrial conferences.

Requirements
  • MS in Computer Science, Data Science or a related field
  • Strong coding skills, with 3+ years industrial level software engineering experience in C/C++/Python
  • 1+ year working experience in large scale data mining and cloud computing. Familiarity with MapReduce framework and parallel/distributed processing such as Hadoop/Spark/Scope
  • Experience in machine learning/deep learning. Prior experience in speech and natural language data processing a big plus
  • Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, excellent teamwork skills, and a passion for improving end user experience

#Cognition

Cognition - Speech and Language

title: Data & Applied Scientist Manager
description: [ Do you want to be at the forefront of Microsoft's cloud transformation? Are you an experienced analytics leader who thrives on driving business change through data-driven story telling? Are you a passionate people manager who is ready to bring out the most in your team? Microsoft's Cloud Marketing Insights is leading the analytics for Microsoft’s go-to-market strategy in the Azure and Business Applications businesses. We arm marketers to make great decisions about their products and programs, and we facilitate sellers in driving the cloud transformation of their customers. We are looking for a leader to drive the team towards those objectives. This team creates reporting and analytics that delight users with their simplicity and acuity. As the Analytics Team Lead, you will have a passion to drive new insights through analytics that support marketing action while also continuing to build the knowledge base we use to understand our business every day. As the leader of this team, you will work closely with marketing owners to dig deep using analytics to accelerate customer acquisition, engagement, retention, and revenue growth across the portfolio of Microsoft's Azure and Business Applications business. Your team will also serve as trusted advisors to marketing leads through the continued development of actionable insights on product and program performance, and identify opportunities for improvement. This role provides a tremendous opportunity to evolve the use of analytics at Microsoft in the rapidly transforming space of Microsoft’s multi-cloud capabilities.  Responsibilities   Lead the Cloud Marketing Insights team that works with Marketing and Field stakeholders to develop foundational analytic assets, provide ad hoc support, and deliver insights the business needs to make decisions on how to invest, optimize, and grow Collaborate across multiple partner groups to set the team's short-term and long-term roadmap, and deliver new capabilities that drive business impact Act as a partner and strategic advisor with the leadership to influence the future of the business  Govern and maintain compliance standards on the reporting streams created to optimize field strategy Mature team capability through coaching analysts on strengths and advanced skillsets, and coalescing the team around a common vision and approach to analytics Enhance alignment, integration, and efficacy of broad analytical efforts though partnering with other analytics team in the space on a shared roadmap and inter-team engagement model Actively participate and contribute to the modern marketing community and discipline at Microsoft   Minimums  Qualifications  5+ years working in Business Analytics or Science fields 10+ years of Business or Marketing related field   Additional Qualifications   Motivated, ambitious, and passionate about analytics and the associated business impact Thrive in cross-functional team environments  Strong leadership and management capabilities Experience leading team portfolios or multiple work-streams Experience with change management, socialization strategies, and leadership-level  presentations Ability to continually evolve team processes that balance agility, quality, and scale Ability to foster a diverse and inclusive team that fosters those values across all internal and external interactions Excellent communication, inter-personal, and cross-group collaboration skills Advanced analytical skill-set and experience with data infrastructure, VSO, SQL, SPSS, etc. BA/BS or equivalent; Masters preferred  Onsite in Redmond, WA Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. title: Principal Data Science Lead
description: [ Microsoft envisions a world where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envisioning what can be and taking their careers places they simply couldn’t anywhere else. This is a world of more possibility, more innovation, more openness, and sky’s-the-limit thinking - a cloud-enabled world. Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. This mission is bold and at the core of what our customers and employees care deeply about. We have unique capability in harmonizing the needs of both individuals and organizations. We deeply care about taking our ideals and vision global and making a difference in lives and organizations in all corners of the planet. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas, because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.  To Learn More About Microsoft’s Mission, Please Visit  https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture  Check Out All Of Our Products At  http://www.microsoft.com/en-us Microsoft aspires to help its customers achieve their own digital transformation, demonstrating the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and services. Microsoft Azure Core Operating System and Intelligent Edge [COSINE] team makes the operating systems to light up billions of devices starting from small IoT devices to the largest servers running on-prem or in public clouds and make them more intelligent, adaptive, personal and secure. We are looking for an engineering lead, who drive a high performing team of Machine Learning Engineers to build an highly efficient ML pipeline and scale Statistical and Machine Learning models prepared by inhouse Data Science team to train parallelly on trillions of data points and execute models cost efficiently on high volume and high speed data. This is a technical, lead position. You will be accountable for the end-to-end design of machine learning pipeline, distributed training at scale and efficient model execution in cloud and in edge devices. Your models should be optimized to process high velocity data at scale and speed to run in ML pipelines. You will be working in Azure cloud with open source compute engines such as Spark.  Responsibilities   Own production version of all machine learning models.  Reverse engineer and rebuild machine learning models, as needed for distributed computing, using Python, Pytorch, MLLib, Spark etc.  Provide MLE expertise for various practice groups in COSINE  Work with Project Managers, Data/feature engineers and data scientists to design your projects  As a mentor, help individuals in the team grow their technical skills.  Build and maintain relationship with centralized machine learning and data science teams for sharing platform, tools and exchanging best practices   Qualifications   Basic Qualifications:  2+ years of quantitative analytical work using Bayesian and frequentists statistics Experience in building products with machine learning techniques such as neural networks, clustering, random forests, etc. Bachelor’s Degree or higher in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering 1+ year of experience in highly distributed large data environments   Preferred Qualifications   A self-starter who can work independently, pro-actively take action, drive toward clarity and think holistically Deep understanding of Windows/Linux operating system Experience with building security features in commercial software  Fluent in Python, Scala Deep understanding of Spark 10+ years of experience with data and analytics in software development 2+ years’ experience in managing small to medium size machine learning team Technical experience in one or more of the following areas: Hadoop, Kafka, MQTT, Docker, Kubernetes Consistent track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication Deep understanding of cloud infrastructure technologies, business drivers, emerging computing trends Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences Master’s Degree in data science, computer science or Engineering Experience with IoT will be a plus   Requirements  These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.  Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. description_raw:
[
Microsoft envisions a world where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envisioning what can be and taking their careers places they simply couldn’t anywhere else. This is a world of more possibility, more innovation, more openness, and sky’s-the-limit thinking - a cloud-enabled world.

Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. This mission is bold and at the core of what our customers and employees care deeply about. We have unique capability in harmonizing the needs of both individuals and organizations. We deeply care about taking our ideals and vision global and making a difference in lives and organizations in all corners of the planet.

We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas, because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.

To Learn More About Microsoft’s Mission, Please Visit

https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture

Check Out All Of Our Products At

http://www.microsoft.com/en-us

Microsoft aspires to help its customers achieve their own digital transformation, demonstrating the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and services. Microsoft Azure Core Operating System and Intelligent Edge [COSINE] team makes the operating systems to light up billions of devices starting from small IoT devices to the largest servers running on-prem or in public clouds and make them more intelligent, adaptive, personal and secure.

We are looking for an engineering lead, who drive a high performing team of Machine Learning Engineers to build an highly efficient ML pipeline and scale Statistical and Machine Learning models prepared by inhouse Data Science team to train parallelly on trillions of data points and execute models cost efficiently on high volume and high speed data.

This is a technical, lead position. You will be accountable for the end-to-end design of machine learning pipeline, distributed training at scale and efficient model execution in cloud and in edge devices. Your models should be optimized to process high velocity data at scale and speed to run in ML pipelines. You will be working in Azure cloud with open source compute engines such as Spark.

Responsibilities

  • Own production version of all machine learning models.
  • Reverse engineer and rebuild machine learning models, as needed for distributed computing, using Python, Pytorch, MLLib, Spark etc.
  • Provide MLE expertise for various practice groups in COSINE
  • Work with Project Managers, Data/feature engineers and data scientists to design your projects
  • As a mentor, help individuals in the team grow their technical skills.
  • Build and maintain relationship with centralized machine learning and data science teams for sharing platform, tools and exchanging best practices

    • Qualifications

     Basic Qualifications:
    • 2+ years of quantitative analytical work using Bayesian and frequentists statistics
    • Experience in building products with machine learning techniques such as neural networks, clustering, random forests, etc.
    • Bachelor’s Degree or higher in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering
    • 1+ year of experience in highly distributed large data environments

    Preferred Qualifications
    • A self-starter who can work independently, pro-actively take action, drive toward clarity and think holistically
    • Deep understanding of Windows/Linux operating system
    • Experience with building security features in commercial software
    • Fluent in Python, Scala
    • Deep understanding of Spark
    • 10+ years of experience with data and analytics in software development
    • 2+ years’ experience in managing small to medium size machine learning team
    • Technical experience in one or more of the following areas: Hadoop, Kafka, MQTT, Docker, Kubernetes
    • Consistent track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication
    • Deep understanding of cloud infrastructure technologies, business drivers, emerging computing trends
    • Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences
    • Master’s Degree in data science, computer science or Engineering
    • Experience with IoT will be a plus

    Requirements

    These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings

    Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
    • Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

    Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

      Not Applicable

    • Employment type

      Full-time

      EducationTraining

description_raw:
[
Job Description

Title: Part-Time Academic Advisor: 10th Grade TRiO TS/GU
Unit: MCCC Part-Time Professional Staff, Grant Funded
Dept.: Pre-collegiate TRiO Programs and Gear Up: Massachusetts
Location: Lowell
Reports To: Director, Pre-collegiate TRiO Programs and Gear Up: Massachusetts
Date: 10/31/2019
General Summary
The Academic Advisor position is a 10-month part-time (18.5 hours weekly) grant-funded position responsible for all day-to-day aspects of a comprehensive outreach and intervention program targeting underserved 10th graders from low-income and first generation to college backgrounds. The Academic Advisor is a professional who works collaboratively with other staff in the Pre-collegiate TRiO/Gear Up programs and who understands the mission of serving an underserved population. The Advisor is responsible for motivating and preparing program participants for high school graduation and post-secondary education by providing high quality academic, college, career, financial, personal and course selection advising to a targeted Educational Talent Search and Gear Up 10th grade cohort. The advisor will have a comprehensive understanding of the specific needs of urban high school sophomores.
The Advisor is responsible for managing a case load of Talent Search and Gear Up students throughout the school year fostering a college going climate by providing creative and innovative programming. The advisor is responsible for working with colleagues in the development of curriculum, coordination, implementation, and instruction of summer school academic programming to prepare students for a rigorous program of study helping to acclimate them for the demands of post-secondary education. Additionally the Advisor serves as an advocate for the students and develops collaborative relationships within the high school and community to provide an array of services.

Responsibilities
  • Recruits, selects, enrolls, and manages a caseload of students of low-income and first generation to college backgrounds by engaging with students to support academic success, promotion, and college enrollment
  • Works with students on college admission criteria achievement, applications and other forms, advising academic course selection in preparing students for a rigorous program of study, and foster career development goals
  • Develop and implement workshops, transition, and orientation programs
  • Collaborate with other staff serving at-risk students
  • Assists students in developing and following a Customized Service Plan via Lowell High School's Naviance portal as outlined in the grant proposals.
  • Serves as a liaison for students with academic or personal concerns to teachers, guidance staff and parents
  • Utilize case management to monitor and document students' academic and attendance outcomes, and provide supportive outreach, intervention, and referral services as appropriate
  • Utilizes appropriate technology tools in the implementation of program services and reporting
  • Conducts student and parent surveys and inputs surveys into the appropriate grant web portal
  • Conducts workshops and seminars for students and parents related to school success and college planning and financial literacy
  • Meets with all students in an assigned caseload to provide an appropriate blend of contact services as delineated in the TRiO and Gear Up grant proposals.
  • Participates in the planning and supervision of field trips and college campus tours
  • Develops relationships with colleges and other youth organizations in the community to support the needs of program participants
  • Initiate, prepare, and follow up special events and activities to support student, family, and school staff to ensure a commitment to academic success, school persistence, and early awareness of postsecondary opportunity for Gear Up/Talent Search high school students
  • Actively participate in Middlesex Community College-Lowell Public School Partnership initiatives undertaken in concert with the K-16 School Partnerships Pipeline.
  • Monitor and evaluate educational advising and support services for progress and performance on projects' goals and objectives.
  • Administer efficient record keeping/data management and reporting systems (utilizing the GEAR UP Program services database) to document services in compliance with the project requirements.
  • Participate in meetings and events as required.
  • Perform duties in accordance with policies and procedures
  • Perform other duties as required
Requirements

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Master's degree in Education, Counseling, Psychology, Sociology or closely related field; with three (3) years' experience and/or training involving college admissions, academic advisement, career development, or program/project management; or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in educational and other programs for low-income and first generation to college students and families;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of outreach and intervention service strategies that address high school transition challenges of at-risk youth as well as various barriers that relate to urban high school youth from low-income and first generation to college backgrounds
  • Confidence and proficiency with computers and technology
  • Excellent interpersonal relationship skills; ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with multiple constituencies encountered in the operation of school and college programming; strong written and oral communication skills; demonstrated success as team player; demonstrated capacity to act as self-starter, to provide responsible, independent leadership in the development of 11th-12th grade outreach programming.
  • Cultural awareness and competency demonstrated by working with and/or understanding of individuals of diverse identities such as socioeconomic level, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity and veterans including those with different levels of academic preparation, varying physical and learning abilities.
  • Bilingual skills a plus
Additional Information

This is a Part-time MCCC Unit Professional Position. To view classification specification for the position link to: http://www.mass.edu/forfacstaff/classificationspecs/classspecs-mccc.asp
Period Covered: September, 2019 - June, 2020
Hours: 18.5 hours per week in a 10-month school year. Flexible schedule between the hours of 8:00a.m - 2:35p.m.
Rate: $28.29 per hour; eligible for earned paid time off in accordance with the collective bargaining agreement
Start Date: November 2019
Application Deadline: November 21, 2019
The College will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Application Instructions

Applicants interested in applying MUST submit the following documents via the online application:
  • Cover Letter
  • Resume
Follow the steps below.
After completing all of the steps below, please go back into the newly created account and double check that your resume, cover letter, application & disclosure forms were uploaded as requested and appear in the format you desire.
Middlesex Community College understands that persons with specific disabilities may need assistance with the job application process and/or with the interview process. For confidential assistance with the job application process, please contact the Affirmative Action Officer at 781-280-3536
If you have any questions follow the link to the Help Desk noted in the menu above to the left.

  • Seniority level

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Part-time

  • Job function

    EducationTraining

  • Industries

    Education Management
]

title: Associate Director, Data Scientist
description: [  About Cfm  The Center for Financial Markets (CFM) is a part of the Milken Institute, a non-profit, nonpartisan think tank determined to increase global prosperity by advancing collaborative solutions that widen access to capital, create jobs and improve health. CFM promotes financial market understanding and works to expand access to capital, strengthen—and deepen—financial markets, and develop innovative financial solutions to the most pressing global challenges. More specifically, we do this through independent, data-driven research, action-oriented meetings and meaningful policy initiatives.  About The Position  CFM’s Access to Capital program has been at the forefront of identifying and promoting evidence-based public policy that advances efficient and equitable access to capital for America’s entrepreneurs. Reporting to CFM’s Director, the Associate Director will lead our work in the following areas:  Leading in the conceptualization and deconstruction of key issues affecting capital access for small- and mid-size firms;  Identifying, researching, and organizing information to assess the appropriateness and sufficiency of handling large datasets and preparing data stored in various formats;  Developing, performing, and supervising data-based structured analysis and ensure integrity and accuracy of analyses;  Designing complex financial and economic models to analyze key data using programming, model building, and/or regression analysis;  Independently leading in the development of written products (op-eds, blogs, policy briefs, whitepapers, and in-depth research assignments); and  Contributing to the presentation of key findings at public speaking engagements and industry conferences.    We’re Looking For Professionals Who Are   Analytical, creative and rigorous thinkers: Detail-oriented and flexible problem solver. Can synthesize diverse streams of information and switch comfortably between academic and real world thinking;  Qualitative and quantitative data scientists: Fluent in the use of statistical, econometric, data mining, and visualization techniques to understand, model, draw insights, and identify opportunities from complex problems;  Roll-up-your-sleeves executers: Comfortable with engaging in new and nebulous projects;  Pragmatic ambassadors: Can build high-profile stakeholder relationships while upholding the Milken Institute’s reputation as a nonpartisan and neutral arbiter of best practices; and  Team players: Collaborate well with multidisciplinary teams, comfortably taking leadership when necessary as well as following directions as needed.    Requirements   At least 4 years of relevant experience in one or more of the following areas: applied macroeconomics, applied microeconomics, econometrics, corporate finance, financial accounting, investment banking, and/or statistics;  Advanced degree preferred (PHD, MS, MA, MBA or JD in economics, finance or a related concentration);  Experienced in taking ownership of end-to-end project conception, setup, management, and execution of complex quantitative analysis;  Excellent written and verbal communication skills;  Expert level financial modeling experience;  Expert level knowledge of statistical analysis programs (such as Stata, SAS, R, and Python);  Experience working in multicultural environments;  Previous experience in teaching, research, and/or consulting is desirable; and  Have the necessary authorizations to work in the United States of America.  The Milken Institute offers an excellent benefits program including medical/dental, LTD, Life, Flex Spending Program, 403(b) tax-deferred retirement savings plan, and company gym. E.O.E.  Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.  To apply, please submit your information and upload your cover letter, resume and short writing sample. All application materials should be attached as PDF files. Any application that does not include both a cover letter and a resume saved as PDFs will be rejected. Applicants will be assessed on a rolling basis.   Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Business Development Sales  Industries Nonprofit Organization Management Research Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[
About Cfm

The Center for Financial Markets (CFM) is a part of the Milken Institute, a non-profit, nonpartisan think tank determined to increase global prosperity by advancing collaborative solutions that widen access to capital, create jobs and improve health. CFM promotes financial market understanding and works to expand access to capital, strengthen—and deepen—financial markets, and develop innovative financial solutions to the most pressing global challenges. More specifically, we do this through independent, data-driven research, action-oriented meetings and meaningful policy initiatives.

About The Position

CFM’s Access to Capital program has been at the forefront of identifying and promoting evidence-based public policy that advances efficient and equitable access to capital for America’s entrepreneurs. Reporting to CFM’s Director, the Associate Director will lead our work in the following areas:
  • Leading in the conceptualization and deconstruction of key issues affecting capital access for small- and mid-size firms;
  • Identifying, researching, and organizing information to assess the appropriateness and sufficiency of handling large datasets and preparing data stored in various formats;
  • Developing, performing, and supervising data-based structured analysis and ensure integrity and accuracy of analyses;
  • Designing complex financial and economic models to analyze key data using programming, model building, and/or regression analysis;
  • Independently leading in the development of written products (op-eds, blogs, policy briefs, whitepapers, and in-depth research assignments); and
  • Contributing to the presentation of key findings at public speaking engagements and industry conferences.


We’re Looking For Professionals Who Are
  • Analytical, creative and rigorous thinkers: Detail-oriented and flexible problem solver. Can synthesize diverse streams of information and switch comfortably between academic and real world thinking;
  • Qualitative and quantitative data scientists: Fluent in the use of statistical, econometric, data mining, and visualization techniques to understand, model, draw insights, and identify opportunities from complex problems;
  • Roll-up-your-sleeves executers: Comfortable with engaging in new and nebulous projects;
  • Pragmatic ambassadors: Can build high-profile stakeholder relationships while upholding the Milken Institute’s reputation as a nonpartisan and neutral arbiter of best practices; and
  • Team players: Collaborate well with multidisciplinary teams, comfortably taking leadership when necessary as well as following directions as needed.


Requirements
  • At least 4 years of relevant experience in one or more of the following areas: applied macroeconomics, applied microeconomics, econometrics, corporate finance, financial accounting, investment banking, and/or statistics;
  • Advanced degree preferred (PHD, MS, MA, MBA or JD in economics, finance or a related concentration);
  • Experienced in taking ownership of end-to-end project conception, setup, management, and execution of complex quantitative analysis;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Expert level financial modeling experience;
  • Expert level knowledge of statistical analysis programs (such as Stata, SAS, R, and Python);
  • Experience working in multicultural environments;
  • Previous experience in teaching, research, and/or consulting is desirable; and
  • Have the necessary authorizations to work in the United States of America.

The Milken Institute offers an excellent benefits program including medical/dental, LTD, Life, Flex Spending Program, 403(b) tax-deferred retirement savings plan, and company gym. E.O.E.

Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.

To apply, please submit your information and upload your cover letter, resume and short writing sample. All application materials should be attached as PDF files. Any application that does not include both a cover letter and a resume saved as PDFs will be rejected. Applicants will be assessed on a rolling basis.

  • Seniority level

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Business DevelopmentSales

  • Industries

    Nonprofit Organization ManagementResearchFinancial Services
]

Strong programming skills (Python, SQL, Matlab, Java,, C++, and R) Knowledge of: toolkits such as Torch, Theano, TensorFlow, Keras, Spark, sklearn, Chainer , etc.  Expertise in linear algebra and calculus is required  7+ years of relevant experience is required  Effective communicator of research ideas for collaborative team-oriented research  Strong buy-side experienced is welcomed. description_raw:
[

Lead Machine Learning Data Scientist (Director)

 London & New York Ref: SMLDS-0103 ££ Excellent with substantial bonus Large Banking Group Market Intelligence, NLP, Alternative Data, Pricing prediction (all Asset Classes)
This top-tier investment bank uses ML techniques to build advanced applications for its trading & risk business across the business lines, transforming their data into business opportunities.

Sitting in the front office, this ED level role will lead the development of new machine learning methods to discover insights across risk, trading, CRM, & pricing models. ML techniques include neural nets algorithms for time series, NLP & supervised learning. In addition to applying existing models, you will develop new techniques for banking, trading & risk leveraging alternative data and identifying solutions for new areas of predictive leverage.
  • MSc, PhD in mathematics, statistics, quantitative finance, physics, computer science, or other
  • Academic and/or professional experiences in advanced machine learning and data mining strongly preferred

  • Hands on experiences applying advanced machine learning methods to techniques
  • Experience with natural language processing techniques essential
  • Good intuition for conducting empirical financial research and strong analytical, econometrics and quantitative skills.
  • Strong programming skills (Python, SQL, Matlab, Java,, C++, and R)
    Knowledge of: toolkits such as Torch, Theano, TensorFlow, Keras, Spark, sklearn, Chainer , etc.
  • Expertise in linear algebra and calculus is required
  • 7+ years of relevant experience is required
  • Effective communicator of research ideas for collaborative team-oriented research

title: Data Science Manager
description: [  The Role  At Mozilla, we want to protect the Internet as a global resource, open and accessible to all. We collect terabytes of data a day from millions of users to guide our decision-making. We could use your help. As a manager on the data science team, you will own a critical piece of the Mozilla organization. Data scientists work closely with our policy, legal, and business development teams to enable decisions and contribute insights that push our mission forward and in the right direction. They build models and design experiments that improve our understanding about the operation of our business and products to ensure that we are optimizing our decisions for maximum impact on the market. We are looking for an opinionated manager with technical chops who is excited to marshal a data science team to shape the future of the Web. You will manage a small team of data scientists and will be responsible for career mentorship and technical guidance. You will work with leadership to define and execute strategies that demonstrate the value of the data contributed by our users while maintaining an ethical set of principles to guide your practice.  As a data science manager...   You are comfortable steering a team of 2-7 data scientists to align with business priorities, legal and policy agendas, and Mozilla’s greater mission  You pride yourself on your ability to communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences across Mozilla  You define requirements for data scientists to other parts of the Mozilla organization  You collaborate with cross-functional management to create new initiatives and refine existing processes that increase the impact of the data science team  You possess a strategic mindset and find motivation in creatively solving problems  You establish best practices for data science workflows and know how to create an environment and team culture that enables data scientists to perform at their best  You have a strong desire to contribute to Mozilla’s mission through data science   Your professional profile   At least 2 years directly managing a team of data scientists.  At least 5 years of industry experience in the data science profession.  You have experience with a breadth of analytical methodologies and possess a solid foundation in numerous statistical techniques  You also have experience with common data science technologies, namely SQL, Python, or R, as well as familiarity with conventional code and programming concepts  You have strong communication skills; experience speaking at industry or academic conferences a plus  You consider contributing to a collaborative and open team culture an important responsibility    Feel Good About Your Work Again.  At Mozilla, we’re serving humanity—by maintaining a safe, open internet—while also helping the individual humans employed here to reach their personal and professional goals. With a relatively small team serving hundreds of millions of people, a culture of exploration, and a commitment to mentorship, opportunities abound to learn and grow at Mozilla.  Our values drive our actions   Purpose is built into our work, with our mission driving every decision  We challenge assumptions, the status quo, ourselves, and each other  We are transparent: in our code, our business partnerships, and our everyday interactions  We seek out people from diverse backgrounds and with perspectives different from our own  We pair purpose with performance and put people ahead of profit   Our impact is global   1000+ paid staff from over 30 countries  Thousands of volunteer contributors across six continents  10 global offices: Beijing, Berlin, London, Paris, Mountain View, Portland, San Francisco, Taipei, Toronto and Vancouver  Hundreds of home offices globally    Our Benefits Are World-class   Flexible work environment (nearly half of Mozillians work remotely)  Industry-leading paid parental leave (up to 26 weeks of fully paid leave for childbearing parents and up to 12 weeks for non-childbearing parents)  Reimbursement for professional development (up to $3,000/year)  A work setup including the latest hardware and software of your choice  Wellness programs—we reimburses up to $1700/year for expenses like child and elder care, mental wellness, and personal enrichment    About Mozilla  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. A lot of companies say they’re “mission-driven.” Our unique corporate structure guarantees that every decision we make upholds our mission: to make sure the internet stays available, safe, and welcoming to everyone. Beholden to neither shareholders nor investors, Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the not-for-profit Mozilla Foundation. Along with 20,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation’s staff designs, builds, and distributes software that allows people to enjoy the internet on their own terms. Our flagship product — the Firefox browser — has expanded into a family of products that protects users and alerts them of risks. Mozilla’s Emerging Technologies group incubated and sponsors Rust — Stack Overflow’s “most loved programming language” for the last four years — and is building safe, private versions of virtual reality, internet of things, and voice recognition. Group: D   Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Other  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
The Role

At Mozilla, we want to protect the Internet as a global resource, open and accessible to all. We collect terabytes of data a day from millions of users to guide our decision-making. We could use your help.

As a manager on the data science team, you will own a critical piece of the Mozilla organization. Data scientists work closely with our policy, legal, and business development teams to enable decisions and contribute insights that push our mission forward and in the right direction. They build models and design experiments that improve our understanding about the operation of our business and products to ensure that we are optimizing our decisions for maximum impact on the market. We are looking for an opinionated manager with technical chops who is excited to marshal a data science team to shape the future of the Web. You will manage a small team of data scientists and will be responsible for career mentorship and technical guidance. You will work with leadership to define and execute strategies that demonstrate the value of the data contributed by our users while maintaining an ethical set of principles to guide your practice.

As a data science manager...
  • You are comfortable steering a team of 2-7 data scientists to align with business priorities, legal and policy agendas, and Mozilla’s greater mission
  • You pride yourself on your ability to communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences across Mozilla
  • You define requirements for data scientists to other parts of the Mozilla organization
  • You collaborate with cross-functional management to create new initiatives and refine existing processes that increase the impact of the data science team
  • You possess a strategic mindset and find motivation in creatively solving problems
  • You establish best practices for data science workflows and know how to create an environment and team culture that enables data scientists to perform at their best
  • You have a strong desire to contribute to Mozilla’s mission through data science

Your professional profile
  • At least 2 years directly managing a team of data scientists.
  • At least 5 years of industry experience in the data science profession.
  • You have experience with a breadth of analytical methodologies and possess a solid foundation in numerous statistical techniques
  • You also have experience with common data science technologies, namely SQL, Python, or R, as well as familiarity with conventional code and programming concepts
  • You have strong communication skills; experience speaking at industry or academic conferences a plus
  • You consider contributing to a collaborative and open team culture an important responsibility


Feel Good About Your Work Again.

At Mozilla, we’re serving humanity—by maintaining a safe, open internet—while also helping the individual humans employed here to reach their personal and professional goals. With a relatively small team serving hundreds of millions of people, a culture of exploration, and a commitment to mentorship, opportunities abound to learn and grow at Mozilla.

Our values drive our actions
  • Purpose is built into our work, with our mission driving every decision
  • We challenge assumptions, the status quo, ourselves, and each other
  • We are transparent: in our code, our business partnerships, and our everyday interactions
  • We seek out people from diverse backgrounds and with perspectives different from our own
  • We pair purpose with performance and put people ahead of profit

Our impact is global
  • 1000+ paid staff from over 30 countries
  • Thousands of volunteer contributors across six continents
  • 10 global offices: Beijing, Berlin, London, Paris, Mountain View, Portland, San Francisco, Taipei, Toronto and Vancouver
  • Hundreds of home offices globally


Our Benefits Are World-class
  • Flexible work environment (nearly half of Mozillians work remotely)
  • Industry-leading paid parental leave (up to 26 weeks of fully paid leave for childbearing parents and up to 12 weeks for non-childbearing parents)
  • Reimbursement for professional development (up to $3,000/year)
  • A work setup including the latest hardware and software of your choice
  • Wellness programs—we reimburses up to $1700/year for expenses like child and elder care, mental wellness, and personal enrichment


About Mozilla

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

A lot of companies say they’re “mission-driven.” Our unique corporate structure guarantees that every decision we make upholds our mission: to make sure the internet stays available, safe, and welcoming to everyone. Beholden to neither shareholders nor investors, Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the not-for-profit Mozilla Foundation.

Along with 20,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation’s staff designs, builds, and distributes software that allows people to enjoy the internet on their own terms. Our flagship product — the Firefox browser — has expanded into a family of products that protects users and alerts them of risks. Mozilla’s Emerging Technologies group incubated and sponsors Rust — Stack Overflow’s “most loved programming language” for the last four years — and is building safe, private versions of virtual reality, internet of things, and voice recognition.

Group: D

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

    Other

]

title: VP of Data Science & Analytics
description: [ In this exceptional leadership opportunity, the VP of Data Science & Analytics will define, build and grow a data strategy and team to deliver best-in-class capabilities that will support Mozilla’s ambitious growth goals. The individual will collaborate closely with the senior leadership team, providing technical vision, analytical support, and business intelligence to shape Mozilla’s roadmap for today’s and tomorrow’s internet ecosystem. In addition to planning for the future, the VP of Data Science and Analytics will enable swift and accurate reporting of technical and user metrics that inform critical product and strategy decisions, while ensuring adherence to Mozilla’s mission and operating principles. The position will require deep technical expertise coupled with an ability to lead and manage in a very dynamic environment. Mozilla is developing and implementing an organizational plan aligned to a company-wide transformation strategy. If you are looking to make an impact, this is a great opportunity to showcase your talents and skills to lead, contribute, and execute.  As a Vice President, Data Sciences & Analytics, you are …   A World Class Team-Builder   Build a high performance, responsive team of data scientists, data engineers, and analysts that is able to harvest and synthesize data quickly and accurately  Support an organizational effort toward better understanding user needs and pain points, and propose roles that data science can play to further this goal  Develop an investment strategy to define, grow and maintain an exemplary data management organization    A Visionary Leader In Applying Data And Data Science   Ensure data best practices and play a critical role in building a data-driven culture throughout Mozilla; Be a thought leader and evangelist to drive adoption and knowledge at all levels of the organization  Determine how to leverage data science, machine learning, and other analytical techniques to offer actionable insights both internally & externally  Develop and implement strategies to support ongoing data management needs, such as governance, technology shifts, and regulatory compliance changes  Define and drive the strategy for investments, working closely with key business analytics leaders, and executive management    An Organizational Enabler   Participate heavily with Mozilla’s executive team, help set business strategy, represent product data science, initiate and debate key strategic topics and opportunities from your team’s work, and drive bold high-impact decisions  Collaborate with cross-functional partners in product, engineering, operations, finance, and marketing to define and build data-informed business strategy and roadmaps  Partner with data engineering team, technology architects and software developers to empower our lines of businesses with robust business intelligence  Provide timely turnarounds on data requests for “one-off” activities, such as acquisition, partnership analyses and new product initiatives  Provide technical leadership where suitable to support colleagues throughout the Mozilla organization  Implement a measurement and tracking system that enables departmental performance benchmarking   Your Professional Profile   15+ years’ experience in algorithmic engineering, data science, machine learning  7+ years of experience in managing, and mentoring data science, data engineering, and analytics teams in a global technology company  Deep technical background with a MS or PhD in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field  Experienced in a complex, cross-functional organization where your teams need to collaborate and integrate with other teams across many disciplines  Passionate to innovate solutions, delight users, and inspire colleagues  Commitment to values that align with Mozilla’s overarching mission and principles  Strong strategic business acumen, change management, and continuous improvement champion  Experience in data-oriented due diligence within the context of M&A transactions  Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence through creating fellowship  Excellent written and verbal communication skills   Success Factors   You will likely be super happy and productive in this role if you…   Have strong technical domain know-how to coach and grow the team  Have a strong builder mentality, can bring order to chaos, and know how to effectively “bring people along”  Bring positive influence on culture and value for Mozilla’s data practice  Are able to effectively challenge the status quo and plan insightful roadmaps  Mentor and coach team on career paths    About Mozilla  Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
