description_raw:
[
In this exceptional leadership opportunity, the VP of Data Science & Analytics will define, build and grow a data strategy and team to deliver best-in-class capabilities that will support Mozilla’s ambitious growth goals.

The individual will collaborate closely with the senior leadership team, providing technical vision, analytical support, and business intelligence to shape Mozilla’s roadmap for today’s and tomorrow’s internet ecosystem. In addition to planning for the future, the VP of Data Science and Analytics will enable swift and accurate reporting of technical and user metrics that inform critical product and strategy decisions, while ensuring adherence to Mozilla’s mission and operating principles. The position will require deep technical expertise coupled with an ability to lead and manage in a very dynamic environment.

Mozilla is developing and implementing an organizational plan aligned to a company-wide transformation strategy. If you are looking to make an impact, this is a great opportunity to showcase your talents and skills to lead, contribute, and execute.

As a Vice President, Data Sciences & Analytics, you are …

A World Class Team-Builder
  • Build a high performance, responsive team of data scientists, data engineers, and analysts that is able to harvest and synthesize data quickly and accurately
  • Support an organizational effort toward better understanding user needs and pain points, and propose roles that data science can play to further this goal
  • Develop an investment strategy to define, grow and maintain an exemplary data management organization


A Visionary Leader In Applying Data And Data Science
  • Ensure data best practices and play a critical role in building a data-driven culture throughout Mozilla; Be a thought leader and evangelist to drive adoption and knowledge at all levels of the organization
  • Determine how to leverage data science, machine learning, and other analytical techniques to offer actionable insights both internally & externally
  • Develop and implement strategies to support ongoing data management needs, such as governance, technology shifts, and regulatory compliance changes
  • Define and drive the strategy for investments, working closely with key business analytics leaders, and executive management


An Organizational Enabler
  • Participate heavily with Mozilla’s executive team, help set business strategy, represent product data science, initiate and debate key strategic topics and opportunities from your team’s work, and drive bold high-impact decisions
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners in product, engineering, operations, finance, and marketing to define and build data-informed business strategy and roadmaps
  • Partner with data engineering team, technology architects and software developers to empower our lines of businesses with robust business intelligence
  • Provide timely turnarounds on data requests for “one-off” activities, such as acquisition, partnership analyses and new product initiatives
  • Provide technical leadership where suitable to support colleagues throughout the Mozilla organization
  • Implement a measurement and tracking system that enables departmental performance benchmarking

Your Professional Profile
  • 15+ years’ experience in algorithmic engineering, data science, machine learning
  • 7+ years of experience in managing, and mentoring data science, data engineering, and analytics teams in a global technology company
  • Deep technical background with a MS or PhD in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field
  • Experienced in a complex, cross-functional organization where your teams need to collaborate and integrate with other teams across many disciplines
  • Passionate to innovate solutions, delight users, and inspire colleagues
  • Commitment to values that align with Mozilla’s overarching mission and principles
  • Strong strategic business acumen, change management, and continuous improvement champion
  • Experience in data-oriented due diligence within the context of M&A transactions
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence through creating fellowship
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Success Factors

You will likely be super happy and productive in this role if you…
  • Have strong technical domain know-how to coach and grow the team
  • Have a strong builder mentality, can bring order to chaos, and know how to effectively “bring people along”
  • Bring positive influence on culture and value for Mozilla’s data practice
  • Are able to effectively challenge the status quo and plan insightful roadmaps
  • Mentor and coach team on career paths


About Mozilla

Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Group: A

    Executive

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Other

  • Industries

title: Data Analyst -Herndon
description: [ Position Overview: Are you technically savvy, but also enjoy explaining results to clients and working to meet their needs? Do you enjoy analyzing big data to identify trends and create reports? Do you have a desire to innovate for an internationally successful OEM? This position may suit you. This person will work in Herndon, VA at the VW/Audi HQ with 3 other NITS Solutions team members working onsite. The client you'll be working with is Volkswagen- great opportunity to be work in a client-facing capacity and be a trusted advisor to them. Travel: About once every 1 3 months to the NITS Solutions HQ in Novi, MI to collaborate with the rest of the team and upper management. Job Responsibilities: Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data Analyze reports of data duplicates or other errors to provide ongoing, appropriate inter departmental communication and monthly or daily data reports Monitor for timely and accurate completion of select data elements. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. In collaboration with others, develop and maintain databases and data systems necessary for projects. Acquire and abstract primary or secondary data from existing internal or external data sources. In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings. Develop graphs, reports, and presentations of project results. Perform basic statistical analyses for projects and reports. Create and present quality dashboards. Liaison between client and third party data provider to identify address and resolve data issues. Proactive in calling clients and display superior customer service skills. Skills: Knowledge of a variety of technologies and/or the ability to understand technology dependencies and manage technology integration required. Experience with all MS Office Tools and SQL. At least 1 2 years of R and/or Python experience- this skill set will be used about once every 1 3 weeks. Previous data work in the automotive industry is preferred bot not required, especially with large data sets. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills required. Superior customer service skills Previous Data Analyst Experience required Perks: NITS Solutions offers paid vacation and holidays, a matching 401(k), ST/LT Disability, and a gold-rated healthcare plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield. We offer employee referral program incentives, enjoy company-wide events (ping pong tournament!), and yearly bonuses and wage appraisals. NITS Solutions encourages career growth - how fast this happens is up to you! - provided by Dice               Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Automotive  ]

title: Data Analyst
description: [  Job Description   NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  Position Summary  We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst. In this role, the successful candidate assists with comprehensive data collection and analysis that integrates the institutional goals and initiatives addressing the overall operations of the medical education program. This position is responsible for preparing large quantities of data into integrated, easily visualized, accurate and timely reports for the institution and OME (Office of Medical Education) program levels. The position is also responsible for assisting with the maintenance and support of various OME tools. The OME associate analyst expertise includes data analytics with regard to medical education program operations.  Job Responsibilities   Create, implement, and integrate multiple data sources including, where possible, optimizing for mobile device technology (including Sharepoint, Educational Data Warehouse (EDW) and workplace assessment tools) and centralization of OME assessments. Assist in the development and maintenance of a OME database. Manage user access to OME software systems (i.e. Sharepoint, Tableau, etc). Work in interdisciplinary groups to meet OME data gathering and tracking needs. Prepare spreadsheets, tables and graphs from multiple data sources, and prepare reports and communicate with interdisciplinary teams. Track, visualize reports using Tableau or other software for medical education program engagement in institutional initiatives.  Assist with the development and maintenance of OME dashboards, communications to end users, and reports using Tableau visualization software. Provide analysis of OME outcomes using multiple data sources to demonstrate compliance with accreditation, regulatory, compliance, and operational requirements. Examples include, but are not limited to: LCME reporting, OME projects Coordinate and maintain electronic data feeds between various data sources Support key managers in analyzing and reporting data from the Sharepoint software and other sources.  Facilitate OME Program access to institutional protocols and practice guidelines and on-line resources Support research on OME data sources. Provide raw data on healthcare disparities, use existing dashboards to study outcomes and institutional initiatives to improve house staff engagement in quality and safety for the purpose of education and academic research. Provide user support for OME systems (e.g., Sharepoint, Tableau) Perform other duties as assigned    Minimum Qualifications  To qualify you must have a Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, SharePoint) Strong ability in teaching others how to optimize their use of computer programs, including Microsoft Office products, Internet browsers and Tableau dashboards. Strong interpersonal communications skills, ability to work across disciplines in collaborative environment  Preferred Qualifications  Interested in developing statistical analysis capability Microsoft SharePoint Skilled in, or interested in learning, SQL database query language Skilled in, or interested in learning, Python or other scripting language Proficient in Tableau Desktop  Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.  NYU School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents. NYU School of Medicine is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online. If you wish to view NYU School of Medicine's EEO policies, please click here. Please click here to view the Federal "EEO is the law" poster or visit https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm for more information. To view the Pay Transparency Notice, please click here.  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Hospital & Health Care  ]
description_raw:
[
Job Description

NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Position Summary

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst.

In this role, the successful candidate assists with comprehensive data collection and analysis that integrates the institutional goals and initiatives addressing the overall operations of the medical education program. This position is responsible for preparing large quantities of data into integrated, easily visualized, accurate and timely reports for the institution and OME (Office of Medical Education) program levels. The position is also responsible for assisting with the maintenance and support of various OME tools. The OME associate analyst expertise includes data analytics with regard to medical education program operations.

Job Responsibilities
  • Create, implement, and integrate multiple data sources including, where possible, optimizing for mobile device technology (including Sharepoint, Educational Data Warehouse (EDW) and workplace assessment tools) and centralization of OME assessments.
    Assist in the development and maintenance of a OME database.
    Manage user access to OME software systems (i.e. Sharepoint, Tableau, etc).
    Work in interdisciplinary groups to meet OME data gathering and tracking needs.
    Prepare spreadsheets, tables and graphs from multiple data sources, and prepare reports and communicate with interdisciplinary teams.
    Track, visualize reports using Tableau or other software for medical education program engagement in institutional initiatives.
  • Assist with the development and maintenance of OME dashboards, communications to end users, and reports using Tableau visualization software.
    Provide analysis of OME outcomes using multiple data sources to demonstrate compliance with accreditation, regulatory, compliance, and operational requirements. Examples include, but are not limited to: LCME reporting, OME projects
    Coordinate and maintain electronic data feeds between various data sources
    Support key managers in analyzing and reporting data from the Sharepoint software and other sources.
  • Facilitate OME Program access to institutional protocols and practice guidelines and on-line resources
    Support research on OME data sources. Provide raw data on healthcare disparities, use existing dashboards to study outcomes and institutional initiatives to improve house staff engagement in quality and safety for the purpose of education and academic research.
    Provide user support for OME systems (e.g., Sharepoint, Tableau)
    Perform other duties as assigned


Minimum Qualifications

To qualify you must have a Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, SharePoint)
Strong ability in teaching others how to optimize their use of computer programs, including Microsoft Office products, Internet browsers and Tableau dashboards.
Strong interpersonal communications skills, ability to work across disciplines in collaborative environment

Preferred Qualifications

Interested in developing statistical analysis capability
Microsoft SharePoint
Skilled in, or interested in learning, SQL database query language
Skilled in, or interested in learning, Python or other scripting language
Proficient in Tableau Desktop

Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

NYU School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents.

NYU School of Medicine is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require applications to be completed online.
If you wish to view NYU School of Medicine's EEO policies, please click here. Please click here to view the Federal "EEO is the law" poster or visit https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm for more information. To view the Pay Transparency Notice, please click here.

    Entry level

    Full-time

    Information Technology

    Hospital & Health Care

title: Jr Data Analyst
description: [  Title: Jr Data Analyst  Location: Redmond, WA  Contract Duration: 2 months with the possibility of extension up to 18 months  Compensation: Minimum base compensation is $35 per Hour and can go higher depending on experience. Also includes medical, dental, vision, PTO, 401k Benefits.  Jr Data Analyst   Job Description: The team is looking for a creative, analytical and experienced analyst who loves data, is curious to explore, and wants to impact business decisions.  Responsibilities   Responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data), data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records, such as organization records, in batch and real time), hierarchy management (identifying, creating, correcting, update, and maintaining complex relationships among parent and child records), and data conversion (changing / transforming the data based on business rules, usually done before the data is integrated into a new system).   Requirements   Should be able to leverage the power of data, the skill of analysis, the science of learning, and the empathy of customer experience to define and guide process improvement initiatives, innovate customer experience, and bring together new ways to create a better customer experience. (1-3 years required) Requires knowledge in project management, writing SQL queries, building Power BI dashboards. (1-3 years required) Must be driven, self-directed, entrepreneurial and focused on delivering the right results.  Must also thrive in a team environment that values cross team collaboration and building on the success of others. Undergraduate or Master studies student with high GPA. Proficiency in English (verbal and written). Advanced computer literacy. Team-oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills. Commitment to accuracy, quality and attention to details. Executes project work and has zero or little experience.   Plusses   Open to recently graduated students who have a degree in information system design or information system management, data science background Data Analysis experience (3-5 years preferred) Experience building Power BI dashboards (3-5 years preferred) Experience with SQL queries (3-5 years preferred)   About Us  Neal Analytics helps companies navigate their digital transformation journey in converting data into valuable assets and a competitive advantage. With our machine learning and data engineering expertise, we leverage data to drive margin increases and profitable analytics projects. Comprised of consultants specializing in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Cognitive Services, practical AI, Data Management, and IoT, Neal Analytics is trusted to solve unique business problems and optimize operations across industries.  Neal Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not and would never discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. description_raw:
[
Title: Jr Data Analyst

Location: Redmond, WA

Contract Duration: 2 months with the possibility of extension up to 18 months

Compensation: Minimum base compensation is $35 per Hour and can go higher depending on experience. Also includes medical, dental, vision, PTO, 401k Benefits.

Jr Data Analyst

Job Description: The team is looking for a creative, analytical and experienced analyst who loves data, is curious to explore, and wants to impact business decisions.

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data), data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records, such as organization records, in batch and real time), hierarchy management (identifying, creating, correcting, update, and maintaining complex relationships among parent and child records), and data conversion (changing / transforming the data based on business rules, usually done before the data is integrated into a new system).

Requirements
  • Should be able to leverage the power of data, the skill of analysis, the science of learning, and the empathy of customer experience to define and guide process improvement initiatives, innovate customer experience, and bring together new ways to create a better customer experience. (1-3 years required)
  • Requires knowledge in project management, writing SQL queries, building Power BI dashboards. (1-3 years required)
  • Must be driven, self-directed, entrepreneurial and focused on delivering the right results. 
  • Must also thrive in a team environment that values cross team collaboration and building on the success of others.
  • Undergraduate or Master studies student with high GPA.
  • Proficiency in English (verbal and written).
  • Advanced computer literacy.
  • Team-oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Commitment to accuracy, quality and attention to details.
  • Executes project work and has zero or little experience.

Plusses
  • Open to recently graduated students who have a degree in information system design or information system management, data science background
  • Data Analysis experience (3-5 years preferred)
  • Experience building Power BI dashboards (3-5 years preferred)
  • Experience with SQL queries (3-5 years preferred)

About Us

Neal Analytics helps companies navigate their digital transformation journey in converting data into valuable assets and a competitive advantage. With our machine learning and data engineering expertise, we leverage data to drive margin increases and profitable analytics projects. Comprised of consultants specializing in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Cognitive Services, practical AI, Data Management, and IoT, Neal Analytics is trusted to solve unique business problems and optimize operations across industries.

Neal Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not and would never discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareComputer Games
]

title: Data Scientist - Bellevue
description: [ Are you passionate about the innovation being driven by: Cloud, Big Data, the Internet of Things, Machine Learning/Data Science, Cognitive Services, Bots/Robotic Process Automation, Modern Data Platforms, Augmented Reality, and Connected “Everything?” Neal Analytics is looking for talented Data Scientists. Data Scientists at Neal are professionals who understand how to present compelling stories through data and create machine learning solutions that wow clients. They are equipped with strong skills working with data, but also possess the requisite business acumen to discuss and present results to business stakeholders. We work in a dynamic, project-based environment that is both interesting and challenging due to the variety of problems. These projects span a wide range of applications (marketing, operations, social media, product recommendation, sensor monitoring) and are consistently at the forefront of the machine learning space. Neal is Microsoft’s premier and award-winning Partner for Data Services, Business Analytics, and Automation. Neal works with the world’s largest brands to help realize their opportunities with data. Neal “shines” among its peers through a non-commodity talent strategy, management consulting lineage, and unparalleled access to Microsoft corporate and field personnel.  Required Skills   Must have a strong quantitative background  Understanding of Data Bricks is a huge plus.  Demonstrable qualifications that you can conduct statistical analysis, explore data, and correctly apply machine learning to solve hard problems  Business Analysis experience  Excellent coding and scripting skills (e.g.: Python, R)  Excellent and thorough knowledge of SQL skills is a nice to have  Cloud platform programming experience (e.g. Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services)  Experience using Microsoft Azure Cortana Intelligence Suite and/or Azure Machine Language is a plus  Solid understanding of general business fundamentals: marketing, accounting, finance, and management practices  Strong knowledge of distributed computing, data warehouse, data mining, business analytics and software development  Deep knowledge of a range of analytic methodologies: statistical inference, Bayesian methods, supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods, dimensionality reduction, anomaly detection, recommendation systems, non-linear optimization, natural language processing, graph analysis, etc.  by Jobble SDL2019-1032  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]

Neal “shines” among its peers through a non-commodity talent strategy, management consulting lineage, and unparalleled access to Microsoft corporate and field personnel.

Required Skills
  • Must have a strong quantitative background
  • Understanding of Data Bricks is a huge plus.
  • Demonstrable qualifications that you can conduct statistical analysis, explore data, and correctly apply machine learning to solve hard problems
  • Business Analysis experience
  • Excellent coding and scripting skills (e.g.: Python, R)
  • Excellent and thorough knowledge of SQL skills is a nice to have
  • Cloud platform programming experience (e.g. Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services)
  • Experience using Microsoft Azure Cortana Intelligence Suite and/or Azure Machine Language is a plus
  • Solid understanding of general business fundamentals: marketing, accounting, finance, and management practices
  • Strong knowledge of distributed computing, data warehouse, data mining, business analytics and software development
  • Deep knowledge of a range of analytic methodologies: statistical inference, Bayesian methods, supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods, dimensionality reduction, anomaly detection, recommendation systems, non-linear optimization, natural language processing, graph analysis, etc.

As part of the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team, the engineer will interact with peers in the US, Europe and India. This role reports to the Manager of Cloud Analysis and Operations. Conduct analysis including data gathering, preprocessing, requirements + design specification and presentations. Demonstrable experience as a self-motivated colleague and independent thinker willing to co-operate in a highly collaborative environment Knowledge transfer between cross-functional teams (e.g. engineering, SRE, research, QA teams, product management) Provide support, engagement, and contribution to identifying and solving resiliency gaps to ensure that service availability remains optimal Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods to improve quality and cost-effectiveness of customer facing products. Able to work in fast paced, challenging environments, dealing with changing priorities and complex and heterogeneous systems Participation in on-call rotation Supports various stakeholders with analysis and processing of complex data sets using advanced statistical, visualization and analytics tools   Education: MSc in a quantitative discipline (data science, mathematics, computer science, statistics, bioinformatics, physics)  PhD degree preferred  Minimum 3+ years of work experience in the following:   Required Skills  * Demonstrated ability to quickly grasp and disseminate new technologies and concepts  Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills  Foster a culture that leverages metrics to make informed decisions and guide change  Research, Reports and Forecasts  Fluency at least with one of the following: R, Python, Spark, Hadoop  Database knowhow (e.g. SQL)  Data and Quantitative Analysis  Predictive Modeling  Stay self-motivated, curious and ask questions  Reviewing design proposals and code pull requests   Nice To Have   Data Mining and Visualization Tools (Tableau, Power BI)  Ability to build KPI dashboards  Experience with time-series data analysis and forecasting methods  Build and prototype analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale  Machine Learning Algorithms  Knowhow of cloud infrastructure  Basics in software architecture: client-server communication, web services, load balancing  Basic know-how about speech recognition   Additional Information  Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. description_raw:
[
Job Summary

Position summary – The Sr. Data Scientist will provide data-driven, action-oriented solutions for various areas including early detection, root cause identification, scalability and business growth. The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for the health, quality, availability and growth of the Dragon Medical One cloud software and services. As part of the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team, the engineer will interact with peers in the US, Europe and India. This role reports to the Manager of Cloud Analysis and Operations.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities
  • Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed.
  • Conduct analysis including data gathering, preprocessing, requirements + design specification and presentations.
  • Demonstrable experience as a self-motivated colleague and independent thinker willing to co-operate in a highly collaborative environment
  • Knowledge transfer between cross-functional teams (e.g. engineering, SRE, research, QA teams, product management)
  • Provide support, engagement, and contribution to identifying and solving resiliency gaps to ensure that service availability remains optimal
  • Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods to improve quality and cost-effectiveness of customer facing products.
  • Able to work in fast paced, challenging environments, dealing with changing priorities and complex and heterogeneous systems
  • Participation in on-call rotation
  • Supports various stakeholders with analysis and processing of complex data sets using advanced statistical, visualization and analytics tools

Education: MSc in a quantitative discipline (data science, mathematics, computer science, statistics, bioinformatics, physics)
  • PhD degree preferred

    • Minimum 3+ years of work experience in the following:

    Required Skills

    * Demonstrated ability to quickly grasp and disseminate new technologies and concepts

  • Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Foster a culture that leverages metrics to make informed decisions and guide change
  • Research, Reports and Forecasts
  • Fluency at least with one of the following: R, Python, Spark, Hadoop
  • Database knowhow (e.g. SQL)
  • Data and Quantitative Analysis
  • Predictive Modeling
  • Stay self-motivated, curious and ask questions
  • Reviewing design proposals and code pull requests

    • Nice To Have

  • Data Mining and Visualization Tools (Tableau, Power BI)
  • Ability to build KPI dashboards
  • Experience with time-series data analysis and forecasting methods
  • Build and prototype analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale
  • Machine Learning Algorithms
  • Knowhow of cloud infrastructure
  • Basics in software architecture: client-server communication, web services, load balancing
  • Basic know-how about speech recognition

    • Additional Information

    Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.

    Nuance Communication Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation and other legally protected characteristics. title: Technical Engagements Manager
description: [ Orbital Insight is looking for an experienced Technical Engagements Manager that can lead internal and external projects and teams to a successful conclusion. More important than anything is the ability to drive projects to the finish line. Whether its reviewing code, flying to meet with the client, architecting a new solution, or tracking down an invoice, you not only have the business and technical chops, but also, most importantly, the attitude, to get things done. You are both the first line of defense and first point of contact. You take complete ownership of an engagement and personally guarantee its success. Based in PA and limited travel is required.  Job Duties   Own an engagement end to end. From contract signing to project completion, you own everything: planning, communication, stakeholder management, scope management, scheduling, status reporting, risk management, resource management, etc. Lead a technical team both as project lead and an expert of the technology.  Create and manage dashboards/reports to monitor project progress & report issues. Design and architect new solutions to solve real world problems for the client, for interaction between software systems, or for new techniques to better analyze our results. Eliminate any and every blocker (business, technical, or personal) that arises when delivering on a particular engagement via delegation, mitigation, or even jumping in!   Qualifications   Masters or Bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.  Experience with the Atlassian stack (JIRA, Confluence), preferably at expert level. Demonstrable experiences leading a technical team and/or a technical project. Former experience as a Product Owner, Data Scientist, or Software Developer. Who you are...  A software engineer with a strong understanding of architecture, design, analysis, and implementation. A results oriented project manager with solid experience leading teams or managing complex projects to success.  A detail-oriented, extremely organized individual with a positive ‘get-the-job-done’ mindset.  An excellent communicator with strong influencing and communication skills at all levels of the organization, able to distill complex technical details to simple descriptions. A driver of progress, the person that chases down every loose end to ensure that each engagement is a resounding success. Orbital Insight is a company on a mission: to help people understand what is happening on and to Earth, in order to accelerate economic, environmental, and humanitarian progress. We are a fast-growing provider of geospatial data and geo­-analytic services to commercial, nonprofit and public-sector clients around the globe. Leveraging advancements in computer vision and cloud computing, Orbital Insight is turning millions of images into a big picture understanding of the world that is quantitatively grounded in observation, creating unprecedented transparency, and empowering global decision makers with new sources of objective, quantified socio­-economic insights. We are recognized world-wide for our innovations. Forbes named us a Next Billion Dollar Startup, and Fortune Magazine named us one of the 50 Most Innovative Companies in the World, two years in a row, in two different categories. In order to see tiny details and yet work at Earth scale, we use computer vision and machine learning. Using convolutional neural networks, we have counted over 3 billion cars across global roads and parking lots, analyzing commercial patterns as well as city growth and development. Our global energy product uses computer vision to map floating roof oil tanks and measure the global volumes of crude oil. With this product, we were able to show that China has 200 million barrels of oil storage capacity that was unknown even to the trading community. Other projects include tracking rates of deforestation, measuring poverty levels around the globe, monitoring construction rates of new roads and buildings, and predicting crop yields. And this is just a part of our mission to understand what’s happening on and to the Earth. We are backed by marquee investors such as Sequoia Capital, Google Ventures, In-Q-Tel, and Bloomberg Beta. Orbital Insight is rapidly expanding its commercial and public sector capabilities. Come join us if you are unafraid to try new approaches and relentlessly seek to push the state of the art, taking projects all the way from prototype to production-ready. A few of our perks…  Stock Options Competitive salary Paid Time Off Medical, dental, and vision insurance Life & disability coverage 401(k) program Flexible Spending Accounts Apple equipment Twice a week catered lunches Stocked kitchen with healthy snacks, coffee, tea, etc Easy commute via nearby Caltrain station, and free commuter Go Pass  Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: Orbital Insight does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any person or email address at Orbital Insight prior to obtaining a signed agreement from Recruiting/HR. Orbital Insight is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved recruitment partners. Furthermore, any resumes sent without an agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Orbital Insight and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention.  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Business Development Sales  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]

Orbital Insight is a company on a mission: to help people understand what is happening on and to Earth, in order to accelerate economic, environmental, and humanitarian progress. And this is just a part of our mission to understand what’s happening on and to the Earth.

Create custom reports and dashboards, audit performance on an on-going basis, and build automated reports where relevant. · Create financial models, as needed to support business leadership. · Experienced in Google Analytics, Optimizely, and Tableu · Manage and improve the monthly financial reporting metrics that will provide management the necessary information to make informed business decisions. · Serve as the financial advisor to the VP of Finance and senior leadership. title: Principal Data Engineer
description: [ Plume develops and deploys cloud based control planes with scale to manage tens of millions of customer homes through some of the world’s largest Internet Service Providers. Our cloud applications include WiFi network management and optimization, device access control, network provisioning, IoT security, and end customer user interaction through mobile apps. We are growing our team and looking for talented individuals to help us define and drive the success of our cloud based service offering. Our focus is on the home market and we support B2B and B2C product offerings.  The Opportunity  As a Senior Data Engineer at Plume, you will focus on providing actionable insights and build highly available resilient systems that will impact and help make business decisions. You will ensure that the platform service we are delivering will meet both our and our customers’ reliability expectations.  What You Will Do   Build infrastructure and abstractions that can enable anyone (engineer or data scientist) to craft a scalable ETL pipeline for whatever the purpose is: metrics, analysis, machine learning, dashboard visualizations  Work closely with ops team to monitor and tune existing infrastructure.  Make intuitive decisions about what services, frameworks, and capabilities need to be in place before they are needed.  Build and maintain a data collection system that robustly extracts meaningful data from multiple sources and data stores.  Build analytics and Machine learning platforms to collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data    Who You Are   BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Systems or related technical field.  3+ years of experience in Data Infrastructure, with Cloud SW experience a plus.  Experience in crafting and scaling data infrastructure, models, and pipelines  Hands-on experience with a variety of data infrastructures, such as:  Processing: Spark, Flink, Hadoop, Lambda  Messaging: Kafka, Zookeeper, Pulsar  Storage: Hive, Mongo DB, Athena, Phoenix, Splice, Redshift, DynamoDB  Machine Learning: Sagemaker, H2O, Keras, NumPy  Open and active in sharing knowledge as well as excellent communication skills  Programming experience in one or more application or systems languages including Scala, Java, or Python  Have an ability to own a project from inception to completion  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Plume develops and deploys cloud based control planes with scale to manage tens of millions of customer homes through some of the world’s largest Internet Service Providers. Our cloud applications include WiFi network management and optimization, device access control, network provisioning, IoT security, and end customer user interaction through mobile apps.

We are growing our team and looking for talented individuals to help us define and drive the success of our cloud based service offering. Our focus is on the home market and we support B2B and B2C product offerings.

The Opportunity

As a Senior Data Engineer at Plume, you will focus on providing actionable insights and build highly available resilient systems that will impact and help make business decisions. You will ensure that the platform service we are delivering will meet both our and our customers’ reliability expectations.

What You Will Do
  • Build infrastructure and abstractions that can enable anyone (engineer or data scientist) to craft a scalable ETL pipeline for whatever the purpose is: metrics, analysis, machine learning, dashboard visualizations
  • Work closely with ops team to monitor and tune existing infrastructure.
  • Make intuitive decisions about what services, frameworks, and capabilities need to be in place before they are needed.
  • Build and maintain a data collection system that robustly extracts meaningful data from multiple sources and data stores.
  • Build analytics and Machine learning platforms to collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data


Who You Are
  • BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Systems or related technical field.
  • 3+ years of experience in Data Infrastructure, with Cloud SW experience a plus.
  • Experience in crafting and scaling data infrastructure, models, and pipelines
  • Hands-on experience with a variety of data infrastructures, such as:
  • Processing: Spark, Flink, Hadoop, Lambda
  • Messaging: Kafka, Zookeeper, Pulsar
  • Storage: Hive, Mongo DB, Athena, Phoenix, Splice, Redshift, DynamoDB
  • Machine Learning: Sagemaker, H2O, Keras, NumPy
  • Open and active in sharing knowledge as well as excellent communication skills

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Expert Data Analyst
description: [ PowerAdvocate, a Verisk Analytics business, leads the energy data industry by providing energy companies with clarity into their complex data. Our Energy FactBase, currently at $3+ trillion and growing, helps customers to create operational and financial excellence. We help our clients to understand how they can leverage our unique view of the marketplace to reduce costs and manage operation risk working with executives on the cutting edge in the power, oil and gas, and renewable energy sectors.  Job Description  Does your perfect day consist of analyzing complex information to find useful insights and connections? Do you like to slice-and-dice data to provide critical solutions that are useful to the company and its clients – or do you like to just do it for fun? If you have a strong desire to learn new tools and technologies to solve business problems, then we have the job for you. PowerAdvocate is seeking an Expert Data Analyst to join our growing company, providing cutting edge intelligence to improve the energy industry. We are looking for a team player who thrives in a dynamic environment, and wants to enrich data to deliver superior customer results. As an Expert Data Analyst within PowerAdvocate’s Spend Intelligence Group you will use your keen eye for detail, your creative analytical skills, and your love for working in a team to help PowerAdvocate maintain its leadership position in energy information. The Expert Data Analyst is a key member of the Spend Intelligence Group, responsible for the data aggregation, normalization, classification and enhancement process which turns raw customer spend data into PowerAdvocate Spend Intelligence. The analyst will utilize robust technology tools and energy industry knowledge to create a truly unique product that is one of PowerAdvocate’s fastest growing solutions.  Job Responsibilities  In addition to the following, other duties may be assigned to meet business needs:  Perform data extraction, manipulation, cleaning, analysis and QA of large datasets  Research energy industry data to accurately and granularly classify spend into industry-specific schema  Gain familiarity with energy industry suppliers and their services and products in order to accurately and granularly classify spend  Build data intelligence around business rules to deliver reportable and actionable information to stakeholders  Participate on a self-managed Agile Scrum team, an innovation PowerAdvocate has adapted from the software development domain   Qualifications   Minimum Requirements:   Bachelor’s degree required  1-5 years’ experience  Exceptional analytical, organizational, problem solving, and time management skills with attention to detail  Proven ability to learn quickly in a fast-paced environment, to manage multiple tasks and/or projects with changing priorities and to communicate effectively at all levels  Likes the balance of working independently and being a member of a team  Enjoys organizing large data sets, identifying discrepancies, and making appropriate adjustments  Experience with Excel to solve complex quantitative problems and analyze data  Demonstrated a willingness to think creatively and offer new ideas to solve problems   Pluses   Experience in the energy industry  Proficiency with databases  Experience in spend analysis  Fluent in technical Spanish  Some programming experience  Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Computer Software Oil & Energy Management Consulting  ]
description_raw:
[
PowerAdvocate, a Verisk Analytics business, leads the energy data industry by providing energy companies with clarity into their complex data. Our Energy FactBase, currently at $3+ trillion and growing, helps customers to create operational and financial excellence. We help our clients to understand how they can leverage our unique view of the marketplace to reduce costs and manage operation risk working with executives on the cutting edge in the power, oil and gas, and renewable energy sectors.

Job Description

Does your perfect day consist of analyzing complex information to find useful insights and connections? Do you like to slice-and-dice data to provide critical solutions that are useful to the company and its clients – or do you like to just do it for fun? If you have a strong desire to learn new tools and technologies to solve business problems, then we have the job for you.

PowerAdvocate is seeking an Expert Data Analyst to join our growing company, providing cutting edge intelligence to improve the energy industry. We are looking for a team player who thrives in a dynamic environment, and wants to enrich data to deliver superior customer results.

As an Expert Data Analyst within PowerAdvocate’s Spend Intelligence Group you will use your keen eye for detail, your creative analytical skills, and your love for working in a team to help PowerAdvocate maintain its leadership position in energy information. The Expert Data Analyst is a key member of the Spend Intelligence Group, responsible for the data aggregation, normalization, classification and enhancement process which turns raw customer spend data into PowerAdvocate Spend Intelligence. The analyst will utilize robust technology tools and energy industry knowledge to create a truly unique product that is one of PowerAdvocate’s fastest growing solutions.

Job Responsibilities

In addition to the following, other duties may be assigned to meet business needs:
  • Perform data extraction, manipulation, cleaning, analysis and QA of large datasets
  • Research energy industry data to accurately and granularly classify spend into industry-specific schema
  • Gain familiarity with energy industry suppliers and their services and products in order to accurately and granularly classify spend
  • Build data intelligence around business rules to deliver reportable and actionable information to stakeholders
  • Participate on a self-managed Agile Scrum team, an innovation PowerAdvocate has adapted from the software development domain
Qualifications

 Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • 1-5 years’ experience
  • Exceptional analytical, organizational, problem solving, and time management skills with attention to detail
  • Proven ability to learn quickly in a fast-paced environment, to manage multiple tasks and/or projects with changing priorities and to communicate effectively at all levels
  • Likes the balance of working independently and being a member of a team
  • Enjoys organizing large data sets, identifying discrepancies, and making appropriate adjustments
  • Experience with Excel to solve complex quantitative problems and analyze data
  • Demonstrated a willingness to think creatively and offer new ideas to solve problems
Pluses
  • Experience in the energy industry
  • Proficiency with databases
  • Experience in spend analysis
  • Fluent in technical Spanish
  • Some programming experience
Additional Information

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

  • Seniority level

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Computer SoftwareOil & EnergyManagement Consulting
]

title: Behavioral Economist
description: [ Posted by:  Kaustubha Phene   Kaustubha Phene Optimal Product Choice, Price and Convenience - Every Customer, Every Time     Are you fascinated by Consumer Behavior? Can you imagine self-learning solutions that enable new consumer-driven retail models? Can you identify patterns from seemingly unrelated and irregular instances? Do logical pursuits for discovering the ‘why’ behind consumer actions excite you? What is your curiosity quotient? Do you wish to work in a lean, high-pressure, execution-oriented environment? Do you want to work with a premier Consumer Research/AI team? Are you a hungry, ambitious big thinker who wants to move incredibly fast?   You are looking for Pristine. We are a pioneering Consumer Behavior AI solutions provider to the Retail industry. Retailers are challenged with rapid industry transformation. Our self-learning Recommendation platform empowers them to win in the age of Personalized Retailing. We enable retailers to offer the Optimal Product, Price and Convenience choice to each Customer, every time . Everyday, our platform learns from 30 million+ new transactions, 10,000+ stores and 35 million+ customers. Powered by our proprietary Consumer Behavior Research, our platform recommends Assortment, Prices, Promotions, Replenishment, Placement, Personalized Offers, E-commerce Content and Home Delivery. We need original thinkers with foundational knowledge in Consumer Decision Making, who are highly curious, imaginative and result oriented . Experience with Retail Consumer Behavior Analysis would be a strong plus.   Email resume to career@pristineinfotech.com. Describe what supremely qualifies you for this role.       Role: Behavioral Economist   Experience: 0 - 3 years   as Data or Consumer Behavior Scientist, in the USA or Europe.    Education: Master’s/Ph.D. in Behavioral Economics, Psychology, Behavioral & Decision Sciences or related fields. Undergraduate and graduate degrees from  US or European Universities  required .  Location: Boston   Abilities, Experiences and Attitude:   Leveraging Data Science for understanding Consumer Behavior Problem definition, ideation, data prep, analysis, solutioning, implementation, measurement and improvement. Excellent presentation and writing. Effectively articulating complex subjects to tech/non-tech audiences. Analyzing and modeling high-dimensional and often ambiguous environments and designing nuanced, self-learning algorithms. Abstract and imaginative thinking for discovering patterns from a relatively sparse set of instances. Strong investigative/research orientation. You are analytical and creative, and you don’t quit. Working with colleagues in labs across time zones. Result oriented. Self-starter. Owns projects with little oversight.  Technical Expertise and Familiarity  Knowledge/exposure/interest in Machine Learning and Deep Learning Proficiency in Python or R    Responsibilities:  Conceptualize, architect and implement high-scale self-learning, recommender systems. Develop analytical processes, predictive models and self-learning algorithms.    Benefits  Competitive salaries, generous equity, 401K, and Medical, Dental and Vision insurance. Start-up environment where you’ll help shape the industry future and have a huge impact Work with amazingly talented and driven AI Scientists and Engineers.   Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Research Analyst Science  Industries Computer Software Management Consulting Information Technology and Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Posted by:
  • Kaustubha Phene

    Kaustubha Phene

    Optimal Product Choice, Price and Convenience - Every Customer, Every Time

    • Are you fascinated by Consumer Behavior? Can you imagine self-learning solutions that enable new consumer-driven retail models? Can you identify patterns from seemingly unrelated and irregular instances? Do logical pursuits for discovering the ‘why’ behind consumer actions excite you? What is your curiosity quotient? Do you wish to work in a lean, high-pressure, execution-oriented environment? Do you want to work with a premier Consumer Research/AI team? Are you a hungry, ambitious big thinker who wants to move incredibly fast?


    You are looking for Pristine. We are a pioneering Consumer Behavior AI solutions provider to the Retail industry. Retailers are challenged with rapid industry transformation. Our self-learning Recommendation platform empowers them to win in the age of Personalized Retailing. We enable retailers to offer the Optimal Product, Price and Convenience choice to each Customer, every time. Everyday, our platform learns from 30 million+ new transactions, 10,000+ stores and 35 million+ customers. Powered by our proprietary Consumer Behavior Research, our platform recommends Assortment, Prices, Promotions, Replenishment, Placement, Personalized Offers, E-commerce Content and Home Delivery. We need original thinkers with foundational knowledge in Consumer Decision Making, who are highly curious, imaginative and result oriented. Experience with Retail Consumer Behavior Analysis would be a strong plus.


    Email resume to career@pristineinfotech.com. Describe what supremely qualifies you for this role. 

     

    Role: Behavioral Economist Experience: 0 - 3 years as Data or Consumer Behavior Scientist, in the USA or Europe.

    Education: Master’s/Ph.D. in Behavioral Economics, Psychology, Behavioral & Decision Sciences or related fields. Undergraduate and graduate degrees from US or European Universities required. Location: Boston


    Abilities, Experiences and Attitude:

    • Leveraging Data Science for understanding Consumer Behavior
    • Problem definition, ideation, data prep, analysis, solutioning, implementation, measurement and improvement.
    • Excellent presentation and writing. Effectively articulating complex subjects to tech/non-tech audiences. Analyzing and modeling high-dimensional and often ambiguous environments and designing nuanced, self-learning algorithms.
    • Abstract and imaginative thinking for discovering patterns from a relatively sparse set of instances.
    • Strong investigative/research orientation. You are analytical and creative, and you don’t quit.
    • Working with colleagues in labs across time zones.
    • Result oriented. Self-starter. Owns projects with little oversight.

    Technical Expertise and Familiarity

    • Knowledge/exposure/interest in Machine Learning and Deep Learning
    • Proficiency in Python or R


    Responsibilities:

    • Conceptualize, architect and implement high-scale self-learning, recommender systems.
    • Develop analytical processes, predictive models and self-learning algorithms.


    Benefits

    • Competitive salaries, generous equity, 401K, and Medical, Dental and Vision insurance.
    • Start-up environment where you’ll help shape the industry future and have a huge impact
    • Work with amazingly talented and driven AI Scientists and Engineers.

      Mid-Senior level

      Full-time

Understands and appreciates different and opposing perspectives  Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification by the Project Management Institute (PMI) is a requirement  Knowledge of productivity and PM tools (MS Office PC software applications - Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, Visio)  Relevant university degree or equivalent work experience  Strong Data Background; specific domain expertise related to the data portfolio (e.g. basic knowledge of Data Governance, Database/Business Intelligence, ETL process and data linage etc.)  8-10+ years of relevant project management experience, with at least 5 - 7 years managing Data related Technology projects  Senior Project Manager - Big Data – Nice to Have Skills  Knowledge of and experience working with the Agile methodology is an asset  Experience in the Financial Services sector is an asset  Knowledge of the Clarity PPM application is an asset  Senior Project Manager - Big Data - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 12 months to start Senior Project Manager - Big Data - Assignment Location Downtown Toronto  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Contract  Job function Project Management Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Senior Project Manager - Big Data

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Project Manager - Big Data.

Senior Project Manager - Big Data – Job Description
  • The general accountabilities of this role include, but are not limited to the following:
  • Lead the delivery of System Upgrade or Application Development projects or assigned work packages from Initiation to Implementation
  • Manage multiple project stakeholders from cross-functional teams, as well as interfacing with project leaders, technology specialists, professional staff, vendors and consultants.
  • Engage executive sponsor to ensure active participation on project initiatives
  • Effectively manage stakeholder expectations related to project cost, time, and scope of deliverables
  • Establish effective project oversight and other governance bodies, and engages the correct levels to support the direction for the project
  • Provide on-going communication to key stakeholders, including the Project Sponsor, Program Manager and Portfolio Director to ensure they are aware of significant changes to the project status in a timely manner
  • Communicate project summary, status, financials, etc. to appropriate parties involved in the governance of the project
  • Collaborate with the appropriate partners to ensure required resources are assigned to the project for successful delivery
  • Assess and ensure that customer experience / stakeholder expectations are appropriately managed
  • Build consensus and relationships with project team and business
  • Manage and track cash view of all project financials (forecasts and actuals)
  • Build and manage project schedule, obtaining input from all project stakeholders to gain buy-in and acceptance of milestones and target completion dates for all project deliverables
  • Maintain project RAID log, tracking and managing risks, issues, actions and decisions through to completion by owners
  • Adhere to established project management processes ensuring approved scope deliverables are completed
  • Oversee scope of the project and collaboratively adjusts scope when necessary, ensuring adherence to established project change management processes
  • Adhere to enterprise project gating and governance controls to ensure that projects meet all the performance, quality and compliance standards and conforms to appropriate methodology

Senior Project Manager - Big Data – Mandatory Skills
  • Strong knowledge of the Project Management Life Cycle (PMLC) utilizing the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) by PMI
  • Solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and how it integrates with the PMLC
  • Thorough knowledge of project management principles, practices, techniques, and tools
  • Experience executing projects using different approaches, like Waterfall, Iterative, or Agile
  • Experience working in a large matrix organization with a mature EPMO governance support structure
  • Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to lead and inspire a team to perform, maximize the contributions of all team members and communicate effectively, with confidence
  • Strong collaboration skills to help uncover stakeholder needs and motivations, influence and secure the cooperation of key resources, resolve conflicts and negotiate positive outcomes for the project
  • Logical and analytical. Comfortable making decisions under pressure. Able to balance the level of data required to make a decision with the importance of the outcome
  • The ability to understand and learn the dynamics of relationships in an organization to identify decision makers and influencers, and to predict how new events or situations will affect the organization
  • Resilient under pressure and tight timelines
  • Adaptable to a variety of situations, individuals or groups. Understands and appreciates different and opposing perspectives
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification by the Project Management Institute (PMI) is a requirement
  • Knowledge of productivity and PM tools (MS Office PC software applications - Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, Visio)
  • Relevant university degree or equivalent work experience
  • Strong Data Background; specific domain expertise related to the data portfolio (e.g. basic knowledge of Data Governance, Database/Business Intelligence, ETL process and data linage etc.)
  • 8-10+ years of relevant project management experience, with at least 5 - 7 years managing Data related Technology projects

Senior Project Manager - Big Data – Nice to Have Skills
  • Knowledge of and experience working with the Agile methodology is an asset
  • Experience in the Financial Services sector is an asset
  • Knowledge of the Clarity PPM application is an asset

Senior Project Manager - Big Data - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Senior Project Manager - Big Data - Assignment Location

Downtown Toronto

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Contract

  • Job function

    Project ManagementInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareFinancial Services
]

title: Data Scientist- Supply Chain Analytics
description: [  Description  Are you passionate about analytics? At P&G, we don't just offer a job, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities, so that we develop our leaders of tomorrow. Our Data Scientists have the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa. We use mathematical modeling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modeling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi-million dollar decisions. You will act as primary evangelist for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis. Our Data Scientists are effective communicators, ambitious and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are critical to thrive in a multifunctional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive. Our Data Scientists are technically Capable: Data Scientists "get their hands dirty", using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions. As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G's supply chains.  Qualifications  We believe you will be a good fit if, you have:  A Master in a quantitative degree (Statistics, Operation Research, Systems Engineering, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.)  We are looking for graduates with a maximum of 8 years professional experience  Good technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc)  Demonstrated success in leadership, problem solving and priority setting  Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams  English fluency  Passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics  Some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting  Demonstrated success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action   Just So You Know  You will be expected to travel for 10-20% of your time. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor. Immigration sponsorship is not available for this position, except in rare situations based on Procter & Gamble's sole discretion. Applicants for U.S. based positions are eligible to work in the U.S. without the need for current or future sponsorship. We do not sponsor for permanent residency. Any exceptions are based on the Company's specific business needs at the time and place of recruitment as well as the particular qualifications of the individual. Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law. Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed. Job locations: Boston, Massachusetts, United States Job Type: Full-time Req No: IT 00002266 SDL2019-130  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Construction Information Technology and Services Financial Services  ]

Description

Are you passionate about analytics? At P&G, we don't just offer a job, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities, so that we develop our leaders of tomorrow.

Our Data Scientists have the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa. We use mathematical modeling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modeling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi-million dollar decisions. You will act as primary evangelist for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.

Our Data Scientists are effective communicators, ambitious and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are critical to thrive in a multifunctional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.

Our Data Scientists are technically Capable: Data Scientists "get their hands dirty", using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions. As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G's supply chains.

Qualifications

We believe you will be a good fit if, you have:
  • A Master in a quantitative degree (Statistics, Operation Research, Systems Engineering, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.)

You will be expected to travel for 10-20% of your time.
