title: Sr. Data Scientist -Sunnyvale
description: [ Hi , This is Ravi from SoftSol, SoftSol is a World class IT Development Services and Solutions provider that Empowers its customers towards greater efficiency, innovation, compliance and cost savings. With its headquartered at California s Silicon Valley, SoftSol is also a CMMi Level 3, IS0 9001 and ISO 27001 certified company that provides innovative and cutting-edge IT services for Fortune 500, Midlevel, as well New Start-up organizations. We have a large pool of IT personnel who carry extensive experience and expertise in mitigating complex IT challenges and integration of emerging technologies in a dynamic environment. Role: Sr. Data Scientist Location: Sunnyvale, CA. Duration: 6+ months Essential skills: Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development. Experience with Linear and Logistic modelling. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Should be proficient with Artificial Neural Networks, Random forest. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Strong hands on experience with Machine Learning. We re looking for someone with at least 9 or plus years of specific experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models and is familiar with the following software/tools: Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, etc. Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, Digital Ocean, etc. Should have experience Supporting on Vector Machine methods Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Experience analysing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Core metrics, AdWords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc. Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Cassandra, MySQL, etc. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, Tableau, D3, ggplot, etc. Thanks & Regards, Ravi Kiran Gavirneni Technical Recruiter Email: Office: (510)-674-0182 Ext 203 / Direct: (510)-213-7316 SoftSol, Inc. | 42808 Christy St. Suite 100, Fremont, CA 94538 | - provided by Dice            Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Other  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Financial Services  ]

[

Hi,

SoftSol is a World class IT Development Services and Solutions provider that Empowers its customers towards greater efficiency, innovation, compliance and cost savings. With its headquartered at California s Silicon Valley, SoftSol is also a CMMi Level 3, IS0 9001 and ISO 27001 certified company that provides innovative and cutting-edge IT services for Fortune 500, Midlevel, as well New Start-up organizations. We have a large pool of IT personnel who carry extensive experience and expertise in mitigating complex IT challenges and integration of emerging technologies in a dynamic environment.

Job Title: QA (Big Data)

Location: Pleasanton, CA

Duration: 12+ Months

Responsibilities
  • Providing primary support for testing application and modules built on Big Data.
  • Perform functional and integration testing for all applications implemented in Big Data which also includes aggregating information provided by various agencies.
  • Work closely with Business Users and Development Teams to scope and draft testing requirements.
  • Plan and handle testing activities like creating test plans and test cases and work on functional and integration testing.
  • Create and publish testing reports like Test Execution Summary Report and Defects Reports.
  • Test all the interfaces from/to applications implemented in Big Data.
  • Deliver all assignments in a timely manner

Skills
  • 4+ years of hands-on testing experience for applications built on Big Data.
  • 5+ years of experience in SQL and relational database design and methods for data retrieval.
  • Business domain knowledge related to Worker's Compensation Insurance industry is a plus.
  • Knowledge of NoSQL systems like HBase or Cassandra.
  • Knowledge of Cloudera Distribution 6.x.
  • Knowledge of Solr collections in Solr Cloud environment.
  • Knowledge of data pipelines using Hadoop components Sqoop, Hive, Solr, MR, Impala, Spark, Spark SQL.
  • Experience with developing Hive QL, UDF s for analyzing semi structured/structured datasets.
  • Experience with Spring framework, Web Services and REST API's.
  • Experience with testing REST API s using tools like Postman and SoapUI.
  • Knowledge of Test Planning, Reporting and Defect Management process in HP ALM & JIRA.
  • Experience with testing ingestion and processing of various file formats like Avro/Parquet/Sequence Files/Text Files etc.
  • Experience in testing data warehousing and Business Intelligence systems.
  • Expert in all technical aspects of testing which includes delivering effective testing strategies and testing artifacts like Test Plans, Test Cases, Testing Execution Reports etc.
  • Providing test estimates for proposed projects.
  • Knowledge of Test Automation Scripting using Selenium, TestNg, AutoIT, Grid & Webdriver, xPath utilities, custom reports, trend analysis, file difference / compare tools, Protractor, Watir for both, BDD/TDD and Hybrid, linear test frameworks.
  • Experience in testing APIs using service based Automation Scripting.
If you are interested please share your updated resume along with your expected rate per hour.

Thanks & Regards,

Ravi Kiran Gavirneni

Technical Recruiter

Office: (510)-674-0182 Ext 203 / Direct: (510)-213-7316

title: Technical Lead - Big Data
description: [  Job Number: 230893  Technical Lead - Big Data    Softworld is currently looking for a Technical/SW Development Lead to join our federal client's Enterprise Analytics team. The successful candidate will develop Business Intelligence/Big Data solutions in an unparalleled large-scale enterprise environment with 100+ data sources churning out over 1.3 billion transactions per day (over 40k per second!), where nearly 35 Petabytes of data are housed and the use of super-computers and in-memory databases are needed to process and support 100s of mission-critical business applications.  Responsibilities: * Work with product owners across several high priority and concurrent efforts; Work with senior enterprise architects and functional architects to translate business requirements to a detailed technical solution and design, build level-of-effort estimates, and implementation timeline in an extremely fast-paced Agile/rapid solution development lifecycle * Coordinate with interfacing applications to define integration approach and data specifications * Drive development approach, review development work products to verify accuracy and alignment with expected results and USPS secure coding standards, coordinate deployment and production validation activities. * Hands-on role requiring technical lead to code key components and frameworks to accelerate development * Oversee sprint team members, track milestones for completion, verify SOPs and QA processes are followed, escalate risks, and provide regular status to USPS product owners  Qualifications: * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline. * 6+ years of diverse architecture and development experience - data architecture, web architecture and integration architecture * 3+ years of big data implementation experience with Cassandra, Hadoop or other similar NoSQL platforms, and open source technologies Spark and Kafka * 3+ years of implementation experience with integrating big data platforms with custom and COTS BI/reporting platforms to produce highly responsive data visualizations * Java Programming Language * Database design and modeling - logical and physical * Ability to provide inputs to size infrastructure needs for new solutions (storage, memory, compute, memory) * Performance tuning - table partitioning and indexing, process threading * Agile development methodology * Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills * Effective communicator (both verbal & written)     THIRD PARTY AGENCIES, SUBCONTRACTORS, AND RECRUITERS NEED NOT APPLY. Applicants received from firms will not be considered. Subcontracting is not available for this position.   Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Computer Software  ]
description_raw:
[

Job Number: 230893

Technical Lead - Big Data



Softworld is currently looking for a Technical/SW Development Lead to join our federal client's Enterprise Analytics team. The successful candidate will develop Business Intelligence/Big Data solutions in an unparalleled large-scale enterprise environment with 100+ data sources churning out over 1.3 billion transactions per day (over 40k per second!), where nearly 35 Petabytes of data are housed and the use of super-computers and in-memory databases are needed to process and support 100s of mission-critical business applications.

Responsibilities:
* Work with product owners across several high priority and concurrent efforts; Work with senior enterprise architects and functional architects to translate business requirements to a detailed technical solution and design, build level-of-effort estimates, and implementation timeline in an extremely fast-paced Agile/rapid solution development lifecycle
* Coordinate with interfacing applications to define integration approach and data specifications
* Drive development approach, review development work products to verify accuracy and alignment with expected results and USPS secure coding standards, coordinate deployment and production validation activities.
* Hands-on role requiring technical lead to code key components and frameworks to accelerate development
* Oversee sprint team members, track milestones for completion, verify SOPs and QA processes are followed, escalate risks, and provide regular status to USPS product owners

Qualifications:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
* 6+ years of diverse architecture and development experience - data architecture, web architecture and integration architecture
* 3+ years of big data implementation experience with Cassandra, Hadoop or other similar NoSQL platforms, and open source technologies Spark and Kafka
* 3+ years of implementation experience with integrating big data platforms with custom and COTS BI/reporting platforms to produce highly responsive data visualizations
* Java Programming Language
* Database design and modeling - logical and physical
* Ability to provide inputs to size infrastructure needs for new solutions (storage, memory, compute, memory)
* Performance tuning - table partitioning and indexing, process threading
* Agile development methodology
* Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Effective communicator (both verbal & written)




THIRD PARTY AGENCIES, SUBCONTRACTORS, AND RECRUITERS NEED NOT APPLY. Applicants received from firms will not be considered. Subcontracting is not available for this position.

  • Seniority level

    Mid-Senior level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Computer Software
]

The majority of this will be done by scraping SharePoint sites and building algorithms with AI/ML to interpret the data.    The technology stack is listed below (not all of these are required, looking for a mix of people to bring these skills):   Development: AWS, Python, Java, Junit, Lambda, Dockers, Chef, Kubernetes, SQL, MySQL, NoSQL, SQL Server, Oracle   AWS/Big Data: AWS ML, AWS EMR, AWS Redshift, AWS Kinesis, AWS Dynamo DB, Hadoop, HortonWorks, MapReduce, SparkML, KAFKA   Apache Atlas, Apache Ranger, AWS (EC2, ECS, EMR, S3, ECR, RDS, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CloudTrails, Lambda), Brakeman, ChaosMonkey, Docker, Elasticsearch, Fortify, GoldenGate, Hortonworks, Junit, Metacat, Neo4J, nTeract.io, New Relic, GraphDB, OWASP, RCov, RSpec, R Studio, Selenium, ServiceNow, SonarQube, sparkML, Splunk, TensorFlow, KNIME   Job Description/Requirements:   Minimum of five (5) years of experience in the Information Technology field focusing on AI/ML development projects using DevSecOps and AWS cloud environments. description_raw:
[

AI/ML & Big Data Engineers (Junior & Mid Level)
Location: Remote
Duration: 6 months contract to hire


Key Skills: AWS, Java and/or Python


Overview:


The task for these positions is to do analysis for a government customer using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. The majority of this will be done by scraping SharePoint sites and building algorithms with AI/ML to interpret the data.


The technology stack is listed below (not all of these are required, looking for a mix of people to bring these skills):


Development: AWS, Python, Java, Junit, Lambda, Dockers, Chef, Kubernetes, SQL, MySQL, NoSQL, SQL Server, Oracle


AWS/Big Data: AWS ML, AWS EMR, AWS Redshift, AWS Kinesis, AWS Dynamo DB, Hadoop, HortonWorks, MapReduce, SparkML, KAFKA


Apache Atlas, Apache Ranger, AWS (EC2, ECS, EMR, S3, ECR, RDS, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CloudTrails, Lambda), Brakeman, ChaosMonkey, Docker, Elasticsearch, Fortify, GoldenGate, Hortonworks, Junit, Metacat, Neo4J, nTeract.io, New Relic, GraphDB, OWASP, RCov, RSpec, R Studio, Selenium, ServiceNow, SonarQube, sparkML, Splunk, TensorFlow, KNIME


Job Description/Requirements:


Minimum of five (5) years of experience in the Information Technology field focusing on AI/ML development projects using DevSecOps and AWS cloud environments.


Possess strong full stack engineering, including at least three (3) years of experience deploying production enterprise applications in AWS that use AI/ML


At least three (3) years of specific software engineering related to front-end and back-end applications and or data services


Experience in large scale, high performance enterprise big data application deployment and solution architecture on complex heterogeneous environments in AWS


Must be eligible to obtain DHS EOD clearance required

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and Services
]

title: Data Scientist
description: [ JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST  Job Description   About Us: Engineers solving real-world problems  At Applied Insight, we leave no stone unturned in solving our customers’ technology challenges. Supporting the Federal Government with the strongest mission focus, our solutions empower people to collaborate more effectively in delivering services vital to the nation. Our unique approach to information technology considers people first. We make it our job to understand our customer’s mission and the user’s reality right from the start, combining technology and process to deliver what customers really need to succeed – from adaptation to innovation – drawing on our long experience of supporting the US Defense, Intelligence and Federal Civilian communities.  A day in the life-- a few of the things you might be doing on any given day:   Perform deep dive analysis into data sets and reports to identify problems or suspected issues with collected data.  Analyze business operations requirements for data, evaluate existing data quality, and recommend improvement opportunities  Analyze output products to assure data quality and conformance to requirements  Participate in continuous improvement efforts to increase available data quality and speed of delivery  Participate on an Agile development team, using Scrum techniques, as a contributing development team member  Collaborate with peers and provide professional assessments of project tasks   Our expectation is that you will excel in this role if you:  Work as part of a small team of data engineers, database developers and visualization specialists to analyze large sets of structured data, looking for anomalies and undiscovered correlations. Combining analytic, Python, and R skills to discover and solve data problems obscured to the layman by the sheer volume of data. Apply fuzzy matching and statistical analysis to find and deal with inaccurate data points or missing data, and work with data providers to correct their input feeds. You will use a variety of tools to profile and visualize data, developing reports, dashboards, and repeatable analyses for leadership.  What we are expecting from you (i.e. the qualifications you must have):   Bachelor’s Degree in a related business or technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience.  Agile development certifications preferred.  Good Python Scripting  SQL Scripting  MS Excel (e.g., vlookup, pivot tables , etc)  Time management skills and the drive to work with limited supervision within a small team  Ability to manage priorities across multiple project tasks  TS/SCI clearance required    Nice To Have   Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodologies  Experience with analytic tools like Tableau, Kibana, or Alteryx,  Experience with relationshal databases like Postgres, SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL  Jupyter Notebook   www.applied-insight.com. EEO/AA including Vets and Disabled.  Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Computer & Network Security  ]
description_raw:
[
JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST

Job Description

About Us: Engineers solving real-world problems

At Applied Insight, we leave no stone unturned in solving our customers’ technology challenges. Supporting the Federal Government with the strongest mission focus, our solutions empower people to collaborate more effectively in delivering services vital to the nation. Our unique approach to information technology considers people first. We make it our job to understand our customer’s mission and the user’s reality right from the start, combining technology and process to deliver what customers really need to succeed – from adaptation to innovation – drawing on our long experience of supporting the US Defense, Intelligence and Federal Civilian communities.

A day in the life-- a few of the things you might be doing on any given day:
  • Perform deep dive analysis into data sets and reports to identify problems or suspected issues with collected data.
  • Analyze business operations requirements for data, evaluate existing data quality, and recommend improvement opportunities
  • Analyze output products to assure data quality and conformance to requirements
  • Participate in continuous improvement efforts to increase available data quality and speed of delivery
  • Participate on an Agile development team, using Scrum techniques, as a contributing development team member
  • Collaborate with peers and provide professional assessments of project tasks

Our expectation is that you will excel in this role if you:

Work as part of a small team of data engineers, database developers and visualization specialists to analyze large sets of structured data, looking for anomalies and undiscovered correlations. Combining analytic, Python, and R skills to discover and solve data problems obscured to the layman by the sheer volume of data. Apply fuzzy matching and statistical analysis to find and deal with inaccurate data points or missing data, and work with data providers to correct their input feeds. You will use a variety of tools to profile and visualize data, developing reports, dashboards, and repeatable analyses for leadership.

What we are expecting from you (i.e. the qualifications you must have):
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a related business or technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience.
  • Agile development certifications preferred.
  • Good Python Scripting
  • SQL Scripting
  • MS Excel (e.g., vlookup, pivot tables , etc)
  • Time management skills and the drive to work with limited supervision within a small team
  • Ability to manage priorities across multiple project tasks
  • TS/SCI clearance required


Nice To Have
  • Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodologies
  • Experience with analytic tools like Tableau, Kibana, or Alteryx,
  • Experience with relationshal databases like Postgres, SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL
  • Jupyter Notebook


www.applied-insight.com. EEO/AA including Vets and Disabled.

  • Seniority level

    Mid-Senior level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Computer & Network Security
]

title: Data Scientist - Next Gen AI
description: [  Data Scientist  Ayasdi is pioneering a newer way to understand large and complex data using Topological Data Analysis (TDA) to automatically discover insights. We use TDA to unify cutting-edge machine learning approaches into a common framework without the need to write algorithms, queries or models. We’re building a platform to solve some of the world’s most complex data problems and are seeking you to join our Customer Success Team as a Data Scientist. Working closely with exceptionally smart people you will balance your creative mindset with your technical knowledge to solve complex problems in new and innovative ways for some of the largest and most complex financial services challenges today and tomorrow. You will use our techniques in combination with advanced statistical and machine learning methods to solve customer problems as well as assist with prototyping new products and solutions.  Job Summary  As a Data Scientist at Ayasdi, you will be ideating and creating solutions for some of the most complex problems utilizing our next generation AI analytical platform. By combining traditional ML with Ayasdi’s framework you will build new groundbreaking solutions that fundamentally alter the way data is analyzed. Your technical and inquisitive aptitude will lead you to interesting datasets, but your creativity and initiative will help you find clarity with obscure information. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to perform exploration and experimentation to build prototypes and best practices for our applications. This position will bring insight and change how our customer’s approach complex problems with analytics.  Responsibilities   Directly interact with customers across industries to understand and help solve their business problems.  Become a master advocate and leader of Ayasdi’s products  Serve as a technical and subject matter expert for sales meeting and events  Interact and collaborate with engineers and product managers to identify and discover insights from customers to continually develop our product.    Qualifications   MS or PhD in quantitative field  3+ years utilizing Machine Learning in a financial institute or related organization  Solid understanding of statistics and machine learning algorithms  Ability to translate analytic ideas into code using production-quality Python code  Expertise with data science toolkits like scikit-learn  Extremely good problem-solving skills  Ability to travel infrequently   Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Management Consulting  ]
description_raw:
[
Data Scientist

Ayasdi is pioneering a newer way to understand large and complex data using Topological Data Analysis (TDA) to automatically discover insights. We use TDA to unify cutting-edge machine learning approaches into a common framework without the need to write algorithms, queries or models. We’re building a platform to solve some of the world’s most complex data problems and are seeking you to join our Customer Success Team as a Data Scientist.

Working closely with exceptionally smart people you will balance your creative mindset with your technical knowledge to solve complex problems in new and innovative ways for some of the largest and most complex financial services challenges today and tomorrow. You will use our techniques in combination with advanced statistical and machine learning methods to solve customer problems as well as assist with prototyping new products and solutions.

Job Summary

As a Data Scientist at Ayasdi, you will be ideating and creating solutions for some of the most complex problems utilizing our next generation AI analytical platform. By combining traditional ML with Ayasdi’s framework you will build new groundbreaking solutions that fundamentally alter the way data is analyzed. Your technical and inquisitive aptitude will lead you to interesting datasets, but your creativity and initiative will help you find clarity with obscure information.

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to perform exploration and experimentation to
build prototypes and best practices for our applications. This position will bring insight and
change how our customer’s approach complex problems with analytics.

Responsibilities
  • Directly interact with customers across industries to understand and help solve their
    business problems.
  • Become a master advocate and leader of Ayasdi’s products
  • Serve as a technical and subject matter expert for sales meeting and events
  • Interact and collaborate with engineers and product managers to identify and discover insights from customers to continually develop our product.


Qualifications
  • MS or PhD in quantitative field
  • 3+ years utilizing Machine Learning in a financial institute or related organization
  • Solid understanding of statistics and machine learning algorithms
  • Ability to translate analytic ideas into code using production-quality Python code
  • Expertise with data science toolkits like scikit-learn
  • Extremely good problem-solving skills
  • Ability to travel infrequently

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareManagement Consulting
]

title: Scientist IV
description: [  Responsibilities  Conduct and participate in molecular virology projects. Implement laboratory experiments to build and analyze oncolytic viruses under the guidance of a Senior Scientist and provide high-quality data in a timely manner. At any given time, he/she will perform a wide and complex variety of assays, tests and studies, including but not limited to: DNA/RNA purification, restriction enzyme digests, PCR, ligation reaction, bacterial transformation and culture, co-transfection of cell lines, viral selection, plaque purification, and propagation of virus and plaque assays. Work in the laboratory to build oncolytic viruses using molecular virology techniques  Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Biological Sciences with a minimum of five years of related experience or a recent Ph.D. graduate Prior research experience in molecular virology or molecular biology Experience in genetic design and molecular manipulation of HSV-1 or Vaccinia virus preferred Able to execute and interpret in vitro studies with supervision, independently interpreting data and proposing next steps Ability to contribute to the preparation and submission of technical data reports  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Research Analyst Information Technology  Industries Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing Construction Machinery  ]

[

title: RF Engineer/Design Specialist (Data Analytics)
description: [  Join our team  With over 9 million subscribers, there’s a lot of buzz and potential around data science, big data and machine learning. Our Evolving RAN Optimization (ERO) team is re-thinking how we optimize our wireless network by blending wireless engineering, computational analysis, and programming.   Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together   As a Data Scientist, you will leverage data science techniques to help Radio Frequency (RF) engineers optimize TELUS’ wireless network, while we ready ourselves for an exciting and new 5G network. Specifically, you will be at the forefront of the wireless engineering data science revolution employing new angles and methods towards solutioning. You will also raise subscribers’ mobile experience to unchartered territory in hopes of providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country.    Here’s How    Apply your data exploration and manipulation skills to store wireless network data into a useful layout (via ETL, map-reduce, cleanse, feature engineer, etc.). Implement data collection, and storage architectures to support our big data initiatives and data-driven insights.  Apply your data analytics skills in order to perform proof of concepts/prototyping and gain insights from the data (via machine learning, computational statistical analysis, etc.). Create wireless optimization models, platforms and insights for the engineering stakeholders. Bring the science of optimizing a wireless network to new levels.  Apply your data presentation skills in order to make insights available in meaningful ways to key stakeholders (via API, Tableau, web apps, etc.). Understand RF engineering requirements and provide data analytics and web applications to support their work.  Provide expertise in software engineering best practices, insights and guidelines to promote sustainable innovation. Keep up-to-date with data science and wireless technologies.  Primary Location  CA-ON-Toronto  Other Locations  CA-ON-Scarborough, CA-QC-Montreal  Schedule  Full-time  You're the missing piece of the puzzle   Acknowledged for your 3+ years of software development experience  Valued for your strong problem solving, big data analytical and mathematical skills  Commended for your passion for automation, data science and machine learning  Recognized for your experience with database design and development: MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, Hadoop, SPLUNK, Alteryx, Tableau  Skilled in some of the following languages: C++, Java, Structured Query Language (SQL), Python, R, Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Extensible Markup Language (XML) & JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)  Regarded for your experience with JavaScript frameworks like JQuery, AngularJS, React or others  With a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering    Great-to-haves    Full stack software development experience  2+ years of experience in the telecom industry for basic understanding of wireless network KPIs, mobile telecommunications technologies, HSPA/LTE/5G  Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering   Who is TELUS?  We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions. Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need. Do you share our passion? At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities. At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Seniority level Not Applicable  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Telecommunications Utilities  ]
description_raw:
[
Join our team

With over 9 million subscribers, there’s a lot of buzz and potential around data science, big data and machine learning. Our Evolving RAN Optimization (ERO) team is re-thinking how we optimize our wireless network by blending wireless engineering, computational analysis, and programming.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As a Data Scientist, you will leverage data science techniques to help Radio Frequency (RF) engineers optimize TELUS’ wireless network, while we ready ourselves for an exciting and new 5G network. Specifically, you will be at the forefront of the wireless engineering data science revolution employing new angles and methods towards solutioning. You will also raise subscribers’ mobile experience to unchartered territory in hopes of providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country.



Here’s How



  • Apply your data exploration and manipulation skills to store wireless network data into a useful layout (via ETL, map-reduce, cleanse, feature engineer, etc.). Implement data collection, and storage architectures to support our big data initiatives and data-driven insights.
  • Apply your data analytics skills in order to perform proof of concepts/prototyping and gain insights from the data (via machine learning, computational statistical analysis, etc.). Create wireless optimization models, platforms and insights for the engineering stakeholders. Bring the science of optimizing a wireless network to new levels.
  • Apply your data presentation skills in order to make insights available in meaningful ways to key stakeholders (via API, Tableau, web apps, etc.). Understand RF engineering requirements and provide data analytics and web applications to support their work.
  • Provide expertise in software engineering best practices, insights and guidelines to promote sustainable innovation. Keep up-to-date with data science and wireless technologies.

    • Primary Location

    CA-ON-Toronto

    Other Locations

    CA-ON-Scarborough, CA-QC-Montreal

    Schedule

    Full-time

    You're the missing piece of the puzzle
    • Acknowledged for your 3+ years of software development experience
    • Valued for your strong problem solving, big data analytical and mathematical skills
    • Commended for your passion for automation, data science and machine learning
    • Recognized for your experience with database design and development: MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, Hadoop, SPLUNK, Alteryx, Tableau
    • Skilled in some of the following languages: C++, Java, Structured Query Language (SQL), Python, R, Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Extensible Markup Language (XML) & JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)
    • Regarded for your experience with JavaScript frameworks like JQuery, AngularJS, React or others
    • With a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

    Great-to-haves

    • Full stack software development experience
    • 2+ years of experience in the telecom industry for basic understanding of wireless network KPIs, mobile telecommunications technologies, HSPA/LTE/5G
    • Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

    Who is TELUS?

    We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.

    Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.

    Do you share our passion?

    At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.

    At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

Their goal is to conquer neurological diseases that can have a devastating impact on the lives of their patients. They have locations around the world, which allows them to partner with other healthcare professionals making it easier for those in need to access their medicines and treatments.

    Our client is looking for a Data Scientist / Statistician that will be responsible for pulling data from multiple sources (internally and externally) for claims from doctor patient data to help identify patterns for disease. title: Formulation Scientist - Vaccines
description: [  Description   Formulation Scientist - Vaccines  Bethesda, MD   Want to join a well-established Medical Sciences Team with a large footprint in the Infectious Disease space and make a real difference in the world of vaccinations?   Talent Orchard LLC is a boutique woman-owned Workforce Solutions Company and Federal Contractor. We are currently retained by a specialty Government Contractor to assist in finding experiencedFormulations Scientists to support a long-term government customer in Gaithersburg, MD.  What You Will Do   The Formulation Scientist is responsible for:   Execute studies for the evaluation and development of stable formulations for the vaccine candidates, including the following subtasks:   Generate samples for analysis using standard laboratory techniques (buffer prep, dialysis, dilution, etc.)  Analyze samples employing spectroscopic, calorimetric and other instrumentation.  Design studies in collaboration with team members.  Analyze, collate and interpret data in collaboration with team members.   Develop and execute assays for biological product characterization, formulation development and stability testing of recombinant protein-based vaccines, proteinaceous nanoparticles, and virus-like particles.  Present data in small group, department and conference settings.  Coordinate and execute routine maintenance and troubleshooting (problem diagnosis and repair) for laboratory instrumentation, including spectrometers, calorimeters, particle characterization and robotics systems.  Write and review technical reports and protocols documenting formulation, stability and method development studies.  Lead the execution of individual studies, including scheduling, data collection, and cross- functional interactions.  Design fit-for-purpose formulation and stability studies.  Represent the group in cross functional teams with development personnel to facilitate overall project objectives.    Position Requirements   Your background will include:   M.S. or B.S. in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering or a related discipline.  Minimum of two (2) years of industry, government or equivalent experience in protein formulation or a related field (experience requirement may be waived for exceptional MS candidates.)  Solid knowledge of the protein chemistry; understanding of biophysical and bioanalytical properties of proteins and biologics a plus.  Experience with protein spectroscopic analysis (UV-Vis, Fluorescence, Circular Dichroism spectroscopy).  Experience with classic protein biochemistry sample handling and analysis (UF/DF, SDS-PAGE, Western Blot).  Familiarity with data analysis software is required (Excel, Prism, SigmaPlot, etc.). description_raw:
[
Description

Formulation Scientist - Vaccines

Bethesda, MD

Want to join a well-established Medical Sciences Team with a large footprint in the Infectious Disease space and make a real difference in the world of vaccinations?

Talent Orchard LLC is a boutique woman-owned Workforce Solutions Company and Federal Contractor. We are currently retained by a specialty Government Contractor to assist in finding experiencedFormulations Scientists to support a long-term government customer in Gaithersburg, MD.

What You Will Do

The Formulation Scientist is responsible for:
  • Execute studies for the evaluation and development of stable formulations for the vaccine candidates, including the following subtasks:
  • Generate samples for analysis using standard laboratory techniques (buffer prep, dialysis, dilution, etc.)
  • Analyze samples employing spectroscopic, calorimetric and other instrumentation.
  • Design studies in collaboration with team members.
  • Analyze, collate and interpret data in collaboration with team members.
  • Develop and execute assays for biological product characterization, formulation development and stability testing of recombinant protein-based vaccines, proteinaceous nanoparticles, and virus-like particles.
  • Present data in small group, department and conference settings.
  • Coordinate and execute routine maintenance and troubleshooting (problem diagnosis and repair) for laboratory instrumentation, including spectrometers, calorimeters, particle characterization and robotics systems.
  • Write and review technical reports and protocols documenting formulation, stability and method development studies.
  • Lead the execution of individual studies, including scheduling, data collection, and cross- functional interactions.
  • Design fit-for-purpose formulation and stability studies.
  • Represent the group in cross functional teams with development personnel to facilitate overall project objectives.


Position Requirements

Your background will include:
  • M.S. or B.S. in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering or a related discipline.
  • Minimum of two (2) years of industry, government or equivalent experience in protein formulation or a related field (experience requirement may be waived for exceptional MS candidates.)
  • Solid knowledge of the protein chemistry; understanding of biophysical and bioanalytical properties of proteins and biologics a plus.
  • Experience with protein spectroscopic analysis (UV-Vis, Fluorescence, Circular Dichroism spectroscopy).
  • Experience with classic protein biochemistry sample handling and analysis (UF/DF, SDS-PAGE, Western Blot).
  • Familiarity with data analysis software is required (Excel, Prism, SigmaPlot, etc.).


Established in 2010, Talent Orchard has an exceptional reputation, providing staffing solutions to time-sensitive, talent scarcity issues to deliver better talent management ROI. Our specialty lies in the critical area of program talent acquisition and resource management, not in one narrow skillset, but across many areas of technical and functional delivery. To learn more about our other exciting opportunities, visit our Jobs Page at www.talentorchard.com.

#talentorchard @RockvilleMDjobs #datastandards #bioinformatics #clinicalresearch

title: Sr. Data Engineer
description: [  Job Description:   As a Data Engineer, you will help us to build products based on advanced analytics in big data environment, create optimization methods to improve model performance and improve the existing solutions.  You will collaborate with team of business analysts, data scientists and engineers, help to understand network and customer data and build new products.   Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, feature engineering, algorithm optimization and scaling machine learning models in big data environment. You will work closely with data architects to determine requirements for scalable solution and data scientists to determine which data are needed for analysis.  You will help to solve problems related to database integration and messy, unstructured data sets. Help to provide clean, usable data for data science and business need.     Responsibilities :  1. Work in big data. Take existing solutions, optimize and build high-performance algorithms. Scale algorithms on terabytes of data. Improve time complexity and space complexity of data pre-processing. Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality. 2. Process structured and unstructured data, validate data quality, help to design data quality tests in big data environment. 3. Help to develop and support data products. Develop data set processes for data modeling, mining and production.  4. Work closely with engineers and data scientists. Help data science team and engineers to improve spark performance. Be involved into data products deployment.  5. Create custom software components using Spark or PySpark (e.g. specialized UDFs) and analytics applications. 6. Help to create visualization tools for tracking model performance and data quality. Integrate new data management technologies and software engineering tools into existing structures. 7. Collaborate with data architects, engineers, data scientist, business team members on project goals.   Minimum qualifications: - BS degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering. -2 years of relevant work experience in big data analysis or related field (data engineer/developer). -Expert in Spark, Python/ or R, PySpark/ or SparkR, Scala, SQL/Hive - Familiar with Spark MLlib, SparkSQL -Accomplished in Hadoop-based data mining frameworks.  Preferred qualifications:  - MS or PhD degree in a quantitative field. - 2-3 years of relevant work experience, including deep expertise in Spark.    Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Telecommunications  ]
description_raw:
[

Job Description:


As a Data Engineer, you will help us to build products based on advanced analytics in big data environment, create optimization methods to improve model performance and improve the existing solutions.

You will collaborate with team of business analysts, data scientists and engineers, help to understand network and customer data and build new products.  

Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, feature engineering, algorithm optimization and scaling machine learning models in big data environment. You will work closely with data architects to determine requirements for scalable solution and data scientists to determine which data are needed for analysis.

You will help to solve problems related to database integration and messy, unstructured data sets. Help to provide clean, usable data for data science and business need.



Responsibilities: 

1. Work in big data. Take existing solutions, optimize and build high-performance algorithms. Scale algorithms on terabytes of data. Improve time complexity and space complexity of data pre-processing. Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.

2. Process structured and unstructured data, validate data quality, help to design data quality tests in big data environment.

3. Help to develop and support data products. Develop data set processes for data modeling, mining and production.

4. Work closely with engineers and data scientists. Help data science team and engineers to improve spark performance. Be involved into data products deployment.

5. Create custom software components using Spark or PySpark (e.g. specialized UDFs) and analytics applications.

6. Help to create visualization tools for tracking model performance and data quality. Integrate new data management technologies and software engineering tools into existing structures.

7. Collaborate with data architects, engineers, data scientist, business team members on project goals.


Minimum qualifications:

- BS degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering.

-2 years of relevant work experience in big data analysis or related field (data engineer/developer).

-Expert in Spark, Python/ or R, PySpark/ or SparkR, Scala, SQL/Hive

- Familiar with Spark MLlib, SparkSQL

-Accomplished in Hadoop-based data mining frameworks.

Preferred qualifications:

- MS or PhD degree in a quantitative field.

- 2-3 years of relevant work experience, including deep expertise in Spark. 

  • Seniority level

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Telecommunications
]

description_raw:
[

Hi ALL,

Greetings from SRS Consulting Inc.!!

Please find the below job description and let me know if you are interested or if possible share this requirement with your known person who is looking for similar kind of job.

Role: Data Scientist

Location: Rockville, MD

Duration: Long term

Responsibilities For Data Scientist
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
  • Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
  • Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

Qualifications For Data Scientist
  • Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
  • We re looking for someone with 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models,
  • Has a Master s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java,
  • JavaScript, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
  • Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc.
  • Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.
  • Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.
  • Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
  • Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.
Thanks & Regards,
Syed Saadi
Direct: 510-256-7194
Email:syed.saadi@srsconsultinginc.com

description: [  Overview  Come join Intuit as a Group Manager in the Small Business Group (QuickBooks) Data Analytics & Science team. This position leads a team of talented analysts and scientists to work alongside with business stakeholders to deliver customer insights and recommendations. title: Data Analyst, Marketing - New York
description: [ Headquartered in San Francisco and launched in 2009, AFAR is the multi-platform travel media brand that inspires and guides those who travel the world to have deeper, richer, more fulfilling experiences. AFAR is the most critically acclaimed travel media brand, having received two National Magazine Award nominations and 20 Lowell Thomas Awards since our launch.  Data Analyst, Marketing (New York)  AFAR Media is looking for a data analyst to own metrics and provide insight and guidance to our busy, innovative marketing team. AFAR’s focus is on growth and revenue and the marketing data analyst is a key role in helping us achieve success in these areas. We’re looking for someone to identify, instrument, and gather data for partner marketing campaigns, organize it in a meaningful way for internal users, optimize ongoing campaigns for maximum reach, and help tell the story of AFAR’s impact to our partners and clients.  The Job   Collaborate with marketing team members to understand the goals of each partner’s marketing campaign, translate them into metrics, and implement measurement before launch  Build self-service dashboards and ad-hoc reports to show the performance of various marketing tactics, site sections, and editorial products.  Use multiple data sources to develop clear insights about AFAR’s audience profile and behavior for use by advertisers, partners, and internal team members  Develop, implement, analyze, and report on A/B tests to maximize campaign performance. Translate performance data into actionable insights, and helps the team learn from each project  Conduct broader market research on the travel and media industries to provide valuable insights to partners and clients and situate AFAR’s offerings within the industry  Collaborate with the ad operations and audience development teams to extract advertiser data and campaign performance metrics  Help the marketing and sales teams use data to tell clear stories demonstrating the impact of AFAR’s custom content and other innovative programs  Tackle complex and ambiguous analytic projects: resolve ambiguity as much as possible in all stages, comfortably shift between various tools to answer complicated questions, and accurately identify trade-offs and ROI  Collaborate with Data Analytics Manager to coordinate metrics reporting and data storage for consistency, clarity, and efficiency across the organization    Requirements   3-5 years in a consumer-focused, quantitative role   Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including experimentation, data visualization, and defining KPI strategy for the business.  Strong communicator adept at presenting complex data and your findings in a contextual and relevant way to non-technical stakeholders across the company  Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, A/B testing frameworks, Excel, and data visualization tools required  Experience with developing, implementing, and reporting on A/B tests  Experience with SocialFlow and Sailthru and Ipsos valued  Understanding of how user tracking works, sampling and statistical significance    Good To Know  AFAR is moving quickly, has big plans for the future, and is searching for someone as determined as we are who will thrive in our fast-paced and exciting environment. If you crave constant direction and predictability, this is probably not the media company for you. At AFAR our employees step up, step in, take ownership and wear as many hats as needed to achieve our goals and get the job done.  Desired Characteristics   Passionate about travel and great travel content; an embrace of our vision of helping drive consumers from inspiration to action.  A “driver” personality - biased toward action, great collaborator and master simplifier - constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery.  No hesitation in rolling up your sleeves and tackling something hands-on Pandologic. Keywords: Data Analyst, Location: New York, NY - 10060  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Research  ]
description_raw:
[
Headquartered in San Francisco and launched in 2009, AFAR is the multi-platform travel media brand that inspires and guides those who travel the world to have deeper, richer, more fulfilling experiences. AFAR is the most critically acclaimed travel media brand, having received two National Magazine Award nominations and 20 Lowell Thomas Awards since our launch.

Data Analyst, Marketing (New York)

AFAR Media is looking for a data analyst to own metrics and provide insight and guidance to our busy, innovative marketing team. AFAR’s focus is on growth and revenue and the marketing data analyst is a key role in helping us achieve success in these areas. We’re looking for someone to identify, instrument, and gather data for partner marketing campaigns, organize it in a meaningful way for internal users, optimize ongoing campaigns for maximum reach, and help tell the story of AFAR’s impact to our partners and clients.

The Job
  • Collaborate with marketing team members to understand the goals of each partner’s marketing campaign, translate them into metrics, and implement measurement before launch
  • Build self-service dashboards and ad-hoc reports to show the performance of various marketing tactics, site sections, and editorial products.
  • Use multiple data sources to develop clear insights about AFAR’s audience profile and behavior for use by advertisers, partners, and internal team members
  • Develop, implement, analyze, and report on A/B tests to maximize campaign performance. Translate performance data into actionable insights, and helps the team learn from each project
  • Conduct broader market research on the travel and media industries to provide valuable insights to partners and clients and situate AFAR’s offerings within the industry
  • Collaborate with the ad operations and audience development teams to extract advertiser data and campaign performance metrics
  • Help the marketing and sales teams use data to tell clear stories demonstrating the impact of AFAR’s custom content and other innovative programs
  • Tackle complex and ambiguous analytic projects: resolve ambiguity as much as possible in all stages, comfortably shift between various tools to answer complicated questions, and accurately identify trade-offs and ROI
  • Collaborate with Data Analytics Manager to coordinate metrics reporting and data storage for consistency, clarity, and efficiency across the organization


Requirements
  • 3-5 years in a consumer-focused, quantitative role
  • Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including experimentation, data visualization, and defining KPI strategy for the business.
  • Strong communicator adept at presenting complex data and your findings in a contextual and relevant way to non-technical stakeholders across the company
  • Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, A/B testing frameworks, Excel, and data visualization tools required
  • Experience with developing, implementing, and reporting on A/B tests
  • Experience with SocialFlow and Sailthru and Ipsos valued
  • Understanding of how user tracking works, sampling and statistical significance


Good To Know

AFAR is moving quickly, has big plans for the future, and is searching for someone as determined as we are who will thrive in our fast-paced and exciting environment. If you crave constant direction and predictability, this is probably not the media company for you. At AFAR our employees step up, step in, take ownership and wear as many hats as needed to achieve our goals and get the job done.

Desired Characteristics
  • Passionate about travel and great travel content; an embrace of our vision of helping drive consumers from inspiration to action.
  • A “driver” personality - biased toward action, great collaborator and master simplifier - constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery.
  • No hesitation in rolling up your sleeves and tackling something hands-on
Pandologic. Keywords: Data Analyst, Location: New York, NY - 10060

    Entry level

    Full-time

    Information Technology

    Research

title: Data Science Internship
description: [ Data Science Graduate Level Internship It's a data-driven world. Be part of a growing community of data science professionals that harness the power of data to analyze performance trends, identify opportunities, and keep Liberty Mutual moving forward. The details Calling all aspiring data scientists! Here's the perfect opportunity to grow your knowledge and skills in key areas such as cloud computing, machine learning, and various modeling techniques and software. In the 10- to- 12 - week Data Science Graduate Level Internship, you'll build robust models and use statistical software, such as R, Python, and SAS, to solve critical business problems in product management, claims, distribution, marketing, HR, legal, finance, and other business functions. At the conclusion of your summer internship, you'll deliver a presentation of your work and skills to your colleagues and the data science management team. The Data Science Graduate Level Internship may be your first step toward pursuing a rewarding career at Liberty Mutual, one of the leading property and casualty insurers in the United States. Our interns often transition into full-time opportunities at our Boston , Chicago , and Seattle offices.  A Little About Us  As one of the leading property and casualty insurers in the country, Liberty Mutual is helping people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. title: Senior Technical Data Analyst
description: [  Overview  The Small Business & Self Employed Group ("SBSEG") is Intuit's largest business unit with ~$3B+ in revenue, serving 6M+ customers with the QuickBooks line of products including accounting, payments, payroll and financing solutions. The US SBSEG Finance team is critical in driving business growth and profitability through strategic, financial and operational leadership.  Responsibilities  We are looking for a passionate data leader to drive quantitative analysis in supporting the $1B+ QuickBooks Online offering and reporting to the US Online Sr. Finance Manager. Main responsibilities include:   Strategic planning via statistical analysis  : Understand current online ecosystem and long-term trends (e.g. ARPC, retention, lifetime value), proactively highlighting risk and opportunities related to business growth and drive optimal investment decisions through statistical and econometric analytical techniques.   Driving operational execution  : Partner with data engineering, analytics and marketing to define key performance indicators and develop how they are captured to drive insights and decision making in order to achieve our strategic and financial goals.   Modeling:  Partner with financial analysts to improve forecast accuracy through incorporating fundamental business and market trends.   Ensuring data integrity:  Diagnose root causes behind identified gaps in data and processes, spanning multiple systems and data warehouses   Process improvement  : Drive efficiencies and continuous improvement by streamlining, standardizing and automating processes and reporting requirements   Team coaching  : Proactively influencing, leading & educating within the Finance organization and cross-functional teams on actionable insights  Qualifications You are a data leader, with strong analytical and modeling skills and a deep SaaS understanding. You also have demonstrable experience of acting as a business partner, supporting and challenging non-finance stakeholders. As this role involves constant interaction with senior non-finance stakeholders across the business, you need the confidence and emotional intelligence to effectively communicate at all levels. The ideal candidate has worked in the high-tech industry and enjoys operating in an extremely fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.  3-5 years of analytics experience applying quantitative analysis, econometric techniques, and experimental design to problem-solve business challenges  Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Excel to analyze complex business scenarios by building/improving financial models. Tableau and Hyperion EssBase experience preferred.  Demonstrable experience applying data science techniques preferred (predictive, modeling & analytical) to practical business problems.  Proficient with SQL and at least one scripting language used in analytics (ideally Python); understanding of software development best practices strongly preferred.  Highly motivated, self-starter with ability to work independently in a fast pace environment, simultaneously manage several priorities, and challenge the status quo to lead change and operational improvements.  Understanding of SaaS business dynamics (cohorted retention, ARPC, LTV/CAC) preferred.  Hacker mindset - no matter how messy data is, if there is a way, you'll figure it out.  Entrepreneurial and curious mindset - passionate about business and data, and constantly thinking about opportunities and risks others have not yet thought about.  Ability to influence all levels of leadership to drive actions, behaviors, decisions and business outcomes  Exceptional track record of self-motivation, prioritization, initiative, and integrity  Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues, and translating between the two.  BS/BA in Quantitative discipline. Masters in a quantitative discipline preferred. PandoLogic. Keywords: Data Analyst, Location: Mountain View, CA - 94039  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Research  ]
description_raw:
[
Overview

The Small Business & Self Employed Group ("SBSEG") is Intuit's largest business unit with ~$3B+ in revenue, serving 6M+ customers with the QuickBooks line of products including accounting, payments, payroll and financing solutions. The US SBSEG Finance team is critical in driving business growth and profitability through strategic, financial and operational leadership.

Responsibilities

We are looking for a passionate data leader to drive quantitative analysis in supporting the $1B+ QuickBooks Online offering and reporting to the US Online Sr. Finance Manager. Main responsibilities include:
  • Strategic planning via statistical analysis : Understand current online ecosystem and long-term trends (e.g. ARPC, retention, lifetime value), proactively highlighting risk and opportunities related to business growth and drive optimal investment decisions through statistical and econometric analytical techniques.
  • Driving operational execution : Partner with data engineering, analytics and marketing to define key performance indicators and develop how they are captured to drive insights and decision making in order to achieve our strategic and financial goals.
  • Modeling: Partner with financial analysts to improve forecast accuracy through incorporating fundamental business and market trends.
  • Ensuring data integrity: Diagnose root causes behind identified gaps in data and processes, spanning multiple systems and data warehouses
  • Process improvement : Drive efficiencies and continuous improvement by streamlining, standardizing and automating processes and reporting requirements
  • Team coaching : Proactively influencing, leading & educating within the Finance organization and cross-functional teams on actionable insights
Qualifications
You are a data leader, with strong analytical and modeling skills and a deep SaaS understanding. You also have demonstrable experience of acting as a business partner, supporting and challenging non-finance stakeholders. As this role involves constant interaction with senior non-finance stakeholders across the business, you need the confidence and emotional intelligence to effectively communicate at all levels. The ideal candidate has worked in the high-tech industry and enjoys operating in an extremely fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.

  • 3-5 years of analytics experience applying quantitative analysis, econometric techniques, and experimental design to problem-solve business challenges
  • Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Excel to analyze complex business scenarios by building/improving financial models. Tableau and Hyperion EssBase experience preferred.
  • Demonstrable experience applying data science techniques preferred (predictive, modeling & analytical) to practical business problems.
  • Proficient with SQL and at least one scripting language used in analytics (ideally Python); understanding of software development best practices strongly preferred.
  • Highly motivated, self-starter with ability to work independently in a fast pace environment, simultaneously manage several priorities, and challenge the status quo to lead change and operational improvements.
  • Understanding of SaaS business dynamics (cohorted retention, ARPC, LTV/CAC) preferred.
  • Hacker mindset - no matter how messy data is, if there is a way, you'll figure it out.
  • Entrepreneurial and curious mindset - passionate about business and data, and constantly thinking about opportunities and risks others have not yet thought about.
  • Ability to influence all levels of leadership to drive actions, behaviors, decisions and business outcomes
  • Exceptional track record of self-motivation, prioritization, initiative, and integrity
  • Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues, and translating between the two.
  • BS/BA in Quantitative discipline. Masters in a quantitative discipline preferred.
    • PandoLogic. Keywords: Data Analyst, Location: Mountain View, CA - 94039

title: Sr. Research Associate (Psychometrist Exp.)
description: [  Job Description  GDIT's Military Health Solutions is hiring a Senior Clinical Research Associate to support the Defense & Veterans Brain Injury Center located at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center (WRNMMC) in Bethesda, MD. As a leader in traumatic brain injury research, the Defense and Veterans Brain Injury Center (DVBIC) serves active duty military, veterans and their beneficiaries with coordinated care throughout 23 Army, Navy and Veterans Affairs medical treatment centers. General Dynamics Health Solutions researchers and healthcare professionals treat and track more than 8,500 TBI patients a year to measure the impact of care on long term health and occupational outcomes. Conducting 72 different clinical research studies to include a 15-year congressional directed study our experts educate political leaders, caregivers, clinicians, and the general public to provide and improve evidence-based, best practice TBI care for service members, veterans and their families. Learn More about The Senior Research Associate will support several multi-site research projects as part of the Congressionally Mandated 15-Year study to examine outcome from traumatic brain injury in a military population and the effect on family members. S/he will administer and score an objective comprehensive psychological and neuropsychological test battery incorporating pertinent behavioral observations. S/he will conduct comprehensive unstructured and structured diagnostic clinical interviews, and case conference interview data with senior neuropsychology staff. Scores and codes neuropsychological test data and codes interview data.  Primary Responsibilities Include   Conducts comprehensive neuropsychological testing and administers self-report questionnaires, including scoring, coding, and quality checks. Documents behavioral observations and testing notes for consideration in scoring/coding data. Conducts comprehensive diagnostic unstructured and structured clinical interviews and participates in case conferencing of interview data and data coding with senior neuropsychology staff. Documents behavioral observations and testing notes for consideration in scoring/coding data. Conducts medical record reviews for data collection, case conferencing, and eligibility requirements. Collects and analyzes data to evaluate eligibility for enrollment. Offers suggestions for appropriate services for participants as needed. Responds to emergent patient situations. Collects and processes all study related data, assists with data export, data coding, and performs quality control procedures. Completes and maintains paperwork and electronic systems related to participant processing. Maintains research project records in compliance with study and IRB requirements. Maintains clear and accurate records, inventories and logbooks. Communicates with participants, staff, management, directors, and outside collaborators Assists training new staff on study activities and maintaining data collection integrity standards across study procedures and staff. May oversee and supervise junior research staff on study activities.   Non Primary Responsibilities   Other duties consistent with the above  Education  Bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline required. Masters Degree in Psychology, Counseling, or related field preferred.  Must have Human Subjects training completed.    Qualifications   2+ years of clinical experience in neuropsychological test administration and unstructured clinical interviewing preferred. Prior experience assessing traumatic brain injury preferred. Prior experience within the 15-Year TBI Study or DoD/ VA military systems preferred. U.S. Citizenship is required and candidates must be able to obtain a favoravle NACLC/ T3 security investigation prior to starting position. Excellent interpersonal and computer skills; ability to communicate effectively and to work with individuals of all levels. Knowledge of basic counseling skills is preferred for eliciting cooperation from difficult subjects and ability to adapt to change in evaluating subjects of different disability during complex testing modalities. Excellent communication skills to impart complex test and interview results to other professionals. Excellent attention to detail for accurate instrument completion, scoring, and data entry. Must possess interpersonal skills to work effectively with patients and staff. Ability to work comfortably with computer software, including Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.  For more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology has served as a trusted provider of information technology, systems engineering, training and professional services to customers across federal, state, and local governments, and in the commercial sector. Over 40,000 GDIT professionals deliver enterprise solutions, manage mission-critical IT programs and provide mission support services worldwide. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.
