title: Quality Data Analyst
description: [ Responsible for the implementation and support of heart transplant research database application(s), in order to meet the needs and support the data collection of Tufts Medical Center clinical research team members. Main responsibilities included database management and data quality assurance. Will be accountable for planning, design, implementation and management of all data collection. Including the development of data discrepancy management plans and the training and development of database tools for the clinical team.  Responsibilities    Apply detailed knowledge of system functionality to the implementation of the database applications and modules   Use knowledge of user workflow and dataflow to assist users in defining requirements   Use technical and analytical skills to determine best approaches to tailoring system to meet individual requirements   Provide input on build and configuration of systems to meet requirements, using available application tools and working with clinical team members and information systems support   Define and document data handling conventions, edit checks, quality acceptance and auditing criteria for electronic data as well as procedures for handling exceptions. Develop test scenarios based on requirements   Become expert in the use of the heart transplant research database including all querying, reporting and quality of the data   Work with clinical team members to resolve any data entry/data management issues   Use available tools, systems and processes in support of coding medical terminology   Provide technical and professional guidance to less experienced resources as needed   Participate in the development and maintenance of standard operating procedures related to data management activities   Collaborate with vendor support personnel to research and resolve vendor product issues   Participate in cross-training, as a trainer and a learner, for personal development and to ensure adequate secondary coverage on all applications   Participate in the transplant research team process from research study design through analysis (in cooperation with the study PI and statistician) to study publication   Performs additional duties as assigned by manager    Job Knowledge And Skills    Understanding of complex data query creation via Microsoft Access or other applications   Experience with clinical research work designed for manuscript publication(s)   Experience with Database Management System (e.g.: SAS or other statistical program) preferred.   Understanding and experience with up to date MD Windows Operating Systems and applications.   Ability to learn new applications quickly and utilize application tools to tailor system to manage data and meet user requirements   Excellent customer service orientation, including excellent English communication skills (verbal, written and interpersonal)   Flexibility and can-do attitude   A basic understanding of quality measurement and quality improvement methods is favorable   Must be a team player and demonstrate interest in a longer-term role   Passion for supporting applications in a healthcare environment    Requirements  Bachelor's Degree in Nursing, hospital administration, or related management field and/or combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired. Experience with data management systems and familiarity with clinical data analysis and reporting 3+ years of healthcare/medical/ clinical research experience preferred  Strong Technical/analytical Skills Demonstrated Through Prior Data Organizing Experience  An equivalent combination of education and clinical experience, which provides proficiency in the areas of responsibility listed above, may be substituted for the above education and experience requirements.  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Part-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Hospital & Health Care  ]
description_raw:
[
Responsible for the implementation and support of heart transplant research database application(s), in order to meet the needs and support the data collection of Tufts Medical Center clinical research team members. Main responsibilities included database management and data quality assurance. Will be accountable for planning, design, implementation and management of all data collection. Including the development of data discrepancy management plans and the training and development of database tools for the clinical team.

Responsibilities
  • Apply detailed knowledge of system functionality to the implementation of the database applications and modules
  • Use knowledge of user workflow and dataflow to assist users in defining requirements
  • Use technical and analytical skills to determine best approaches to tailoring system to meet individual requirements
  • Provide input on build and configuration of systems to meet requirements, using available application tools and working with clinical team members and information systems support
  • Define and document data handling conventions, edit checks, quality acceptance and auditing criteria for electronic data as well as procedures for handling exceptions. Develop test scenarios based on requirements
  • Become expert in the use of the heart transplant research database including all querying, reporting and quality of the data
  • Work with clinical team members to resolve any data entry/data management issues
  • Use available tools, systems and processes in support of coding medical terminology
  • Provide technical and professional guidance to less experienced resources as needed
  • Participate in the development and maintenance of standard operating procedures related to data management activities
  • Collaborate with vendor support personnel to research and resolve vendor product issues
  • Participate in cross-training, as a trainer and a learner, for personal development and to ensure adequate secondary coverage on all applications
  • Participate in the transplant research team process from research study design through analysis (in cooperation with the study PI and statistician) to study publication
  • Performs additional duties as assigned by manager


Job Knowledge And Skills
  • Understanding of complex data query creation via Microsoft Access or other applications
  • Experience with clinical research work designed for manuscript publication(s)
  • Experience with Database Management System (e.g.: SAS or other statistical program) preferred.
  • Understanding and experience with up to date MD Windows Operating Systems and applications.
  • Ability to learn new applications quickly and utilize application tools to tailor system to manage data and meet user requirements
  • Excellent customer service orientation, including excellent English communication skills (verbal, written and interpersonal)
  • Flexibility and can-do attitude
  • A basic understanding of quality measurement and quality improvement methods is favorable
  • Must be a team player and demonstrate interest in a longer-term role
  • Passion for supporting applications in a healthcare environment


Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Nursing, hospital administration, or related management field and/or combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired.
Experience with data management systems and familiarity with clinical data analysis and reporting
3+ years of healthcare/medical/ clinical research experience preferred

Strong Technical/analytical Skills Demonstrated Through Prior Data Organizing Experience

An equivalent combination of education and clinical experience, which provides proficiency in the areas of responsibility listed above, may be substituted for the above education and experience requirements.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Part-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Hospital & Health Care
]

title: Interdisciplinary Physical Scientist/Chemist - DIRECT HIRE
description: [  Duties Help Duties  Summary  You will service as a Physical Scientist/Chemist in the Office of Hazardous Materials Safety, Offices of Sciences, Engineering and Research, on the Radioactive Materials/Research and Development branch. Learn more about this agency  Responsibilities  If selected, you will serve as a Physical Scientist, Chemist or Engineer in the Engineering and Research Division within the Office of Hazardous Materials Safety (OHMS) of the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) of the Department of Transportation (DOT). You will perform professional tasks directed toward the evaluation of the risks of hazardous materials transport and the development of Federal policy and regulations for domestic and international transportation of hazardous materials by highway, air, rail, and water. You will evaluate, develop and direct basic and applied research and performs a variety of assignments of a conventional nature and broad scope. The assignments require planning, organizing and conducting of a wide range of complex scientific evaluation functions. Your duties will include, but not be limited to, the following:  Provide technical skills and assistance required to support development of regulatory standards, compliance information, and test programs to evaluate the type and degree of hazard involved in the transportation of hazardous materials.  Perform a variety of studies and calculations relating to existing and new packaging systems. This work includes incident data, hazards, failure modes, risk, chemical analysis, chemical and material compatibility analyses, and nondestructive testing.  Review scientific literature, U.S. Hazardous Material Regulations, international hazardous materials standards, and other studies towards comprehensive understanding of the risks and hazards associated with the transport of hazardous materials.  Work closely with other offices reporting to the Associate Administrator for Hazardous Materials Safety, government agencies and industry to support understanding of the Hazardous Materials Regulations (HMR) and promote uniform interpretation and enforcement.   The Ideal Candidate Will  This position is perfect for an individual with a STEM background looking for an opportunity to work in support of an agency whose mission is to manage current and emerging risks inherent in the transportation of hazardous materials.  Possess a strong science background with specialized education or training in engineering, chemistry and/or physics, including properties of chemical substances, interactions of chemical substances and materials, chemical and physical hazards, and basics of hazardous materials safety.  Communicate clearly both verbally and in writing when presenting technical information to varying audiences.  Generate recommendations based on comprehensive technical judgment.  Be open-minded, willing to learn, and a team player.  Be adaptable to working on multiple projects at the same time.  Have extensive experience managing projects and/or programs in a scientific research setting. Travel Required Occasional travel - Some travel is required. Supervisory status No Promotion Potential 13  Job family (Series) 1301 General Physical Science 1320 Chemistry  Requirements Help  Requirements  Conditions of Employment  You must be a U.S. citizen & meet specialized experience to qualify  Submit application and resume online by 11:59 PM EST on the closing date  Review Required Documents Section as documents are required by closing date  Direct Hire Authority will be used to fill this position   Conditions Of Employment   SELECTIVE SERVICE: Males born after 12/31/1959 must be registered for the Selective Service.  PROBATIONARY PERIOD: You must complete a one-year probationary period (unless already completed).   Qualifications  This is an interdisciplinary position, which means that the duties and responsibilities of the position relate to both the Physical Scientist (1301) and Chemist (1320) fields. Because of the interdisciplinary nature of this position, a person with the education and experience in either the 1301 or the 1320 field may be considered equally well qualified to do the work. All applicants must meet the mandatory education requirements of at least one of the series AND the specialized experience of this vacancy in order to qualify.  To Qualify On For The GS-11 On Experience, You Must Have At Least One Year Of Experience Equal Or Equivalent To The GS-09,it Must Include   Experience in applying scientific method, concepts, principles, and practices to perform research, calculations, studies, analysis, or testing.  Experience in oral and written communication presenting results of scientific research, calculations, studies, analysis, test results or recommendations through briefing papers, technical papers, reports, or presentations. To qualify for the GS-11 on Education alone, you must have:  3 years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a Ph.D. degree or Ph.D. or equivalent doctoral degree.  You can also qualify based on a combination of higher level graduate education and experience. This must be fully supported by your resume and transcripts, provided with your application.   To Qualify For The Grade 12, You Must Have At Least One Year Of Experience Equal Or Equivalent To The GS-11 It Must Include   Experience developing technical positions supporting the development of regulatory or industry standards or policies based on scientific knowledge and expertise.  Experience providing technical recommendations or guidance through briefing papers, technical papers, reports or presentations. You cannot qualify on education at this level, you must have experience. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. For additional information about applying to Federal positions, please click on the following link: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-policies/#url=e4 Students enrolled in a qualifying degree program can apply if the anticipated graduation date is within six months of closing date of the announcement. Graduation transcript must be received before start date. Other applicants must meet all qualification requirements by the closing date of this announcement. Education  Physical Scientist  To qualify for this Interdisciplinary Physical Scientist (1301)/Chemist (1320) series (in addition to the specialized experience), you must meet at least one of the following criteria:  Degree: physical science, engineering, or mathematics that included 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science such as mechanics, dynamics, properties of materials, and electronics. or  Combination of education and experience -- education equivalent to one of the majors shown in A above that included at least 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science, plus appropriate experience or additional education.   Chemist   Degree: physical sciences, life sciences, or engineering that included 30 semester hours in chemistry, supplemented by course work in mathematics through differential and integral calculus, and at least 6 semester hours of physics. or  Combination of education and experience -- course work equivalent to a major as shown in A above, including at least 30 semester hours in chemistry, supplemented by mathematics through differential and integral calculus, and at least 6 semester hours of physics, plus appropriate experience or additional education.   Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Research Analyst Information Technology  Industries Biotechnology  ]

You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.
    For additional information about applying to Federal positions, please click on the following link: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-policies/#url=e4
    Students enrolled in a qualifying degree program can apply if the anticipated graduation date is within six months of closing date of the announcement. Graduation transcript must be received before start date.
    Other applicants must meet all qualification requirements by the closing date of this announcement.
    Education

    Physical Scientist

    To qualify for this Interdisciplinary Physical Scientist (1301)/Chemist (1320) series (in addition to the specialized experience), you must meet at least one of the following criteria:

  • Degree: physical science, engineering, or mathematics that included 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science such as mechanics, dynamics, properties of materials, and electronics.
    • or
  • Combination of education and experience -- education equivalent to one of the majors shown in A above that included at least 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science, plus appropriate experience or additional education.

    • Chemist

  • Degree: physical sciences, life sciences, or engineering that included 30 semester hours in chemistry, supplemented by course work in mathematics through differential and integral calculus, and at least 6 semester hours of physics.
    • or
  • Combination of education and experience -- course work equivalent to a major as shown in A above, including at least 30 semester hours in chemistry, supplemented by mathematics through differential and integral calculus, and at least 6 semester hours of physics, plus appropriate experience or additional education.

  • Seniority level

    Associate

    Full-time

    ResearchAnalystInformation Technology

    Biotechnology
]

title: Research Assistant, Science Graduate (Visiting) (Part Time)
description: [  The visiting incumbent of this position will work in the Global Modeling and Assimilation Office at NASA GSFC on the framing and analysis of OSSE experiments that are designed to plan observing strategies appropriate for the Northern high latitudes and Arctic ecosystems. This will include working with GMAO scientists to design scenarios of expected CO2 and CH4 emissions (e.g. permafrost thaw, hydrate release, cold season respiration) for GEOS simulations; analyzing GEOS simulations by comparing with existing satellite and in situ data; and evaluating the impact of new network locations (in situ, airborne assets or remote-sensing capabilities). We expect the visiting scientist to contribute to a peer-reviewed publication describing this work and its outcomes.      The visiting appointment is from February 1, 2020 through June 30, 2020.       Essential Duties/Responsibilities:     Design OSSEs appropriate for planning observing strategies in the Northern high-latitudes and Arctic ecosystems Analyze GEOS output by comparing with satellite and in situ data Evaluate the impact of new network locations in Arctic and Boreal ecosystems Use of MERRA-2 and GEOS modeling system to advance GMAO data assimilation capabilities Engage the academic community, both national and international, in research work through research collaborations, visits, invited guests, workshops, conferences, etc. Develop an awareness of NASA's mission needs and address them to the best of ability. Complete all trainings as required. Other job-related duties as assigned      Required Qualifications:        Education:      MS in Earth Sciences or a related field.        Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:      Expert in arctic and marine ecosystems with a strong background in ecological/climate modeling Must have working experience with analyzing eddy covariance tower data and atmospheric observations of greenhouse gases Knowledge of structured programming languages as well as software packages for data processing and visualization Proficiency in Unix environment; Ability to work with large data files in hdf or netcdf format. Strong capabilities in graphics and animations are highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to carry out research and publish peer-reviewed papers       Technology:      Working knowledge of programming (Fortran) and scripting (Python or other) languages are essential. Knowledge or ability to learn advanced computing techniques in an ESMF environment, with GIThub code management, and OpenMP/MPI coding techniques is essential.     Attributes:     Strong analytical and problem-solving background. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Willingness to learn and improve. Strong team player.     Working Conditions:      Work will be performed in an office or computer lab environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; talk or hear. Keyboarding for large time spans each day may be a significant part of this position.     Applicants should apply to the posting at  https://usracareers.silkroad.com/  and include a letter of interest, resume, or curriculum vita. Additional information on USRA can be found at  www.usra.edu  .      USRA is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity.   Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Part-time  Job function Research Science  Industries Defense & Space  ]
description_raw:
[


The visiting incumbent of this position will work in the Global Modeling and Assimilation Office at NASA GSFC on the framing and analysis of OSSE experiments that are designed to plan observing strategies appropriate for the Northern high latitudes and Arctic ecosystems. This will include working with GMAO scientists to design scenarios of expected CO2 and CH4 emissions (e.g. permafrost thaw, hydrate release, cold season respiration) for GEOS simulations; analyzing GEOS simulations by comparing with existing satellite and in situ data; and evaluating the impact of new network locations (in situ, airborne assets or remote-sensing capabilities). We expect the visiting scientist to contribute to a peer-reviewed publication describing this work and its outcomes.




The visiting appointment is from February 1, 2020 through June 30, 2020.




Essential Duties/Responsibilities:



  • Design OSSEs appropriate for planning observing strategies in the Northern high-latitudes and Arctic ecosystems
  • Analyze GEOS output by comparing with satellite and in situ data
  • Evaluate the impact of new network locations in Arctic and Boreal ecosystems
  • Use of MERRA-2 and GEOS modeling system to advance GMAO data assimilation capabilities
  • Engage the academic community, both national and international, in research work through research collaborations, visits, invited guests, workshops, conferences, etc.
  • Develop an awareness of NASA's mission needs and address them to the best of ability.
  • Complete all trainings as required.
  • Other job-related duties as assigned





Required Qualifications:





Education:



  • MS in Earth Sciences or a related field.






Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:



  • Expert in arctic and marine ecosystems with a strong background in ecological/climate modeling
  • Must have working experience with analyzing eddy covariance tower data and atmospheric observations of greenhouse gases
  • Knowledge of structured programming languages as well as software packages for data processing and visualization
  • Proficiency in Unix environment;
  • Ability to work with large data files in hdf or netcdf format.
  • Strong capabilities in graphics and animations are highly desirable.
  • Demonstrated ability to carry out research and publish peer-reviewed papers




Technology:



  • Working knowledge of programming (Fortran) and scripting (Python or other) languages are essential.
  • Knowledge or ability to learn advanced computing techniques in an ESMF environment, with GIThub code management, and OpenMP/MPI coding techniques is essential.




Attributes:



  • Strong analytical and problem-solving background.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Willingness to learn and improve.
  • Strong team player.




Working Conditions:




Work will be performed in an office or computer lab environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; talk or hear. Keyboarding for large time spans each day may be a significant part of this position.




Applicants should apply to the posting at https://usracareers.silkroad.com/ and include a letter of interest, resume, or curriculum vita. Additional information on USRA can be found at www.usra.edu.




USRA is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Part-time

  • Job function

    ResearchScience

  • Industries

    Defense & Space
]

title: R&D / Data Science Internship - Canada
description: [  About Unilever  Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in more than 190 countries. Working to create a better future every day, we help people feel good, look good and get more out of life. In the United States and Canada, the portfolio includes brand icons such as: Axe, Becel, Ben & Jerry’s, Breyers, Caress, Clear Scalp & Hair Therapy, Consort For Men, Country Crock, Degree, Dove personal care products, Fruttare, Good Humor, Hellmann’s, I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter!, Just for Me!, Klondike, Knorr, Lever 2000, Lipton, Magnum, Motions, Nexxus, Noxzema, Pond’s, Popsicle, Promise, Q-tips, Simple, St. Ives, Suave, TIGI, TONI&GUY Hair Meet Wardrobe, TRESemmé and Vaseline. All of the preceding brand names are trademarks or registered trademarks of the Unilever Group of Companies. Our ambition is to double the size of our business, while reducing our overall environmental footprint (including sourcing, consumer use and disposal) and increasing our positive social impact. We are committed to helping more than a billion people take action to improve their health and well-being, sourcing all our agricultural raw materials sustainably by 2020, and decoupling our growth from our environmental impact. Supporting our three big goals, we have defined seven pillars, underpinned by targets encompassing social, environmental and economic areas. See more on the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan at http://www.unileverusa.com/sustainable-living/ or http://www.unilever.ca/sustainable-living/ . Unilever employs approximately 11,500 people across North America – generating more than $10 billion in sales in 2014. For more information, visit www.unileverusa.com or www.unilever.ca  Unilever offers numerous exciting career paths within R&D. Creating new innovations and technologies, and enhancing our existing brand portfolio – it’s all yours in Unilever’s R&D function. Bring your imagination and technical expertise to help develop superior products in an ever-evolving consumer marketplace.  STATISTICS & DATA SCIENCE INTERN   A R&D Statistician / Data Scientist Intern Will Be Focused In One Of Two Areas And Will Be Expected To Conduct The Following Activities As Part Of a Team   Apply Data Visualization, Machine Learning, Text Mining, Statistics, Big Data Analytics, or Predictive Modeling as applied to clinical and/or biological systems or formula and material science  Generate, compile and present analytics based on specific project assignment, including analysis and reporting  Work with cross functional teams (i.e. formulation, clinical science, consumer science, bioscience) as project requires  Maintain a safe working environment in laboratory and assigned work space.    Requirements   CANDIDATES MUST BE LEGALLY AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE U.S.  Masters or PhD. Student with significant coursework or major in Statistics, Biostatistics, Bio-informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Industrial Engineering.  Baseline level of statistical thinking required for all candidates  Must have experience writing statistics-focused scripts using R, SAS, Python, or similar programs (e.g., JMP)  In addition, there are two types of candidates we are looking for to work specific projects in the Research & Development team:   Consumer Insights – multivariate analysis, regression analysis, text mining, visualization of high dimensional data  Clinical / Biosciences – at least 1 year of statistical theory / methods and fundamental understanding of simulation approaches   Willing and able to work as part of a team and also to think and act independently with minimal guidance  Willing and able to learn to explain technically-sophisticated methods to a non-technical audience   Unposting Date  Ongoing  Schedule  Full-time  Primary Location  Canada-Ontario-Toronto  Shift  Day Job  Job  Research/Development  Travel  No  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Education Training  Industries Consumer Goods Food & Beverages Food Production  ]

[
About Unilever

Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in more than 190 countries. Working to create a better future every day, we help people feel good, look good and get more out of life. In the United States and Canada, the portfolio includes brand icons such as: Axe, Becel, Ben & Jerry’s, Breyers, Caress, Clear Scalp & Hair Therapy, Consort For Men, Country Crock, Degree, Dove personal care products, Fruttare, Good Humor, Hellmann’s, I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter!, Just for Me!, Klondike, Knorr, Lever 2000, Lipton, Magnum, Motions, Nexxus, Noxzema, Pond’s, Popsicle, Promise, Q-tips, Simple, St. Ives, Suave, TIGI, TONI&GUY Hair Meet Wardrobe, TRESemmé and Vaseline. All of the preceding brand names are trademarks or registered trademarks of the Unilever Group of Companies.

Our ambition is to double the size of our business, while reducing our overall environmental footprint (including sourcing, consumer use and disposal) and increasing our positive social impact. We are committed to helping more than a billion people take action to improve their health and well-being, sourcing all our agricultural raw materials sustainably by 2020, and decoupling our growth from our environmental impact. Supporting our three big goals, we have defined seven pillars, underpinned by targets encompassing social, environmental and economic areas. See more on the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan at http://www.unileverusa.com/sustainable-living/ or http://www.unilever.ca/sustainable-living/.

Unilever employs approximately 11,500 people across North America – generating more than $10 billion in sales in 2014. For more information, visit www.unileverusa.com or www.unilever.ca

Unilever offers numerous exciting career paths within R&D. Creating new innovations and technologies, and enhancing our existing brand portfolio – it’s all yours in Unilever’s R&D function. Bring your imagination and technical expertise to help develop superior products in an ever-evolving consumer marketplace.

STATISTICS & DATA SCIENCE INTERN

A R&D Statistician / Data Scientist Intern Will Be Focused In One Of Two Areas And Will Be Expected To Conduct The Following Activities As Part Of a Team
  • Apply Data Visualization, Machine Learning, Text Mining, Statistics, Big Data Analytics, or Predictive Modeling as applied to clinical and/or biological systems or formula and material science
  • Generate, compile and present analytics based on specific project assignment, including analysis and reporting
  • Work with cross functional teams (i.e. formulation, clinical science, consumer science, bioscience) as project requires
  • Maintain a safe working environment in laboratory and assigned work space.


Requirements
  • CANDIDATES MUST BE LEGALLY AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE U.S.
  • Masters or PhD. Student with significant coursework or major in Statistics, Biostatistics, Bio-informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Industrial Engineering.
  • Baseline level of statistical thinking required for all candidates
  • Must have experience writing statistics-focused scripts using R, SAS, Python, or similar programs (e.g., JMP)
  • In addition, there are two types of candidates we are looking for to work specific projects in the Research & Development team:
  • Consumer Insights – multivariate analysis, regression analysis, text mining, visualization of high dimensional data
  • Clinical / Biosciences – at least 1 year of statistical theory / methods and fundamental understanding of simulation approaches
  • Willing and able to work as part of a team and also to think and act independently with minimal guidance
  • Willing and able to learn to explain technically-sophisticated methods to a non-technical audience

description_raw:
[
Job Description

Job Title: Data Science Researcher 2
Location: San Jose, CA
Duration: 18 months

Summary

The Document Cloud Insights & Analytics team is looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about using big data to deliver phenomenal customer experiences and to inform business decisions. You¹ll develop algorithms that analyze and derive insights from our massive product usage dataset, working in collaboration with product managers, researchers, and engineering teams.

Responsibilities
  • Identify opportunities for business impact based on user behavior and usage patterns correlated with higher engagement and retention.
  • Using data and analytics, drive experiment design to help the Document Cloud CSMB teams focus on key opportunity areas for Acrobat, Sign, and Mobile.
  • Understand usage patterns and core value proposition leveraging advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, data mining or deep learning techniques.
  • Partner with various engagement and experience teams to understand measurement requirements, help define them into Key Performance Indicators and drive delivery of in-depth analytics and visualizations to partner teams.
  • Develop and implement algorithms for cleaning, integrating, and evaluating large datasets from multiple disparate sources.
  • Answer questions arising from the product teams and perform independent, exploratory data analyses to deliver insight to the product teams
  • Support regular ad-hoc data and analysis needs to better understand customer behaviors. Support teams in running growth programs and A/B tests through analyzing results and communicating learnings and insights.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of experience with a bachelor¹s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Applied Math, Econometrics, Operations Research, or related field.
  • Expert level understanding of machine learning techniques and their real-world applications.
  • Expert level understanding in statistical modelling. Strong proficiency in querying, manipulating and analyzing large data sets using SQL and/or SQL-like languages.
  • Experience performing quantitative analysis of large data sets; using SQL.
  • Experience with big data techniques (Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark) and querying tools (such as Hive, Pig, Impala).
  • A deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms.
  • Proficiency in Java or Python, and R
  • Experience with one or more data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, MicroStrategy etc
  • Strong business acumen, excellent communication, relationship skills, and a great team player.
  • Good attention to detail and the ability to stitch and QA multiple data sources

  • Seniority level

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Other

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareFinancial Services
]

description_raw:
[
Job Description

TITLE: Health Care Data Analyst 1 – Professional/Exempt

JOB SUMMARY: The health care data analyst is responsible for producing reports on clinical performance measures, focused clinical studies and patient satisfaction measures in a manner which translates most effectively into information for decision-making toward improved clinical care processes and clinical, service and financial outcomes.

ROLE: See job description for Administrative Partner

AREA OF ASSIGNMENT : Outcomes Management

HOURS OF WORK : Monday-Friday, 0800-1630 with limited requirements for flexible hours.

RESPONSIBLE TO : Director Outcomes Management

Pre-requisites
  • Minimum associate degree in health care field or equivalent preferably in Health Information Management, a clinical field or healthcare informatics.
  • Minimum 2 years recent employment in acute health care setting preferred.


Qualifications
  • Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite particularly Excel and Access.
  • Ability to design and implement systems necessary to collect, analyze, report and file data.
  • Proficiency in use of Excel’s Analysis Tool Kit and QI Macros or equivalent statistical analysis software.
  • Ability to generate reports from various software programs and databases.
  • Ability to use quantitative and qualitative data in performance measurement.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality of data and information as required.
  • Requires planning, organizing and working on multiple tasks at one time.
  • Requires deep concentration for a large volume of work that must be completed within a limited period of time to meet deadlines for reporting.

UNIQUE PHYSICAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKING CONDITIONS: See Generic Job Description/Administrative Partner

Performance Responsibilies

  • Generic Job Functions: See Generic Job Description/Administrative Partner

  • Unique Job Functions:
    • Support the organization-wide quality management, patient safety and performance improvement program through retrieval, analysis and reporting of data internally and externally in accordance with regulatory requirements and organization-wide standards.
    • Produce reports and information as requested within established time frames.
    • Develop and maintain competency in clinical decision support systems (including but not limited to 3M, STAR, Medstat: Performance Expert and Core Measures, Q-Net Exchange).
    • Identify and report variations in clinical care that require immediate follow-through.
    • Utilize various software applications for data collection, analysis and reporting.
    • Perform other duties as assigned.

    • Seniority level

      Entry level

    • Employment type

      Full-time

    • Job function

      Information Technology

    • Industries

      Hospital & Health Care
    ]

title: Field Application Scientist, Cellular Imaging and Analysis
description: [  Job Details  Job Opportunity PerkinElmer is looking for a motivated, successful and experienced field application scientist to scientifically represent our company. As a cellular imaging and analysis subject matter expert, you will be managing vital scientific relationships with users of our high content screening solutions. You will work collaboratively with a team of highly experienced scientists to give application-centric presentations, provide advanced instrument training and assist customers with experimental design and troubleshooting their imaging studies. If you like staying intellectually challenged and engaging with scientists in academia, biotech and pharma, then this is an ideal opportunity for you. What we provide We provide our customers with critical knowledge, expertise and innovative detection, imaging, software, and services solutions so that they can make better decisions for better research outcomes. At PerkinElmer, we make a difference everyday – helping scientists, clinicians and governments detect earlier and more accurately to improve the health and safety of people and the environment. Our solutions range from enabling the discovery of more effective diagnostics and therapies, to making sure that the food we eat, the water we drink, and our environment are safe from contaminants. Our Team The PerkinElmer Cellular Imaging and Analysis team is one of the fastest growing teams within our organization. We offer cutting edge solutions for automated microscopy and data analytics. Our instrumentation is represented globally by over 3,500 peer reviewed publications. The Field Applications Scientist team works in concert with our integrated sales team to provide the optimal PerkinElmer solution to meet the research scope and vision for our customers. We seek a motivated, independent, and entrepreneurial minded individual to leverage the existing momentum to further drive expansion of our imaging portfolio in the mid Atlantic and South East. How you will contribute Support cellular imaging solution sales which can include presentations, and demonstrations of our instruments and software. Provide post sales application support and training. Develop a strong, working knowledge of our high content imaging portfolio and scientific applications. Knowledge of imaging and analysis will be key to successful customer outcomes. Work closely with product managers, marketing teams and application teams to develop and maintain pre-sales and post-sales presentation and training material. Attend and present data at local tradeshows as requested. Help with lead generation for both commercial and academic accounts Present a professional image at all times to customers, clients and other vendors. What you’ll bring to the table MS or PhD (preferred) in a scientific discipline or equivalent experience as a Field Application Scientist Proven track record of experience in cell based assays, imaging and molecular biology. Knowledge of fluorescence and confocal microscopy is ideal. Knowledge of broad range of high content imaging and analysis and applications is preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication, negotiating and presentation skills. Ability to work effectively independently and within a team environment. Willingness for 50-75% overnight travel.  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Research Analyst Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[

Job Details

Job Opportunity

PerkinElmer is looking for a motivated, successful and experienced field application scientist to scientifically represent our company. As a cellular imaging and analysis subject matter expert, you will be managing vital scientific relationships with users of our high content screening solutions. You will work collaboratively with a team of highly experienced scientists to give application-centric presentations, provide advanced instrument training and assist customers with experimental design and troubleshooting their imaging studies. If you like staying intellectually challenged and engaging with scientists in academia, biotech and pharma, then this is an ideal opportunity for you.

What we provide

We provide our customers with critical knowledge, expertise and innovative detection, imaging, software, and services solutions so that they can make better decisions for better research outcomes. At PerkinElmer, we make a difference everyday – helping scientists, clinicians and governments detect earlier and more accurately to improve the health and safety of people and the environment. Our solutions range from enabling the discovery of more effective diagnostics and therapies, to making sure that the food we eat, the water we drink, and our environment are safe from contaminants.

Our Team

The PerkinElmer Cellular Imaging and Analysis team is one of the fastest growing teams within our organization. We offer cutting edge solutions for automated microscopy and data analytics. Our instrumentation is represented globally by over 3,500 peer reviewed publications. The Field Applications Scientist team works in concert with our integrated sales team to provide the optimal PerkinElmer solution to meet the research scope and vision for our customers. We seek a motivated, independent, and entrepreneurial minded individual to leverage the existing momentum to further drive expansion of our imaging portfolio in the mid Atlantic and South East.

How you will contribute

Support cellular imaging solution sales which can include presentations, and demonstrations of our instruments and software.
Provide post sales application support and training.
Develop a strong, working knowledge of our high content imaging portfolio and scientific applications. Knowledge of imaging and analysis will be key to successful customer outcomes.
Work closely with product managers, marketing teams and application teams to develop and maintain pre-sales and post-sales presentation and training material.
Attend and present data at local tradeshows as requested.
Help with lead generation for both commercial and academic accounts
Present a professional image at all times to customers, clients and other vendors.
What you’ll bring to the table

MS or PhD (preferred) in a scientific discipline or equivalent experience as a Field Application Scientist
Proven track record of experience in cell based assays, imaging and molecular biology. Knowledge of fluorescence and confocal microscopy is ideal.
Knowledge of broad range of high content imaging and analysis and applications is preferred.
Excellent written and verbal communication, negotiating and presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively independently and within a team environment.
Willingness for 50-75% overnight travel.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    ResearchAnalystInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareFinancial Services
]

title: Staff Data Scientist - NLP
description: [  Position Description  As the Walmart Voice Commerce team we are building completely new capabilities to allow our customers to shop by seamlessly interacting with their connected devices using spoken language. This team is part of the Growth organization and will build new voice experiences both in-house and in collaboration with strategic partners. Voice as a medium for shopping is still in its infancy and as part of this team you will get to work on industry leading solutions and be at the forefront of this emerging platform. You will get to part of defining how customers shop in everyday lives.  Minimum Qualifications   Ph. D. in computer science or similar field or MS with 3+ years of related experience Deep knowledge of machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, statistics, NLP or related field. Good functional coding skills in C++, Java, Scala in addition to good knowledge of one of the scripting languages such as Python or Perl. Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark etc.) Superior ability to analyze and interpret the results of product experiments. Proven experience working with statistical languages such as R. Strong communication skills both written and verbal   Additional Preferred Qualifications   Knowledge of Spark, Scikit-learn, Problem solving, Willing to learn new technologies. Self-starter, Quick learner, Keen observer, eye for detail and someone who relishes challenges Strong research and publication record   Company Summary  The Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the world’s largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.  Position Summary  As the Walmart Voice Commerce team we are building completely new capabilities to allow our customers to shop by seamlessly interacting with their connected devices using spoken language. [
Position Description

As the Walmart Voice Commerce team we are building completely new capabilities to allow our customers to shop by seamlessly interacting with their connected devices using spoken language. This team is part of the Growth organization and will build new voice experiences both in-house and in collaboration with strategic partners. Voice as a medium for shopping is still in its infancy and as part of this team you will get to work on industry leading solutions and be at the forefront of this emerging platform. You will get to part of defining how customers shop in everyday lives.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Ph. D. in computer science or similar field or MS with 3+ years of related experience
  • Deep knowledge of machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, statistics, NLP or related field.
  • Good functional coding skills in C++, Java, Scala in addition to good knowledge of one of the scripting languages such as Python or Perl.
  • Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark etc.)
  • Superior ability to analyze and interpret the results of product experiments.
  • Proven experience working with statistical languages such as R.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal

Additional Preferred Qualifications
  • Knowledge of Spark, Scikit-learn, Problem solving, Willing to learn new technologies.
  • Self-starter, Quick learner, Keen observer, eye for detail and someone who relishes challenges
  • Strong research and publication record

Company Summary

The Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the world’s largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.

Position Summary

As the Walmart Voice Commerce team we are building completely new capabilities to allow our customers to shop by seamlessly interacting with their connected devices using spoken language. This team is part of the Growth organization and will build new voice experiences both in-house and in collaboration with strategic partners. Voice as a medium for shopping is still in its infancy and as part of this team you will get to work on industry leading solutions and be at the forefront of this emerging platform. You will get to part of defining how customers shop in everyday lives.

title: Big Data Engineer
description: [ Wicresoft is hiring a lead technical consultant on big data engineering, with exceptional experiences from architect to implementation. The job assignment will be on-site of a name-brand public company located in Seattle.  Job Overview  You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support client's software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.  Main Responsibilities   Maintain optimal data pipeline architecture.  Assemble complex data sets that meet functional or non-functional business requirements.  Manage Azure or AWS Data Pipeline for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.  Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into key business performance metrics.  Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.  Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.  Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.   Qualifications   Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.  Experience building and optimizing AWS Data Pipeline or Azure , architectures and data sets.  Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.  Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.  Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.  A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.  Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.  Experience with big data tools: Spark , Kafka, Hadoop, etc.  Experience with Azure or AWS Data Pipeline, and cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift  Experience with Python, C#, etc.  - provided by Dice  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Pharmaceuticals  ]
description_raw:
[
Wicresoft is hiring a lead technical consultant on big data engineering, with exceptional experiences from architect to implementation. The job assignment will be on-site of a name-brand public company located in Seattle.

Job Overview

You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

The Data Engineer will support client's software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.

Main Responsibilities
  • Maintain optimal data pipeline architecture.
  • Assemble complex data sets that meet functional or non-functional business requirements.
  • Manage Azure or AWS Data Pipeline for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
  • Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into key business performance metrics.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Qualifications
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Experience building and optimizing AWS Data Pipeline or Azure, architectures and data sets.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
  • Experience with big data tools: Spark, Kafka, Hadoop, etc.
  • Experience with Azure or AWS Data Pipeline, and cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Experience with Python, C#, etc.
- provided by Dice

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwarePharmaceuticals
]

title: Senior Data Scientist - Boston
description: [  Senior Data Scientist  Are you interested in a role that offers you the opportunity to consult some of the top Fortune 500 firms in the nation make the best decisions when it comes to their data environments? We are a well-known data consulting shop looking to bring on a Senior Data Engineer to interact with industry agnostic clients to help them build out cutting edge data structures and distributed systems. They’re looking for someone who has worked with a variety of NoSQL databases, ideally someone with some sort of Spark exposure, as well as someone who is very confident and comfortable in a client facing role. This role offers a lot of ownership and impact and would require up to 40-50% travel nationwide.  Required Skills & Experience   3+ years working with large data sets  Java, Python, or Scala  Data warehouses, ETL, BI  Strong SQL and NoSQL experience  Previous consulting or client facing experience  Ability to interact with both technical and nontechnical stakeholders   Desired Skills & Experience   AWS, GCP, etc.  Hadoop, Spark, EMR  AWS Redshift  Data pipelining (Kafka, etc)  Exposure to analytics  Strong understanding of Information Security  Bachelors or Masters Degree   What You Will Be Doing   60% Data Engineering  40% Requirements Gathering/Client Facing  Travel Required   The Offer   Competitive Salary: Up to $80-130k/year, DOE   You Will Receive The Following Benefits   Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)  401(k) with company match  Paid Sick Time Leave  Pre-tax Commuter Benefit  Causal work setting  Extensive training  Full travel accommodations  Generous Bonuses  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. This position does not offer sponsorship. Workbridge Associates, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) across 11 major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today’s highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Other  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Senior Data Scientist

Are you interested in a role that offers you the opportunity to consult some of the top Fortune 500 firms in the nation make the best decisions when it comes to their data environments? We are a well-known data consulting shop looking to bring on a Senior Data Engineer to interact with industry agnostic clients to help them build out cutting edge data structures and distributed systems. They’re looking for someone who has worked with a variety of NoSQL databases, ideally someone with some sort of Spark exposure, as well as someone who is very confident and comfortable in a client facing role. This role offers a lot of ownership and impact and would require up to 40-50% travel nationwide.

Required Skills & Experience
  • 3+ years working with large data sets
  • Java, Python, or Scala
  • Data warehouses, ETL, BI
  • Strong SQL and NoSQL experience
  • Previous consulting or client facing experience
  • Ability to interact with both technical and nontechnical stakeholders
Desired Skills & Experience
  • AWS, GCP, etc.
  • Hadoop, Spark, EMR
  • AWS Redshift
  • Data pipelining (Kafka, etc)
  • Exposure to analytics
  • Strong understanding of Information Security
  • Bachelors or Masters Degree
What You Will Be Doing
  • 60% Data Engineering
  • 40% Requirements Gathering/Client Facing
  • Travel Required

  • Competitive Salary: Up to $80-130k/year, DOE

  • Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)

title: Data Scientist
description: [  Data Scientist X is Alphabet’s moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, world-changing ideas are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. For X to be successful, we have to repeatedly turn breakthrough technology ideas into products that solve large problems in the world, and create meaningful businesses for Alphabet.  Responsibilities   Formulate questions in ways that allow one to design an experiment and build statistical models to test the validity of a hypothesis / infer causal relationships / make predictions.  Extract large data sets, use statistical programming languages like Python / R for modelling. Use visualisation dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings & iterate quickly to solve problems.  Work with cross-functional internal / external stakeholders including Engineering and Product to support a broad spectrum of data analysis needs and guide decision making.    Minimum Qualifications   Masters degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or equivalent practical experience  In-depth knowledge of statistical modelling / bayesian hierarchical modelling and statistical computation using Python / R  Demonstrated ability to self-manage, take initiative, problem-solve, and navigate through ambiguity.    Preferred Qualifications   PhD degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or related field  Knowledge of the latest research in statistical / ML algorithms  Experience with modelling of environmental / agricultural / quantitative genetics problems    About X, The Moonshot Factory  X creates radical new technologies to solve some of the world’s biggest problems. We develop uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers, designers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x] and is part of Alphabet  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Data Scientist
X is Alphabet’s moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, world-changing ideas are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. For X to be successful, we have to repeatedly turn breakthrough technology ideas into products that solve large problems in the world, and create meaningful businesses for Alphabet.

Responsibilities
  • Formulate questions in ways that allow one to design an experiment and build statistical models to test the validity of a hypothesis / infer causal relationships / make predictions.
  • Extract large data sets, use statistical programming languages like Python / R for modelling. Use visualisation dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings & iterate quickly to solve problems.
  • Work with cross-functional internal / external stakeholders including Engineering and Product to support a broad spectrum of data analysis needs and guide decision making.


Minimum Qualifications
  • Masters degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • In-depth knowledge of statistical modelling / bayesian hierarchical modelling and statistical computation using Python / R
  • Demonstrated ability to self-manage, take initiative, problem-solve, and navigate through ambiguity.


Preferred Qualifications
  • PhD degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or related field
  • Knowledge of the latest research in statistical / ML algorithms
  • Experience with modelling of environmental / agricultural / quantitative genetics problems


About X, The Moonshot Factory

X creates radical new technologies to solve some of the world’s biggest problems. We develop uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers, designers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x] and is part of Alphabet
